reviewText: I read many reviews and I had doubts but I ordered it because it seemed perfect for me because I'm a side sleeper and don't like the regular travel pillows.  I was so disappointed that it was defective. I tried to inflate it and the small black ring that holds the pink valve in place came off and then the pink valve disappeared inside the pillow. I found it at the far end and worked it back to the opening. I tried and couldn't reinstall the black ring and without the valve held in place, the air escaped immediately. Great idea - just not manufactured very well. It's being returned today. I ordered it Tuesday and received it Wednesday. Delivery is great. Wish the product was too.

This design is really pretty and look great on the table. They work like they are supposed to and I'm really happy with the purchase. I've bought another brand that did not hold up but these seem really solid.

Love the ease of chopping into a container.  Container also doubles as serving dish and comes with a storage lid.  Dishwasher safe.  Cons:  It is large...so for 2 people maybe too big.  My other con..it comes with 2 chopping blades which are extra large and large..wish it came with a small/smaller chopping blade as somethimes we like our vegies or fruit in smaller chunks.  Also, be careful when removing chopping blades as it is easy to cut yourself...they are sharp.

Bought this for my wife who has been hounding me for years to get her a cast iron pot. Food stuck and burned the tirst time she used it, but she loved it. Guess there's a learning curve for cast iron, but no curve for feeling. Great product for satisfying the wife.
I'm glad I bought this, I needed something to hold all my flour and this works great.  Heavy duty and doesn't take up a lot of space.  Highly recommend for those of you with little space.

I like the versatility of this cup/bowl. Great for soup, cereal, or a big cup of tea. I like that they are dishwasher safe and I like the way they hold up in the oven with my favorite French Onion Soup. delicious!

We have one of these big tea balls from years ago and have been looking for this size everywhere. those smaller ones just can not hold cinnamon sticks and other spices for our homemade hot cider and this can much easier. picked up a few of these for stocking stuffers

They are a pain to get on and once on do a decent job but still didn't keep our sheets as nice as I'd of hoped. All in all I'd probably buy again because they do help a bit and they weren't to expensive compared to some.

The tortillas kept sliding off the rack during baking, so I came up with my own way of cooking the shells. I finally decided to dip my corn tortillas in oil, microwave them till soft, place them on a cold rack and weighed the top down with a cookie sheet with a little oil on the area that topped the shells to avoid sticking. The rack was placed inside a jelly roll pan to catch drips. I also baked them longer, about 15 minutes. This was with a brand called La Tortilla Factory which is a more homemade style of tortilla. They came out semi-crisp which is what I prefer. If you baked the shells longer you can probably get the super crispy shell.

I was a little disappointed when the pan arrived. It isn't heavy like the other Nordic Ware pans I own. I used some Crisco on the inside of the pan, and worked it in with a pastry brush. I used a boxed cake mix to make pineapple upside down cake. There was enough batter left over to make some cupcakes. The cake turned out great. This pan is thin and light, but it works.

Three stars, because when it was delivered one of the poles that you hang your clothes on was missing.  I didn't realize this until I had already started putting the rack together.  I know I should have inventoried all the pieces first, but I was in a rush to use it.  It never occurred to me that such a large piece would be missing.  It seems like it was a decent rack, but never actually got to use it.
This unit spilled gallons of water all over our antique wood floors and ruined it.  It caused thousands in damage.  I would pay to get rid of it.
A mortar and pestle are necessary for any home cook that likes breaking down fresh spices or things like garlic.
It works well and validates that my oven heats slower than most. I've already dropped the thermometer, without any ill affect.

Got a special deal from Macy's I could not refuse, seventeen bucks.Nice sturdy looking unit and well engineered. I disconnected my gas and have been using micro for everything. Works for most foods but this looks more perfect for breakfast. Will check back after a few usages. Says it is easyclean with uniform heat, we shall see. Mostly great reviews and product has been out for some time.

I like this product!  Because the holes in it are so close together, I feel like it drains better and faster than my old plastic colander.  Since it is stainless steel, it also doesn't melt like my old plastic colander.On the down side, it could be a bit more rigid.  I believe that the trade off of having so many holes so close together is that it does not have the rigidity that other colanders have.  In my estimation if you are really rough on your colander, you might want to consider something else.

This versatile and well-made collapsible colander is a godsend in our small boat galley.  We cook a lot of fresh veggies and make a lot of salads while aboard our boat, so a colander for washing produce is essential.  With this product, I no longer have to sacrifice way more space than I want to in order to keep a large enough colander at hand.
summary: Another winner for the space-deprived cook

reviewText: This is a great price on an ok set of cutting boards.  Lets start with this, you wont use the little board unless you like having cheese parties or something of the sort.  Its too small for anything else.  The mid size board is useful for making a sandwich or something along those lines.  The largest of the three is the 'real' cutting board.I purchased this set as a quick replacement for an expensive John Boos cutting board that was ruined by a leaky faucet.  Wasnt really in the mood to spend $100 on another one, so I opted for a cheapo cutting board in the interim.  I was pleasantly suprised by these.First - use a wood or plastic cutting board, dont ruin your knives on a glass cutting board.  I know, these are wood, but I had to just throw that out there in case you were considering a glass option.Wood will cut 'faster' than plastic, meaning it will be easier to cut on a wood board.  Plastic will be easier to clean and sanitize afterward, plus you dont have to worry about warping or cracking.  I still prefer wood, and use the plastic board liners when Im cutting raw food with bacteria hazards, like chicken.These boards arrive oily.  Took a good cleaning to get the oily feeling off.  Im sure it was food safe oil, but Id still rather not eat it.  They are light weight for cutting boards too.  This can be useful if you prefer to keep them stored instead of constantly on your counter top.These are not 'end cut' boards, so they will be more likely to split and warp than some others.  For the price though, noone would expect otherwise.Overall, I was pleasantly suprised by these.  They were flat, smooth, and finished well.  The largest board is about the right size for an 8" Chef Knife and able to accomodate a good sized roast.  The smaller boards are pretty limited on their usefulness, Id say more for presentation than funtion; like serving whole loaf bread or cheeses that will be cut and served at the table.Just for reference, these are not the same quality you get with a high end Butcher Block type cutting board, but for the price these cannot go wrong.
summary: Great price on ok cutting board

reviewText: I like the unadorned simplicity of this one-piece pasta fork.  No assembly required.  It forks my pasta like it oughta!

I have been sleeping with a body pillow for about 13 years now and this is by far the best one for me.  It is very firm and feels great between my knees and to lay on.  Other body pillows just flatten out and I don't see that happening with this body pillow.  It is heavy but I like that heaviness.
Maybe I got a dud -- this is a great, very comfortable pillow but it gets just as warm as my regular pillow. I wish it did adjust to my body temp -- that would be terrific!

I'm in agreement with the other reviewers.  The edge of this spatula has melted and I can remove the excess with my thumbnail.  Yuck!  This spatula was actually a free replacement for an older one that had done the same thing.  (Oxo is very good about standing behind their products.)  However, it is odd that they sent me something with the same innate flaw.  I should have been told that ALL nylon spatulas will melt!  They should discontinue making them or specify to be used ONLY where NO HEAT is involved.  But what tasks would that include?
Great product.
Fits perfectly on the door under my sink! Thin profile doesn't interfere with anything else I have under there. Love it.

When I first washed these towels (white) there was so much lint in my washer and dryer and lint trap, more than I've had for any other new towels I've used before. So I put them through the wash again...more lint.  I didn't want to towel off and have lint all over me, so I said I'd put them through one more time and in my head I was thinking these are crap towels I'm going to just use them for the dogs outside.But after that third wash, what was left was really nice, soft, thick towels that I especially like using on my face. The big ones are nice for drying the body off, but are too thick and heavy for effectively wrapping my hair up in.They do feel really good against the skin.The care instructions say wash in cold water and I wash my towels in hot water. After many washings they are holding up well.  I also dry hot so maybe I'm ruining the towels, but so far they are ok.*Care Instructions: Wash before use. Wash separately with like colors, gentle cycle.  Machine wash cold water, do not bleach.  Do not wring or twist.  Tumble dry low heat or line dry in shade. May expect changes in size.  Do not iron. Made in Mexico.
I got this because I purchased a french press. Fresh ground beans are so much better than pre-ground  coffee. This is a really good, cheap grinder.

When I turn the grill on it is on 300 like the instructions say it should be and it's set for 5 minutes I can decrease or increase the minutes but the temperature I can only increase and the instructions say to cook hamburgers , steak, fish at 160 or 170...Well I went ahead and threw my little baby filet mignon steaks and they cooked up just like my old grill of 10 years there were no complaints from my girls but then they never complain about any people food...I may have cooked it just a minute or two longer than necessary cause I thought my steak ended up a bit dry and tuff but that's an easy enough adjustment you always have to make an adjustment but it just annoys me that I can't set the temperature lower...I'm so tired of having to return what seems like every other thing I purchase from Amazon.com...

Probably.  This food processor is very powerful and will definitely dice your hand if you put it in there.Keep in mind that seven cups is a lot smaller than it seems.  I found this out when I decided to make a soup with all the squash that my CSA kept giving me.... if it is in liquid form and exceeds the height of the blade mechanism, then it will seep up and through the middle of the processor and spill everywhere out the base area.  If you want to make puree's or soups, you'll need something bigger.  This is made simply for chopping and maybe some small blending.Normally, this chops anything I throw in there to a very fine texture.  Leave it in there for longer and it comes to a chunky liquified form... good for making curry pastes or healthy spreads.  Every so often when I put a big chunk of garlic or a wedge of bell pepper, it will either get stuck under a blade or skip on the top for a while, making the bits inconsistent in size.  With a little poking, it'll be fine.  The lock in mechanism is very innovative, and the processor will not turn on unless this is locked in place.  It is made almost idiot proof, so you can't really turn it on and stick your hand in at the same time.Cleanup is relatively easy.  If you use a dishwasher, all the components can be taken apart with ease and thrown into a dishwasher.  I don't have one, so it's a bit trickier to wash by hand only because of the smaller areas, (the lock mechanism, the center tube, etc)  I don't use it all the time, but it is very nice to take out and push down a lever and watch stuff chop.I have limited experience with blenders and processors.  I have a hand-me-down blender that works amazing (old stuff was made to last) and this is my first processor.  The price seems high to me, but I really don't know if that's the norm or not.  Seems like a lot if you don't use it that often as I do.  But if you plan to use it a few times a week, it is probably a safe buy.  Just keep in mind it's not really for liquids and you should be right as rain.

my first impression of this stock pot,  all i have done is wash the pot so far and fill it with water to see what level and weight it has. it is very shinny on the out side. in time that might change since i dont handle my pots with kid gloves. the interrior is all one piece with a smooth roll at the bottom. it makes me think that it will clean well without having a sharp edge d to have to scrub.  water poured out of it well with very little driippage form the rolled top edge. the lid wont be used but it fit well on the inside of the pot. i like that it is glass and i can see what it happening inside without having to let the steam out. if it were steaming it would probable keep most if the steam and water inside of the pot. the handles are securely attached with rivets. looks like they will hold up to a full pots weight without distorting the shape of the pot or breaking off. very flat bottom to keep contact on the glasstop stove. with the thicker bottom i might be able to keep a more even temperature across the whole pot. the bottom is a seperate piece added to the pot. no seperation big enough to get food or moisture in. instructions tell you how to clean the pot. not rocket science. it is a cooking pot.

Have been using small throw away salt and pepper grinders from the store and wanted refillable one's. Could not find any at all of the local big name box stores. Amazon to the rescue... Bought 2 sets and they come filled and ready to use. Just need to remember that the grinder is on the top so turn them over and turn to bottom to use them. They also have 5 different grind settings so you can set the grind to your liking. Our family just love them and cheaper than a years worth of throw away grinders from the big W store.
This was a great solution to use beside the shower chair for my partner recovering from a stroke.  It puts the soap and shampoo at the right height, and holds them both

Unless something is really wrong with measuring cups, I'm not sure how much there is to say.  These measuring cups are as easy to use as any others.  The one thing I didn't like about them is that it's hard to get them on and off the ring that is supposed to hold them.  Other than that, I haven't had any troubles using them.
great product to have.  so useful over and over.  sits on counter nicely and attractive in the kitchen also. nice price.

Nice little slow cooker for the money.  Great for 2-3. Even 4 depending on what's being cooked.BEWARE, the metal ring right beneath where the crock sits gets extremely HOT.  Toward the bottom not hot, middle warm, top where the metal folds over, extremely extremely hot.  Can't touch even for one second.  Still I'm very pleased with it.  Just use silicone gloves or pot holders etc after it's been cooking.  Comes with a band that attaches at the handles, over the top and criss crosses for traveling to secure the lid.  Nice extra.

I did a lot of research before purchasing the Bunn.  I found a lot of negative reviews on the Keurig and did not want to take a chance.  I also wanted a machine that did not limit me to k-cups.  The Bunn does it all.  You can use k cups, pods, loose coffee, tea bags and plain water with just a swipe of a drawer.  The pulse feature lets you get stronger coffee with the push of a button.  The coffee tasted great and is at a good temperature, although a shade hot for my taste but nothing to loose a star over.As another reviewer said, definitely read the instructions first and follow them to prime the pump before making the first beverage.  This does take maybe 5-10 minutes.  Also, take the time to learn the meaning of the different lights.  It is well worth the effort.  After this, you can make a cup in about a minute or so.  By removing the drip pan (effortless) you can use a travel mug.  The Bunn is not a "pretty" machine.  It simply does what it was designed to do.  This is all I ask.
summary: More than just a k cup machine

reviewText: My wife has several pregnancy pains, including her lower back and knees. Because she's pregnant, she can't take any medications. With a little research, we discovered that a pillow between the knees at night can subdue these pains. I took it a step further and ordered this pillow, specifically designed for the knees. The memory foam holds its shape. Her back, knees and hip pains are far less painful than they were previously. The pillow's contours keep it secure between the knees throughout the night.No offense to the reviewers who complain about how their knees touch despite the pillow being between them... but you must have abnormally fat knees... or... something. I tested the pillow myself and tried to force my knees together - couldn't do it. Not easily anyway. Using the pillow for its intended use, your knees won't touch, or even come close. Again, unless your knees are incredibly heavy.It met all my wife's expectations. A happy wife is a happy life, so 5/5 stars!
summary: A Great Solution For Pregnancy Pains

reviewText: if you want a great fryer and a clean fryer this is the one I searched them all and researched reviews and this one is it for the price it is worth it and it would be a nice gift for another ....

Of course this works for putting your pizza in the oven, but only a small pizza. Im talking personal size! If you try to put a 12 inch pizza with toppings it just doesn't seem strong enough, and starts to actually bend! Should have bought the wooden peel, :(

I bought these towels because a few of the reviews said they were small enough to be used as dinner napkins.  Since I'm trying to transition my family away from paper napkins and use something more sustainable, I thought these would be perfect.  For my purposes, I wish they were a bit smaller, but as kitchen towels, they're absolutely perfect.  The size, the weight, the absorbency, everything. For dinner napkins, I'll likely cut them down and hem them myself.  Which will be awesome, because then I'll have 2 dozen dinner napkins for an amazing price! Anyway, these rule. Go buy them.

These liners are useful. I bought the bamboo steamer, steamer adaptor and the liners, all of them work great. The liners help to prevent the food sticking on the steamer, so we don't need to spend so much time on cleaning the whole thing. Good product.

Updated 4/5/14My new bread maker arrived to replace the defective unit.  And I am very pleased to report that this one works as promised.  My first loaf came out tall and beautifully browned with a light and airy crumb as expected.  The loaf itself was quite beautiful with a great crown.  Fantastic bread maker.This breadmaker makes horizontal loaves, similar to those you find in the store.  Depending on the recipe you use, they will come out nice and fluffy. The shape of the pan, combined with the mixing power of two blades, means no leftover ingredients along the edge of the pan. The non-stick coating allows for easy cleanup. Just pop the bread out and place on a rack to cool.4/3/14I did a LOT of research before deciding on this product. And it seems to work so well for other people.  Keep in mind that I am not a beginning baker. I have made a number of loaves by bread machine and by hand as well.When my unit arrived, I raced home on a late lunch break, opened up all the packaging, plugged it in, whipped some egg whites, put everything in the pan (eggs, water, flour, gluten, salt, yeast all in the correct order), set it on the "French" setting for a two-pound loaf with dark crust and then returned to work. When I arrived home, there was still another hour or to go (I knew it wouldn't be ready until 7:30, but it was so hard waiting!). It smelled so good! When 7:30 finally arrived, the machine alerted me that my bread was done and I raced over. Sadly, what I found was bread that had crowned awkwardly and was all but completely raw. I tried expending the bake cycle, but after another fifteen minutes, opted for a preheated oven. It finished nicely in my oven and the bread was good, albeit a bit dense. I realize way too late in the process that I had added to much yeast. That explained the unusual shape, but not the way undercooked aspect. I decided that since it had been a while since I'd used a bread machine (although all previous bread machine attempts have performed beautifully with other machines) it could be user error.I made a new batch of a different bread (one that you can leave overnight) weighing the ingredients this time and set it to finish at six am. When it was finished, I was even more discouraged. My loaf had risen, then sunk and was again, way, way undercooked. I didn't have enough time to finish baking it in my oven so I ended up having to throw it away. I did a lot of research later that day and decided to give it another go.That night, I measured all of the ingredients with the measuring implements that came with the machine and exactly as specified in the manual. I even added extra flour, following the suggestion of one user and also working on the theory that'd perhaps the rain had made the air extra humid that day and perhaps it was just too wet.  Sadly, this morning, I awoke to the same caved-in, raw bread as before. Again, I didn't have time to bake it in my oven, so it looks like I've wasted even more flour and other ingredients.I am returning my unit, but sadly Amazon did not allow me to exchange it for another so I had to order a second one. It will be here on Saturday. I hope my unit was merely defective. I love bread, especially fresh, homemade bread. And I was so looking forward to making healthy bread for myself and my friends and family. Hopefully the next unit works out better. I really hope so.

Purchased this directly from amazon.com, it arrived expeditiously and packaged very securely as always. Very nice little humidor, keeps cigars smelling and tasting good. It is well worth its price and is constructed of good wood, what's not to love.
summary: Superior Quality Without Breaking The Bank

reviewText: I have no idea if this is a good lunch box.  We owned ours for 6 years and never once packed a lunch in it.  But it has successfully carried the following: matchbox cars, trains, videos, stuffed animals, bugs (live and dead), legos, building blocks, raisins, underwear, binoculars, expired credit cards, pokemon cards, plastic animals and, of course, more trains.3 year olds will love this because it comes with different pieces and has different compartments and so it's fun to take apart and put together.The only flaw is that the outer compartment can be hard for little kids to open and close.  And the straw bottle cleaning problem others have mentioned.But still, if you have a Thomas fanatic, get this for him or her even if there will never be a lunch in it.

Love this.  I can make very thin slices of various vegetables and fruits and can have fun with these .  I need more practice to make spaghetti shape, but will have fun trying.  The only negative is that it is so very sharp and u need to be very careful with it.

I own the best hard-anodized aluminum pans - Anolon Allure. But this skillet is for high temperature browning without worry. The non-stick coatings, if turned up too high will emit toxic fumes, especially to birds. Cast iron does not.Cooking a steak in a nonstick pan you need to let it soak in water for 10 minutes and then use a non-metal potscrubber brush.Cooking a steak in a nonstick pan you need to let it soak in water for 10 minutes and then use a metal potscrubber brush, then wipe it with a paper towel and place it on a burner for 30 seconds to let any water evaporate. Then very lightly coat it with oil.Also it best for the heat source to be under ALL the surface area of the bottom of the pan. Using an infrared temperature sensor I measured 500 degrees in the center and 300 where the burner was not directly underneath. Again, its important to match the burner diameter to the pans diameter.If you understand these concepts then you will be serving both tasty and healthy food. Go right ahead and use metal cooking utensils too.Lastly, for stovetop use, I love my skillet but not the cast iron lids as i don't want to draw away heat from the cooking area. Instead I use a metal outlined glass lid which took a bit of an effort to match the oddball 10 1/4" size.
summary: Great Skillet With the Required Care

reviewText: Probably great for makeup and other small item storage. One of the knobs was a little loose so I keep little used articles in that drawer. Easy to see what you have in there and somewhat stylish. I will probable get another couple (I bought 3 sets)
summary: I keep my eCiggerete supplies in these

reviewText: Fresh, fast espressos, cappucinos and lattes.  No coffee filters.  Easy cleanup.  All I can say is BUY ONE.  And if you read about the gasket wearing out in some of the reviews -- you can buy them for pennies at the hardware store.  Great gift for a college-bound kid or your friend in law/med school; a welcome companion for those late-night study sessions.
i bought this shaker to keep by the stove for SALT but the holes are huge and now i see it is for flour or spices.....i just have to be very careful but i like the fact that it has the handle

I have owned KitchenAid products for over 50 years.  This is my second hand mixer.  It has all the power I would ever need; my only negative comment is that the release button is very tight and being 73 I don't have a lot of strength in my thumbs, so I frequently have to ask some one else to release the blades for me.  My previous hand mixer didn't have this issue, so I don't know if it's a new design feature or if the one I got now just has a "sticky" release button.  Other than that, it's a great hand mixer.  I'd recommend it to anyone.l

I just received these sheets and we slept on them,  I love them!  I had satin sheets.  They were smooth and soft, and slippery and would not stay on the bed!  Got rid of them!  These are smooth, soft, stay put on the bed.  Service was good.  What more can I say at this point?  If they fall apart or have other faults soon, I will revise this review. For now, they are great. Thumbs up.

Happy with the set. If were wishing for anything, was that the bowls were a bit deeper, rather than wide and shallow, but over all this was the best set I could find. A considerable improvement over the plastic bowls we had where you feel like you can never get them entirely clean. The finish does get spotty sometimes if you don't wipe it dry, but that's a small thing. If you're going to be putting them on display, just go to a little extra effort on cleanup.

I ordered these 27-quart bins as tools to help keep my closets more organized, and I'm very happy with them. They're big enough that they can hold quite a bit (I was able to pack a queen-sized blanket plus some table linens into one) but slim enough that they can fit onto most standard shelves without too much overhang. The clear plastic makes it easy to see the contents and saves time digging around looking for things, and the latched lids help keep everything securely packed and safe from dust. They're also nice and sturdy (I could see these being great for moves), and the 6-pack here on Amazon was a great deal price-wise, especially with the free shipping. Highly recommended!

This is great for keeping in your kitchen, on the counter, for composting.  There is a liner in the lid that keeps it from smelling bad and gnats can't buzz around it.  It's handy to drop composting ingredients into in the kitchen and you don't have to take it out to the yard until you're ready to.  We do it about 2ce a week.

It sounded clunky coming out of the box, and wow, when I plugged it in, it vibrated so much it was jumping all over the counter! Smelled like burned plastic too. Just terrible. It went right back into the box and is going back to Amazon. Don't waste your money or time with this.
Does the job.  Nothing special but works for me and keeps the shoes organized.  For 26 bucks not bad at all.

This window unit cools a small space pretty effectively. The only problem I have with it is that in high humidity, it does not seem to take any moisture out of the air at all, which I find unusual for an air conditioner. In my experience, they always dry the air a bit in addition to cooling it, but in the small bedroom that we installed this, by the end of a hot day, everything in the room (pillows, comforter) feel damp, and no one wants to sleep on that, ugh. If the heat is a dry heat then it's the perfect unit for a smaller room, and might even work in a medium to large room also. I LOVE the remote and the auto-settings, they're both very handy.
The spiral slicer was a little slow,Kind of like sharpening a pencil by hand. I tried it on a carrot, zucchini it did the job and I enjoyed my salad.

When I got this out of the box my husband looked at me like I was crazy.  Once he saw what it was he actually liked it.While this cutting board is designed for easy storage I suspect you like me will keep it out on the counter.It stores nicely in place.  When not using the scrap bin it collapses neatly away so that it is not a nuisance.The scrap bin comes off easily so the board (with whatever might be on it) can stay in place while the scraps are dumped.  I can then slide off what I've been chopping without the waste being in the way.this is great innovative step up from a standard cutting board
summary: inovative approach to a cutting board

reviewText: This pan is a great pan for our two person household.  Just the right size for just about anything.  A saucier is so important when making anything that needs stiring, risotto, hot cereal and, yes, even sauces.  I know it's not the best pan out there, but at this price it's the best for the money.

I received this popper as a birthday gift several years ago from a brother. This guy is a great gift giver!!It has been my faithful and trusty sidekick for nearly 5 years. I use it weekly on average, but sometimes as frequently as several days in a row when I'm on a binge. It pops all kinds of popcorn perfectly, high quality gourmet all the way down to the dollar store junk; and It pops perfectly whether you're popping a single snackie serving or enough to feed a party. It's easy to use and heats up fast- popping a half cup of kernels only takes marginally longer than a bag of microwave stuff, and its SO much better! I'm ready to retire my popper to the land of spent small appliances only due to the fact that the bowl is starting to wear out, it's cracking and looking melted around the edges where it rests on the heating plate. I would buy another one of these (and probably will in the future) but my kitchen is currently very cluttered and it does take up a lot of storage/counter space.

We had some Thanksgiving turkey leftovers, we all thought some baked potatoes with all the trimmings would be tasty with the turkey and the doorbell rang!  The UPS guy handed me a small Amazon package; instantly I knew what it was!  I had seen this infomerical on T.V. about the Potato Express so I ordered from Amazon instead.  I pulled out the Potato Express from the box, popped in some red potatoes in the microwave, pushed the baked potato button and within about 3-4 minutes had perfectly baked  potatoes for us to eat with our leftover turkey and cranberries.  Love it, Love it; use it alot!
summary: Came just when I needed it!

reviewText: For wine glasses, pilsner and other narrow/goblet-shaped glassware these are great tools.  We rinse them after each use and store vertically in a narrow glass on the counter top.  The foam does not retain moisture like a sponge or cloth and thus stays clean, fresh and odor-free between uses.  Highly recommended.
summary: The Right Tool For The Job!

reviewText: I ordered this brass lift and lock bath tub drain as a replacement for a corroded existing drain that is 12 years old. We have very hard water here and that is very hard on all the plumbing fixtures. The drain is of excellent quality and was packaged very well and shipped promptly! It was easy to install using all the right tools and plumber's putty.
summary: Replacement brass lift and lock bath tub drain.

reviewText: Love the deep pocket of this mattress protector,  affordable price, Perfectly fit my queen size memory foam mattress. Definitely I would recommend this product to everyone.

We ordered this grill from Amazon about a month ago. It arrived within a week in perfect condition. AS ALWAYS I washed the pan, dried it and continued to season it. I thought i would only use it on rare occasions if I couldn't grill outside. As it turns out, I use it often. The beauty of cast iron is it's heat retention, in a light weight pan as soon as you add food the temperature drops dramatically.. not so with a heavy cast iron pan. Burgers, steaks, chicken and vegetables have perfect grill marks. We also use the Lodge 5 qt. Dutch Oven ( from Amazon )for frying. Since maintaining oil temperature is critical so fried foods do not get soaked with grease, the heavy cast holds the oil temperature well. Both excellent products AND made in U.S.A.
This has been awesome. Kept us cooler in the summer and has been good so far this fall at keeping us snug and warm. Much better than sleeping directly on the memory foam.

I waited for almost a year to review the butter keeper to ensure that it held up well. It is a good product and I recommend it. It is not fancy nor large but for the price it is a good deal.One reviewer mentioned that her/his had developed many tiny cracks that were a problem. I don't see any evidence of this but I don't put it in the dishwasher.Some reviewers stated that the butter falls out. I haven't had any problem with that. I just make sure the butter is soft. I put it in a bit at a time and squish the air bubbles out with a spoon. I knew to get the air bubbles out from baking as a child. We used to spoon Crisco into a measuring cup and squish out the air bubbles to ensure we had the correct amount.I did verify with the manufacturer that the glaze is lead-free.
summary: Like all butter keepers you must squish out the air bubbles

reviewText: Nothing fits tightly. Lids very difficult to snap on. base is useless as containers fall out easily. They weren't worth it. Save your money!
summary: base is useless as containers fall out easily

reviewText: I read all the other reviews have had absolutely none of the problems that were mentioned. I've owned them for at least three years.  I even bought another set, as a matter of fact.  I don't use the second caddy.  I stacked both sets on the original caddy.  Yes, it's kind of cheaply made, but has held up excellently.  I love the fact that I never have to look for lids to match, that there is a good variety of sizes, and best of all, they are NOT disposable.  I admit I do not use them in the microwave.  (I don't use any plastic in the microwave.)  They hold up very well in the dishwasher, and none have stained at all.  I put hot and cold food in them.  Every lid fits fine.  I'm very pleased with the price, the convenience, the entire idea of space saving.
My crust burned under the silicone shield. I will use foil for my 9 inch pies and continue to use my aluminum 10 inch shiled for bigger pies.
summary: I'll stick with my metal pie shield.

reviewText: I have the same item with Martha Stewart's name on it, but same design, same construction. One of the grids has already fallen out, I stuck it back in and out it came again.  It''s all but impossible to get clean with bits sticking down in the yellow grids. The idea for dicing is great but the construction is poor - it's going right back. Save your money. I only gave it one star because I couldn't give it none.

Got these as replacements for the bottles that came with the soda stream. They are exactly the same except that they are white. The old ones didn't break or wear out but they do have expiration dates so we thought it would be best to replace them.
summary: replacements for bottles that came with the soda stream

reviewText: The product that arrived matches the description so there were no surprises.  Their length and weight are very acceptable.  The twisted end makes for a nice grip.While the "pointy" or "eating" ends have these little engraved rings to provide some gripping service, these chopsticks are ideal for sushi or solid foods. Dishes like ramen or pho are a little more difficult.  To that end though, I have used them many times for noodle soups and while they are metal they do not conduct heat to the point where they couldn't be used after sitting in a bowl of steaming broth.Dishwasher safe so far...  I have not noticed any discoloration.  After a thorough initial cleaning, I have not noticed any ill taste effects as a result of the metal.
The hangars are great for gripping slippery and open clothes (like jackets and cardigans).  I have been using them for almost a year and I have yet to have any clothes hanging on them fall off.

I bought this specifically to make zucchini spaghetti.  Works perfectly, is super easy to assemble and takes up very little storage space because of the handy way the pieces all fit together.  Such a simple healthy alternative to traditional pasta! Saute with a little olive oil, garlic or onion, sprinkle with cheese and dinner is ready.

This seals well and I've been very comfortable tossing it in my silk-lined bag to tote it to the office with me. No spills yet and I don't expect any. It also does a great job of keeping my coffee warm at least until lunch (the coffee never lasts longer than that...)
Very good product. Thick glass, very sturdy. The poles are plastic, not metal though. Doesn't impact the look or what it can hold, but something to note.
I use this as a mixing bowl, to microwave soups, pancake batter, serving pitcher etc. It is so useful in so many ways and avoids the need to use BPA/carcinogen laden plastics.

When I was building my homebrew beer filter system I found these. Bought a couple and ganged em together. I've got no real complaints about them, they work exactly as they are supposed to. They hold a 10" filter and run liquid through it.The bottom portion feels like high quality plastic, fairly thick and heavy, more than enough to survive being used for beer.My only issue is with the construction of the top portion. The plastic is very soft, making it easy to cross thread. Not a deal breaker, just means be careful when screwing in metal pipes or fittings.
So much better than the ones found in local retail stores for the same price or more... made well, cool colors and great price! I already bought a few, love these!

These are fantastic!  If you are still wondering whether or not to buy these, have no fear.  They're solid and pretty without being foo-foo, a step above ordinary and even a tad bit elegant.  I use them for everyday and will most certainly be setting my holiday table with them as well.

I never bother to put this away because I use it so much.  My son has milk and wheat sensitivities, and as a result, eats lots of eggs.  True, this was NOT non-stick coming out of the package, but I knew that from reading the reviews here before I used it.  I picked this up at Target, and thought I was gettingLodge Logic LPGI3 Pro Grid Cast Iron Grill/Griddle.  When I got online after getting home from the store and saw that it was this one, I almost returned it.  Glad I didn't.  I don't know how the other griddle works, but I'm sure the only difference would be a larger surface area for cooking.This fits (barely) over my two electric burners.  The first few times I used it, I went heavy on the oils and have not had any problems with it sticking on the flat side.  I cooked pork chops on the grill side and they DID stick, so much so that I had to scrub it afterwards with water and a brillo pad.  For the record, I thought the brillo would take the supposed non-stick coating off and I'd have to re-season it, but it did not.  I have not used the grill since then, but I will be sure to use more oil the next time.  I've made pancakes and eggs on the flat side, and by now, a couple weeks after buying it, I no longer have to use any oil to make it non-stick.  It cleans up easily, too.Another benefit of using this is of course the added iron in all of our diets.  We can all use that.Great little grill/griddle.  If you have a small family this is probably good enough for your needs.
I love this pillow the only down fall is the loft is too much for me so im try to break it down a little but besides for that amazing pillow
I needed a set of inexpensive steak knives and these fit the bill.  They cut meat well.  I even use them to cut veggies, slice bread and trim fat off of meat without any problems.

Why in the world would they put a hole in this sink grid that doesn't serve any purpose? I bought this to replace my old sink grid. The old one had a hole that was big enough to allow you to take the sink strainer out to empty and clean. With this one, you have to take this grid out of your sink to remove your sink strainer. They also make one without a hole. So why make one with a hole that you can't use to remove your sink strainer? I'd love to meet the person who designed this thing. What on Earth did they base the size of the hole on?

My laundry room has developed a weird smell. Don't know why since I can neither find a leak or see evidence of mold but I placed this in the outlet and the smell has been greatly reduced over time. My laundry room is small and it has a slight hum almost like the sound of my "silent" dishwasher. No where near as noisy as my dehumidifier so the noise issue I've seen mentioned is all relative I guess. The product arrived in perfect condition so I guess it's only 4 out of 5 stars because it wasn't the miracle fresh air smell I deluded myself into expecting. Which is kind of silly to expect but there you have it.

I did not give this 5 stars as it is not as cushiony as I had hoped. Guess a thicker and more expensive one would more likely give me the relief I need. This may be fine for others. I have a number of health challenges that cause a lot of pain when standing. So if you just want a mat to helps some you may like this mat.
summary: Helps make standing in kitchen better

reviewText: When I read the reviews for this product I knew this wasn't going to be a true refrigerator, but I bought it for these reasons: 1. It's smaller and priced lower than most compact refrigerators. 2. It only runs on 45 watts electricity. 3. I wanted something to keep a beverage cool in the evening since I live in a two story house and don't want to walk down a flight of stairs at 2 AM to have a drink. I noticed that the people who liked this the best used it for that purpose. If you look inside the unit you will see that there is metal in the back half of the refrigerator. This is the only thing that cools, and it will only cool to a maximum of 32 degrees below room temperature. If your room is over 70 degrees this will not give you a cold beverage. The way I use it is by placing a glass with ice in it at night when my house is cool (that's when I plug it in). The glass stays cold, and the ice melts very slowly. I've also place a can in a bowl of water placed in the back of the fridge and that stays cold (the water helps transfer the cold to the can). As almost all the reviews state, this unit has a very loud fan, so I don't recommend it for a bedroom. I keep it in my office and only turn it on at night. And the latch is delicate so you have to be careful every time you open and close it (not a big deal).
5 out of 5 work to charge my phone, 4/5 work to sync data. A bargain for the price, I'd definitely buy them again if I needed to.

I am getting older and do not see as well as I used to and with the large dial I can see this without my glasses.  I love it and you no longer have to put things into a roast or turkey to try and read in the oven, just stick this one in wait until it stops going up and presto you know the internal temperature.  It also works well to read the temp of the bath water for your grand son....Nice quality product.

This rack arrived the day after I placed the order! I bought it to hang our hats. The rack is made out of a quality wood, the pins are long enough and you can choose how wide or narrow you want to hang it. Love it!
This is great, I don't have to buy filters.  Fits perfectly, I have a latte machine.  Good buy.  No problems

I love this because I hated being limited to whatever I could store around my sink. With this, I have 2 brushes, a sponge & scrubber for tough jobs. The cleaning item I need is always handy, and their is a water catcher on the bottom so that when your brushes & sponges drain, it isn't all over your counter, and you can remove it, drain it, clean it out, and it is all very simple.

The toaster does what it is supposed to do. It has an odd look to it and is not made of the best materials.  It takes diligence to keep clean and shows dirt and grease stains easily on it's tin like body.  The warmer feature is not entirely useful as all it adds is a cover for the top.  You get the same result by just putting a dish on the top of other toasters while it is on.  I should add that the thermostat control is way off from the real temperature.  I discovered this by testing it with my oven thermometer.  I guess overall for the price it is ok, but not the bargain it is made out to be.

Thermos has certainly kept its line contemporary.We probably all remember the Thermos canisters of yesteryear. They did the job well-coffee at sporting events, cool beverages at picnics.  But they were big and clunky, with that plastic cup on the top (that never got quite clean). And always some plaid motif......Remember?Today's Thermos is streamlined and very nicely combines form and function. This one here is a vibrant, jewel-toned cranberry red. It is ideally suited for one person to sip safely from the canister while in the car, on the road, at the office,  etc...........You can pour from this-slowly. It works and that is primarily how I use it.  BUT POUR SLOWLY-or have a paper towel nearby to sop up the mess.Hot stays Hot for hours, as does cold. Things taste freshly made. Nothing unsanitary or unappetizing here!These individual thermos canisters are so terrific-I'm sold. Would not get any other product!
summary: This is NOT your Father's Thermos!  This cranberry red is really nice!

reviewText: This is a really nice big crock pot.  I like the features.  This will be great for large quantities.  I would recommend this item to any one.
i needed this for a three tier cake i was making  for a birthday. This is such a sturdy base.

These attachments work great when it comes to detailing a car. I bought this for my husband to go with his new hand vac for Father's Day.... I know, it is amazing how our needs and wants change over the years. He wanted to be able to clean nooks, crannies, vents, etc. in his car. He loves this set. However, I am on my second set as he forgot he left them on the garage floor and then proceeded to run them over. Such is life I suppose. I am so grateful that these attachments are affordable... and that my husband did not run over the vacuum itself.

I was looking for a decent, middle-of-the-road bread knife.What I got was an attractive bread knife that may end up lasting for a VERY long time.It's heavy, solid construction and it goes through bread and bagels like butter.

great deal for $80. Seems much nicer than the fake wood coffee tables you get at Target, Walmart, etc. The fact that the table is clear makes the room seem a tad bigger, and the glass obviously is SUPER easy to clean

This is a great-looking fan with different speed settings and an oscillating option. I have it on my desk at work and it matches the rest of my desk stuff on my desk like my Dell computer, keyboard, paper trays, etc. It also moves a lot of air for being so small. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because it vibrates ever so slightly when in the lowest speed setting, thereby making a little bit of noise. If I make it go faster on any of the other two speed settings, however, it runs super smooth. Kind of weird since I would expect the opposite to happen.

I had been looking at food dehydrators for 2 months, trying to make my decision, which was hard, as this one had no reviews and I count on the customer reviews to help me decide on whether or not something is a good buy.  It is hard to spend this much money on something and not know what you all think about it.  But...  I really wanted a square one, with a rear fan, and a 10 tray one, but the Excaliber was so expensive, and the reviews were iffy in the sound area and in the temperature control area. (I actually bought this from E-Bay, (better price and freebies too) and they have reviews, but I don't know if I can count on their review system like I can Amazon's.  Anyway, I took the plunge and bought this beauty, I think that the smaller size of the holes in the trays were what made the decision for me, along with the $100+ difference in the price, and the free silicone liner sheets.  It is quiet, efficient, and I just love it.  It came with 3 free silicone liner sheets for fruit leather that I would have had to pay extra for with the Excalibur and the Nesco, and it came with a face plate filler so that I can pull out 4 trays and make yoghurt in it if I want to.I have dried bananas, strawberries and oranges so far with great results.  I was surprised that the oranges were so good, never expected to like them, just did not want them to go bad, so I sliced them in whole circles and put them on the trays. They were crispy/chewy and sweet, and I will save the rinds and chop them in my blender to use later for recipes that call for orange zest. I made Essiene bread this last week, using sprouted wheat, raisins, and sunflower seeds.  It was very fast and with the openings of the trays about 1/2 inch, I put the patties right on the trays, no liner, and it was fine, no chunks falling through.  I love the separate temperature control, it is nice.  So far, 2 months later, I have no complaints except my family is eating the dried fruit as fast as I have time to make it, and I was hoping to store some of it.  My granddaughter has a sweet tooth, and she has her chubby little hands full of the bananas when she is here.  I would have loved to put some of the dried strawberries in my Mueseli, but they disappeared before I could sneak some away.  I am ready for summer to come (we are still having snow storms...) and for my garden to produce so that I can really put it to good use.  I will try jerky soon, but I have no doubt that it will do the job well.  I wanted to wait and write this review until I was sure it would work well for all of my needs, and I am confident to recommend this to anyone who is wanting a good dehydrator for a good price.  It is bigger than the Nesco, smaller than the Excaliber, at 10 square feet of drying space, it more than meets my needs.  It is just the right size for my counter, not too big, sits next to the microwave.  It makes less noise by far than my dishwasher or my stove hood fan.  I know it is on, but I can still think and hear what everyone is saying.  The kitchen smells wonderful while it is running as well, like whatever I am drying.  I expect to be able to take advantage of sales, Costco sized packages, and my garden offerings this year, without worrying about spoilage, plus save a little money, eat a little better.  Not a bad life...  grin...Customer service was amazing.  I received it within 3 days of ordering it, if you can believe that.  I actually had a problem with the unit.  It was explained to me that sometimes when the unit is drop shipped through UPS, they actually drop it, and the protective grill around the fan can get shifted.  Well mine did, and it had the fan blade trapped.  I turned on the unit and washed the trays off for my first use, but the fan blade was not turning and it melted.  Oh man, I had the trays full of sliced bananas and no dehydrator!  Bummer, plus my husband had already thrown the box away so how could I even send it back?  I did not want to send it back, I just wanted it to work!  I took it apart and could see where the problem was, this was a Saturday and their office was closed, so I E-mailed the company, Mercantile Station 2, asking them to send me a replacement fan blade.  Within 30 minutes I had a personal phone call (again, this is Saturday and they are closed) and a promise to ship me a new fan blade the following Monday.  He explained to me that about 1 in 80 customers had had this problem, (leave it to me to be the 1 in 80...) and that they were looking into their packaging to fix the problem.  Meanwhile he could not have been nicer, or more accommodating, and he was very grateful that I was willing to fix the problem myself.  Me too, I did not want to have to wait for an exchange, I just wanted to get it working, and it does, and I am one happy dehydrating woman!  So check that your fan blade is free of impingement before you turn your unit on, which is easy, just take out the trays and you can see all the inner workings.  FEEL CONFIDENT to purchase this unit and save a good $100+ over the other comparable units on the market.9/27/11  It has been 18 months since I purchased this and I still love it.  I have used it steady with no problems and I did not just forget I had it after a few uses.  I took a shelf out of my cupboard and set it there to get it off of my counter, out of sight.  I have made a lot of fruit leather, strawberries, bananas, apples, dried orange and grapefruit slices are divine, beef jerky, and I've even shredded carrots which was a lot of work, but it was fun to have a baggie of them to add to stews and soups.  I sprout my wheat and then dry it back out to grind to flour and save a lot of money doing this.  So far my favorite is dried tomatoes, so good to eat like a chip.  Slice the tomatoes stem to bottom, not side to side, in 1/4 inch slices.  I chop up fresh basil and salt to taste, mixed in with olive oil and dip the tomato slices in it and set them right on my trays. These retail for $20-$30 a pound in the store and are so easy to make.  Love this machine.  So got my money's worth out and expect it to keep working for a long time.

Nice can. Quiet close. Easily removes from can and bag easily removed from liner, because of air hole design. My old can line had such suction that it was nearly impossible to remove the bag without breaking the bag. Great can.

Replaced a "rabbit" type that had broken. Am really pleased with this one, although it would have been better if it came with a stand.  But, it does work well, is easy to use and basically is good looking.
I made my first attempt at making pancakes in the rings, I will now only make pancakes this way. I was so happy with ease of use. Easy clean up.

The vendor of this set of nine WHISKEY STONES by DrinkRox sent them to me for purposes of evaluation.  They are marketed as a way of keeping spirits like bourbon or scotch cool, but for my review I used plain old cold water in a glass "rocks" glass.  I was not warned away from using them to keep opaque liquids like Ensure or orange juice cool, but was not exhorted to use them for that either, and decided not to.  The "stones" are really dice-shaped cubes in neutral shades of gray and comprised of soapstone, not granite (a distinction the vendor uses as a selling point).  Currently the price for the set of nine stones in a small velveteen bag runs half or less of the "personal-luxury" price of about forty dollars they used to sell for.  Instructions are simple: wash off the "rox" but do not dry them, and put them in the freezer.  A bag of nine is probably sufficient for the contents of two glasses.  They will keep the liquid contents of a glass cooler than nothing at all, and since there is nothing to leak there is no dilution by water as there would be with ice cubes.  I think these DrinkRox will serve as a nice small present for a friend or for oneself, especially if dilution of spirits by ice cubes is a problem.  Be aware, though, that the cubes' cooling power is not sufficient to chill a drink, or to keep a cold drink cold all evening.

I, like many of the other reviewers, didn't realize how time consuming it would be to make mini muffins with a 12 option pan!  This option with 24 mini muffins is very nice.  I have made muffins as well as mini pizzas several times in this pan, and it seems to work great.  The non stick coating works well thus far.  Clean up is easy as well!
summary: Great Mini Muffin Pan - 24 is a Must!

reviewText: If you are into stainless, you really can't go wrong with this one.  The three settings work great, it cranks out a lot of pepper with each twist, it is attractive, sturdy, and easy to fill and operate.  There really isn't anything else I could ask for.Update 1/21/2009 - It broke after 2 years.  If I could change my rating, I'd give it 2 stars instead of 5.  I know I can't expect everything to last forever, but 2 years?  I expected more from a $30 pepper mill.  To its credit, it worked perfectly until it died.
summary: Flawless, as far as I can tell

reviewText: Not happy, so small that they are useless for a sandwich. Only good for fruit or small snacks. Next time, will get a larger size.
These containers can be used from everything from mixed nuts to freezer items. They shut securely and do not spill. I like mine and also investedin a few larger sized ones!

I have started becoming more aware of the plastics in our home and wanted to replace our plastic cups that we use every day with BPA free plastic.  These fit the bill.  They're nice-looking and don't have a "cheap" appearance like so many plastic cups (I personally am not fond of plastic cups, but my husband is).

Love the drying quality, but just wish they were more rectangular and longer. Width is great and better than most dish towels These 'cotton' towels have microfiber beat hands down!!  If you want to really and actually dry dishes instead of just pushing water around theses are your best towels.

Tried this a couple of times before marinating my meat...chicken, ribs, turkey chops.... simple to use, just puncture the meat as though stapling items... it for sure helps penetrating seasonings into the meat, especially when leaving overnite... as mentioned in other reviews, depending on thickness of meats, you will need to be careful how long you cook ( can over cook and make dry ). Also it depends how much you puncture your meet, when flipping over tenderizing that side... but when cooked correctly, your meat comes out very tender... I love this. I am hoping I don't have problems with it rusting, but I do make sure I rinse this after each use, carefully placing my thumbs on each end outside of blades, press down  exposing blades, and rinse inside blade protector unit, then I place sometimes in dishwasher... I make sure its completely dry before storing away. If I don't use dishwasher, after I clean this, I shake it out because there always seem to be water stored in the pillars of unit. Make sure I dry by hand as much as possible... I Highly recommend this. tenderizer.
I BOUGHT ONE ~ GOT IT ~ USED IT ~ LOVE IT ~ SO I BOUGHT SEVERAL MORE IN DIFFERENT COLORS FOR MY KITCHEN AND FOR OUR CAMPER

I'm surprised at the spectacular reviews.  First, this product is poorly designed.  The lid cannot be removed without some type of thin utensil.  Flipping the infuser upside down after brewing is complete is not an option since at that point it would be filled with tea leaves and water.  My second issue with it is the poor craftsmanship.  While washing the unit I cut my finger on the inside lip due to sharp exposed metal.  Compared to other similar products, you save some money here but it's not worth it because of these two what I consider major flaws.

I wanted more because I LOVE these bowls. They are so useful around the kitchen. No they are not big mixing bowls, they are a trio of nested bowls that measure 4"x6" Large, 5"x3 1/2" Medium and 4" 3/8"x3". The large one is perfect for my husbands cereal being a bit larger and deeper than most cereal bowls, the medium is perfect for me and the small just comes in handy! After searching for cereal bowls and not finding any deep ones I decided these work best for us anyway. They also make great bowls for side items at dinner.
summary: I got mine at True Value for ten bucks....

reviewText: Nancee J. Swartz, 29, Maryland. I own the KitchenAid Professional 5-Speed Blender and it is a very useful appliance for blending and baking mixes. It is easy to clean and comes with instructions for usage and cleaning. I recommend it as an addition for any kitchen.

They are well stitched and washable.  They hold my Goose down pillows with no errant feathers flying about.  They are not nearly as delicate as others have implied.  And the price is unbeatable.  That's what it's all about!  Highly recommend.  Will buy again.

2014 Update: Breville - With time I have come to truly appreciate and enjoy my Breville food processor. It took me quite a lot of time to figure out how to process doughs with this machine. Initially it just beat them to death. Well, the not-so-difficult (to figure out) secret is to watch the temp of your liquids and to limit your processing time. (See comments for more details.) There also were quite a number of issues initially with processing cheeses. This issue has been totally resolved and the new manual gives clear instructions on how to effectively process cheeses. The Breville has now become my go-to food processor and I use it every day.Cuisinart: About the only time I pull out the Cuisinart is if I have limited time to do clean up between processing or if I am traveling and need to bring a machine along. I don't want to put my beloved Breville at risk (lol). The major issue I have with the Cusinart is the mold problem. I did get a replacement lid and was told (very firmly) that this was a one time thing. The design has not changed so, I am very cautious about clean up with it. I do not put it in the dishwasher and I try to dry every bit I can get to as soon as I can. I also have found that liquid and matter can get in the handle of the largest bowl through a small hole near the bowl opening. I have a small brush I use to get in to remove matter but I am concerned that mold will develop in that area over time. I really no longer can recommend this machine because of these issues.2012 Year End Update: I continue to use and appreciate both the Breville food processor and the Cuisinart. I do reach for the Cuisinart more frequently than the Breville but that is mainly because I use it to make some sort of dough on an almost daily basis. Please see the comments section of this review for a discussion of the cheese grating issues and the resolution for the Breville Food Processor. (Kudos to the company for resolving this issue.) Also please note, I have added a Cleaning section to this review based on issues with the Cuisinart food processor lid.Update:Cuisinart - After 4 months of regular use I have to say that this has become my "go to" machine. I typically need to make some sort of dough with my meals and so I use the large bowl for my dough and then the smaller bowls for slicing and dicing. My only complaints about this machine are that sometimes there is spill over from the smaller bowls to the larger bowls when processing the food and I have to keep a hand on the machine when kneading larger amounts of dough because it gets to rumbling and grumbling all over the counter.Breville - After repeated attempts at dough making with the Breville, I have concluded that it is simply not cut out for that sort of work. When I am making vegetable stock and need to chop up a lot of vegetables I do go with this machine because it is an absolute beast. I also like the french fry disc. I have also used the emulsifying disc and it is pretty effective but must be seated tight down on the base of the bowl or matter gets under the disc. My only other real complaint about this machine is that those little metal tips on the disc spindle and blades have burned me more times than I care to count, they get really hot and then tend to want to stick to the top of the lid when you pull it off.After putting up with a prehistoric GE 7 cup food processor for decades I finally decided to empty my wallet and buy a 14 cup Cuisinart Elite Collection food processor*Cuisinart FP-14DC Elite Collection 14-Cup Food Processor, Die Cast. Then, a week later I was given the opportunity to review this food processor. Can you say "holiday time heaven"? I put both machines through their paces cooking Thanksgiving Dinner and have continued to use them on an almost daily basis to do everything from simple slice and dice to whip, puree and knead.  They are both fine food processors, excelling in different areas. Here is a back-to-back comparison.Appearance:Breville - This is a beautiful machine, being sleek silver and coal black. The lid is a slide lock system and has a very wide feeding chute and a large food pusher with a smaller round pusher, (the small pusher is calibrated and can be used for measuring); the unit can run with the small pusher out but stops if the larger pusher is removed. (And starts right back up if it is put in - quite the shock if you forgot you had the machine running when you took it out.)Cuisinart - This is a very attractive unit but is a bit boxier than the Breville and not as expensive looking. The lid snaps on to the unit when two small buttons are pushed in on the large work bowl. There is a wide feeding chute with a smaller chute inset. And it comes with a retractable cord that can be extended a little or a lot.I really love certain aspects of both machines. The Breville really is a beauty; I like the measurement feature on the small food pusher and the fact that the large pusher is closed in at the bottom, so food does not get in the open part of the pusher when you use it. I am not crazy about the roundness of the small pusher though; functionally it is much less practical. I also love the retractable cord on the Cuisinart.Accessories:Breville -  Three Blades (Micro-serrated S blade, Dough blade and Mini processing blade), 5 discs (Adjustable Slicing Disc, Shredding and Grating Disc, Julienne Disc, Emulsifying Disc and French Fry and Vegetable Stick Disc), One Mini Bowl, a disc spindle, small brush and spatula, instruction booklet (with a few recipes) and storage container.  (Note: the blades have metal tips and can get quite hot after processing - so mind your hands when reaching into the bowls!) All bowls and attachments are BPA free.Cuisinart - Three Blades (Small Chopping/Mixing Blade, Large Chopping/Mixing Blade and Dough Blade.) Two discs (Adjustable Slicing Disc and Reversible Shredding Disc.), two smaller bowls with pour spouts, Stem Adapter, Spatula, Cleaning Tool and instructional DVD with recipes and spiral bound instruction manual with recipes. Accessory Storage Case.The Breville obviously has a greater number of accessories and the storage container is much higher quality than the Cuisinart. The Cuisinart container is a two level unit and the bottom drawer is clumsy to pull out and push in. On the positive side, only the Cuisinart container has a safety lock to keep little hands out.  The Breville brush and spatula are also better quality than the Cuisinart. That said, the instructional booklet from Cuisinart is far superior to Brevilles both in construction and content and the additional DVD is a godsend for those who are either visual or auditory learners. It is very helpful to be able to actually see someone use the food processor.  Also, certain of the Breville accessories must be washed by hand.Warranty:Breville - One year limited warranty on unit. Twenty-Five year induction motor warranty.Cuisinart - Three year limited warranty on unit. Twenty-year motor warranty.Controls:Breville - The unit has three button controls; Power Off, Start/Pause and Pulse. It also has an LCD display with a count up or count down timer.Cuisinart -. The unit has four buttons: On, Off, Dough and Pulse.I love the LCD display and counter feature on the Breville. As for the Cuisinart, the dough cycle is almost a must have for me since one of the primary reasons I wanted a good-sized food processor was because I am a baker.  (It is not my profession but is one of my passions.)Motor:Breville - 1200-watt induction motorCuisinart - 1000-watt peak power induction motorSlicing and Shredding:Breville - Shredding - the machine shines here. Shredded cheeses** are uniformly shredded with minimal powdering and there is quite a difference between fine and course shreds when the blade is turned. Slicing - simply excellent. I made a dessert that called for very finely sliced apples and I could not have asked for a more beautiful result.Cuisinart - Shredding - This unit isn't quite as good at shredding as the Breville. There is very little difference between the fine and medium shred on cheese and quite a bit of the cheese powders. (Not an issue for cooking but one if it is being plated.) Slicing - Very good results here too. Not quite as uniformly sliced as the Breville but close enough.Chopping:Breville - The top performer. You just have to be careful to keep the processing time down or you end up with grated not chopped!Cuisinart - Does a very good job but isn't quite the powerhouse the Breville unit has proven to be.Kneading:Breville - Oh dear, I am afraid I haven't had the best luck here. The machine is simply too powerful and your poor dough is easily beaten. I have tried several batches using this unit at the same time as the Cusinart and have never been able to get the same quality result. They really need to add a dough button to the controls.Cuisinart - Wow, fantastic results! Makes bread so light you can't tell the difference between that kneaded in the food processor and kneaded by hand!I made a double batch of baguette dough. I hand kneaded one third and put one third in each of the food processors. I kneaded the dough in the food processors until it formed a shaggy ball and then finished kneading by hand. The dough in the Breville was simply tough and even with much attention never recovered from the initial processing. The dough in the Cuisinart was easy to work with and felt "just right". When the three loaves were (blind) tasted side-by-side the family was split over whether the hand kneaded dough or the Cuisinart kneaded dough had the best texture and taste. All thought the Breville kneaded dough was on the tough side and a bit tasteless.Cleaning:Breville - the machine must be hand washed. Cleanup is a breeze and there are no issues with food being trapped in the lid seal.Cuisinart - I am very unhappy with the lid and seal is designed on this machine. I have to pick food out of the seal and between the seal and the lid most every time I use the machine. I also am having an issue with mold growing on the top of the seal where it is encased in plastic and unreachable for manual cleaning. I have been soaking the lid in a vinegar solution to deal with this but it is simply unacceptable to have these sorts of issues with a machine that is so expensive. The food processor is top rack dishwasher safe but I would give some thought to putting the blades and slicing/shredding discs in your dishwasher.Overall impression:Breville - this is a very fine, beautiful machine. If you are leaving it out on the counter and use it mainly for slicing, shredding, chopping, I highly recommend investing in this unit. That said; if you like to work with dough, consider investing in the Cuisinart.Cuisinart - Until I had the cleaning issues with the lid on this machine I thought that for the price this unit was a tough one to beat. Now I am not so sure. I very much appreciate and enjoy using the machine but am completely put off by the fact that I have to actively watch for and address mold forming in the seal area of the machine. I recently picked upThe Best Bread Ever: Great Homemade Bread Using your Food Processorand am going to work on using it with the Breville after the first of the year. If I can figure out how to make a great dough using this machine then the Cuisinart will be relegated to the back shelf.*I had a watch on it on camelcamelcamel and there was a price dip.** Please see comments section for a discussion of recommendations for shredding cheese and warranty implications.
Mixer does what it should.. and its orange!  :)Can go super fast.. mixing as it does. Its a tad on the loud side.. but I don't need to quietly mix anything. Its light - easy to hold and maneuver.
InterDesign Rain Tray 4S, Clear  Fits into a narrow draw nicely.  Tall sides and it helps organize the draw.  Came quickly too.

This picture is like an everyday reminder that life is just a series of little, perfect moments. It's like a voice whispering in your ear: "Stop now. Take a break, run away from everyday chaos and rush,and look around yourself. Enjoy this perfect moment and let it make you happy at least for a second or two...". It's almost like you can feel the breeze and tiny drops of water on your skin and smell salty, sea air by only looking at this azure magic.

This media rack is not much of a looker but is very versatile and can hold DVDs, Blu-rays, PS3 games, Wii games, Xbox games, PSV games, and even our old PSP games, plus our family's sole HD-DVD! No assembly needed. It's not super-sturdy, but for this price I knew what to expect and overall am very happy with it.

I've never used another type of jar but these are very good quality and always seal completely.  I've never had one break or had any issues with the lids.  They are easy to fill and work well with my canning utensils. Easy to clean as well.  Save the box as it's a good place to keep them even when filled.

Bought them to replace my old old kitchen shears and so far I'm very happy with them.  Will likely order another pair.  The grips are comfortable, the blades are sharp.  I can't speak to the longevity of them but so far they are wonderful.
summary: They cut, what can I say.

reviewText: OK, I read all the rave reviews about the cannister sucking up masses of totally invisible dust and HOW did it ever find that much? So--the $ was great so I ordered it.The first time i used it, it sucked an entire canister of dust out of three large area rugs. SCARY.It is a pain in the butt to clean the canister after EVERY use and I worrry that it is 'shredding' the wool right off of my old rugs. (They are e bay good deals but 100% wool.)I AGREE with all the other reviewers: WHERE DOES ALL THE DIRT COME FROM?Know what I think?I think it REALLY came from Hell and the devil puts all that dust in there just to FREAK US OUT!Ha!Good sucking 2 U!I'll keep using it unless my rugs start going BALD. As I said, SCARY!Will update my review if that starts happening.Aloha!
summary: SUCKS LIKE A DEVIL, COSTS A DEAL

reviewText: Received a Keurig pod coffee maker for Christmas and a selection of coffee pods. Love the system, hate the waste and big-time expense of using a new pod for each cup and then tossing. Tried the reusable mesh cups (not Keurig) from Amazon and they are not bad but you have to hold your cup up to outlet or it sprays coffee all around. Also grounds in holder and in brewed coffee sometimes a problem. YUK! Received the My-Kaps last night and used 1 twice this morning and I love them. They are FAR thicker and heavier than pictured. Think disc of hard plastic not flimsy top from take-out tartar sauce. So each kap is going to be good for numerous uses. I looked at the various offering on the company web site and while you can buy these without the brush and removal tool, I recommend getting the kit that has them. Don't think I'll use the cleaning brush to 'sweep' out the used grounds since a clean child's soft tooth brush works very well. However, the kap removal tool is great for  extracting kap from top of K-cup (kaps actually fit down inside top of pod not over the top). And in the grand scheme of things and for morning serenity, the small extra expense is well worth it. Also, when you place the filled pod into the holder, rotate it until the hole in the bottom slides over the needle so you're not punching new holes each time. The instructions call for using an espresso grind, but I had some regular grind gift coffee handy and used it without regrinding. Worked fine. Kaps for K-Cups isKeurig B-70 B70 Platinum Single-Cup Home Brewing Systeman excellent product that does the job it was designed to do. Additionally, the kaps make it possible to fill and store pods so the coffee maker is once again super instant and easy to use and they assuage my guilt re: creating needless waste. Does life get any better than this? Wish everything worked this well.

I was sick of finding chairs or door knobs to hang items to dry.  I bought this and installed it in our laundry room with dry wall screws.  It works like a charm!  It even holds up to the winter heavy sweaters.  I push it back up against the wall when not in use.  It can be kinda tricky to install so my advice is to take your time and check and double check hole placement.
summary: Installed it in our laundry room

reviewText: i have lots of bowl sets, like this one for the multiple sizes, sturdy if not perfect fitting lids, low price, not the thickest metal butit makes the bowls lightweight for easy use and clean up, had no problem with rust or defect good everyday bowls

I'd been wanting a George Foreman grill, but I'd never gotten around to buying one ... so when I had the opportunity to try out the Griddler, I jumped at it. And boy, am I glad I did!The Griddler has two reversible, nonstick plates -- each with a raised side for grilling and a flat side to use as a griddle. The plates come out very easily and are dishwasher safe. I found they're also very easy to wash by hand, if you prefer. (The unit comes with a scraper for easy cleaning of the grill sides.) The nonstick coating also seems very thick and durable; we haven't had any problems with it flaking off.So far, I've used it for cooking steak, fish, pancakes, panini and French toast. All have cooked up beautifully, except for the French toast -- and that was my fault, because I forgot to use butter the grill first, and the bread stuck to the plates.
