(I did butter the next batch, and that turned out just fine.) The fish and steak grilled in record time, because they're being heated on two sides, not just one. And the panini were delicious! I would suggest that you use a very thick, sturdy bread, though -- like French bread not Wonder bread -- to ensure your panini isn't squished. The top is rather heavy.I especially love that you can lie the unit flat for lots of grilling/griddle space. I don't have a large griddle pan or skillet, so before when I cooked pancakes, we'd either have to keep them hot in the oven or eat one person at a time. Now I can cook everyone's pancakes together.The Griddler has definitely earned a regular space on my countertop! And my mom is so jealous of it, she wants to buy her own ;)
summary: I never want to live without my Griddler!

reviewText: This toaster is an improvement over my old two-slice Wal-Mart one.  For the most part, it works very well.  Occasionally I'll get a couple of pieces of toast with uneven toasting, but would still buy this again.

Donuts are great. The maker comes with easy to read instructions. The only thing I was unimpressed with was how small they were. This isn't really a problem because they only take 7 minutes a batch to make, but it would have been nice to know they were bite size instead of just small.

These insulated glass cups are great! No more worries about condensation and rings on the table or nightstand! They keep beverages ice cold for longer than a regular glass would. Another thing I really like about them is their look. Other insulated beverage holders are plastic and not really suitable for a more formal dinner setting. These can stand up to any occasion, and the fact that they are clear enough to see the beverage levels and type of beverage is an added plus. Very useful household must-have.

For the price, getting 3 cooling racks that stack and are easy to store when not in use is a no-brainer for anyone that bakes cookies.  We've found that 3 tiers is plenty for allowing cookies to cool from the oven while the next batch goes in, and rotating the next batch onto the rack and the now-cooled cookies to a container.

I don't use this often but when I do it works great. I cook my bacon in a cast iron skillet and most of the time do not need the weight to cook it (note: watch your bacon if you use this). I don't eat as much red meat but I will try this with my next steak.

Just buy them, you will love them.  I buy them all the time because they are simply amazing.  They are sharp, look great on a table and I use them really as a steak knife if I want to because people love the cover.
Great fan. Cheap, sturdy, works well. Little bit loud, but what more can you expect from a powerful mini fan? Would definitely buy again.

After doing a lot of research, I settled on purchasing this indoor grill for use in my apartment. I've used it thus far to make chicken, burgers, and pork chops. Here's my rundown:Pros======- Gets HOT--the manual says the temperature range goes up to 410F, but my infrared thermometer shows my grill surface reaching 550F and above. This is good, of course, since it gets closer to imitating the high temperatures a real grill.- Grill surface is really nonsticky--nothing I've cooked so far has been able to stick to it. Of course, you can't use any metal utensils/spatulas/tongs on it (it will scratch the nonstick coating) so make sure you have nonstick-safe cooking tools before grilling.- Grill surface is heavy and dense--this means it's going to hold its heat better which is important when grilling.Cons======- No lid--to me, this is one of the main reasons I knocked it down a star. No included lid means your only method of heat transfer into the food is going to be conduction, which is fine for thin foods, but for thick foods the outside is going to burn before you can cook the inside fully. On a real grill, you can put the lid on so that it acts as an oven in addition to a grill. Since there's no included lid, you'll have to stick to thinner foods (or I suppose you could sear the outside on the grill and finish the thick meat in an oven, but that kind of defeats the point of having a grill).- Tedious to clean--despite the nonstick cooking surface being extremely nonsticky, it's still a pain to clean because of all the small slats and the burnt fat that can buildup in between the slats. The manufacturer should have included a shaped cleanup tool like the George Foreman grills have, but I find using one of those handheld dishwands (with the scrubber that's safe for nonstick pans) is the easiest tool to cleanup the grill.- Still not "smokeless"--despite what the manufacturer or anyone says, this grill is definitely not smokeless. This isn't so much a fault of this grill in particular, but rather a consequence of extremely high heats plus oil/fat. It's just going to happen. The drip tray does help some, but if you have a rub or a lot of seasoning on your meat, that's also going to add to the smoke as some of the spices blacken. It's still not too bad though, and nothing an open window and a box fan can't alleviate.Overall======This grill is an acceptable substitution for a real grill for those who are unable or unwilling to own a real grill. No, you're not going to get that charcoal taste (but you can get a smoked taste by marinating/brining your meat with a liquid smoke product), but your meat is still going to get nice grill marks and taste pretty good. I do recommend this grill!Extra tip: If you're like me and prone to under/overcook your meat, take a tip from Alton Brown and brine your poultry/pork! I brined my boneless/skinless chicken breasts and after grilling them on this grill, they were so unbelievably juice and tender I had to double check their temperature to make sure they were fully cooked. The texture and juiciness can't be beaten, even if you overcook!

This is a great little gadget. With all the heat in the Midwest in the last few weeks, I found myself thinking, all I want in the world is an orange juice snow cone. This does the job quickly and well. I felt a little ridiculous sitting with a bowl of orange juice and ice. I also felt something close to ecstasy knowing that the next time the need arises, there will be no need to hunt for a street snow cone vendor.This is a terrific thing. I'm sure it will get a lot of use this summer.
i've tried the handheld dyson and this works better than that... for FAR less money. powerful, easy to use and empty.
These are pretty big. They go way up your arm. However they do keep you protected well. I didn't feel any heat at all from the oven. The only thing that gets me is the color. These get dirty easy.

i bought this more for accuracy than speed but I expected it to be faster based on the description.  Took 8 seconds to go from 68 to 168 the last time I checked a chicken.  Should have spent the extra bucks on the more expensive super fast unit.  At least I don't have to use 3 thermometers to get a trusted number.As I use it more I will update if it reads faster.  I suppose I can always pre-heat it with hot water to speed up the read.
summary: Not as fast as I expected

reviewText: The Berghoff 8-Piece Gourmet Knife Block is a perfect set of professional stainless steel knives that are sharp and sleek. The knife block adds some sophistication to your kitchen and without taking up too much counter space and the block allows you to keep your knives nice and sharp without fear of rusting. These knives are made well and the handles are comfortable enough so that you can easily slice away on something as soft as bread and something as tough as steaks without any discomfort. The Berghoff comes with a 30 year warranty that makes it allows you to get more than your money worth for these exquisitely crafted tools.These knives will make a perfect gift for the chef in your life or just a nice housewarming gift for anyone. These are a great investment that will have you preparing your meals just like a professional chef.
summary: A nice investment for your kitchen!!!

reviewText: it works ok but the battery doesn't  last long....
Bigger than I thought so it does not fit on my stove. I sit it on my counter top.  I do like the fact that it is dishwasher safe.
Very sturdy and stay stuck firmly.  These easily hold everything I want in the shower and have room to spare.  I have several large bottles of product on the shelves and it's very sturdy.

I bought three different sets of these.  Red, Black and Blue.  The Red and Black fitted sheet is also significantly bigger than a queen bed.  They dont fit snugly around the matress and require clips to hold them in place.  These sheets are also rather thin.  They are not bad for the price.
Makes my life much easier and fit perfectly. I def want to get more for tea cupboard and baking goods.

Ok, so most of the time when I see a 1 star review I figure that the customer either just for some personal reason hates the product, or misunderstood its use and instead of admitting it, they just blame it on the product.I am giving this 1 star not because it is dysfunctional or a bad product. It gets 1 star because the label that is stuck to the thing was next to impossible to get off. I mean the adhesive was pretty much one with the plastic. I tried a heat gun, hot water, soap and then eventually resorted to using a chemical compound (goof-off) to remove the sticky film. Considering that this is a food container, one should not have to resort to toxic chemicals just to remove the label.Maybe I am just the lucky one that ended up with the bad label, but I so often see this happen. Companies use the wrong kind of sticker on a plastic product resulting in this extremely poor user experience.  When will they learn?Beware...

I purchased this Pyrex set when it was listed on Amazon's "Deal of The Day" for $19.99. At that price, it's definitely a good deal for what you are getting. If you bought all these pieces separately, the cost would be much higher. I did read a lot of reviews noting the "Pyrex controversy" prior to purchasing, and gave it a quick Google search and read. However, considering the price, and the fact that I am pretty careful with my glassware items, I went ahead and purchased this set.A few considerations: I compared the glass to the other Pyrex pieces I own (which are probably about 10 years old), and the thickness of the glass is about the same. The appearance (look and shape) has taken on a more modern design. The photos should be updated because the set I received looks different...the handles of the pans are not solid glass, but are larger with holes in them, making the overall shape/design of the pans quite different. The bright red-orange colored lids are somewhat unpleasant to the eyes...okay, ugly (in my opinion). I would prefer white, dark blue, or at least a darker red. The lids for the mixing bowls fit well. However the lids for the 3-quart oblong and the 8 inch square do not fit as securely as they could/should to preserve the freshness of foods inside. It seems as though the manufactures were trying to achieve a good design by contouring the lid shape around the handles of the pans, rather than covering them (as the ones pictured do). However, something didn't quite work, and they don't line up as well as they should...the fit just doesn't have a good, snug "feel." This is my main complaint about the set. While still fully functional, there is room for improvement here. Oh, and the pie plate is "standard size" (a very shallow 1 and a quarter inches deep). I wish it had included a deep-dish pie plate.These issues aside, longevity and shatter resistance remains to be seen and will take time and usage to determine. I will most definitely update this if I have any "glass explosions" or other issues with the set that are worthy of sharing. There is a tiny "spider-vein" on the bottom of the oblong; I hope this is not a weak spot! :)

I bought this stockpot because the one that came with the set I had (an 8-quart) was just too small for the amounts of stock I was making.  Keep in mind though that this one is very tall--when I wash it in the sink, I have to swivel the faucet out of the way to stand the stockpot upright.  The steamer that came with it was also a godsend, since I did not have a proper steamer prior to buying this.  The price was right too.  Most similar stockpots I looked at from other manufacturers either didn't have the steamer/pasta inserts or cost significantly more.  My only complaint about this set is that it's hard to keep it as perfectly shiny as it was out of the box, but that's true of all stainless steel, and of course it doesn't affect performance at all.Update (April 2013): this pot has held up well to regular use. I have no complaints.

I love this pillow case just for how smooth it feels! I'm not sure if it's making a difference on my face, but I have noticed that I don't wake up with creases on my face. This pillow case also stays cooler longer, for those who are warm sleepers.
This product worked wonderful for my vegetable spagetti pasta. It cooked perfectly and in only 14 minutes. I will use this from now on.

This waffle iron is easy to clean and use. I have two gripes with this is product. 1. It did cook the waffles unevenly. I cooked mine on the 1-1.5 setting for 5 minutes. The waffles were cooked however the browning was uneven. The owner's manual says that browning improves with uses (seasoning the metal). SO hopefully the browning problem will fix itself over time. I posted a pic of the uneven browning. My second complaint is the lack of beeper. However setting a timer is not that hard to do so I can live without a beeper. I had no trouble with my waffle batter spilling out. If it does spill out it may be one of three things: too much batter in the iron, factory defective product, or the batter is too runny.Tips: You can't put pancake batter into a waffle maker and expect to get good waffles. Cook's country/ America test kitchen have a recipe for butter milk waffles. This is what I used and they turned out great. Crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside with lots of deep pockets for syrup and good flavor.I used 1 cup of batter per waffle on the 1-1.5 setting for 5 minutes to produce waffles like the posted picture.If you are making a meal for several people, you can keep cooked waffles in the oven at 250 degrees to help keep them warm.
summary: Pretty Good product and a few tips for good waffles

reviewText: As other reviewers have noted, the product can be damaged during transport, thanks to Stack-on's packaging.  The screws strip like crazy as others have noted as well.I had trouble fitting a 60's era Savage deer rifle and a Marlin .22 into this cabinet.  Forget about the deer rifle and a Mossberg 500 slugster with mounted scope.  Its nice for out of the way storage, but this won't fully meet my needs, and I'm already considering a different purchase.  Should have bought a stand-alone unit instead of trying to skimp by.

After being a Dyson fan for the last 7 years, I decided to try and see if a lower priced model could suffice since I only live in a moderate sized one bedroom. I am not mechanically inclined, and, the assembling was very simple. I was impressed with how well it handled against the carpet. I have two cats and one long hair that tends to shed a lot of her grey coat. Therefore, there must have been a lot of hair ingrained in the carpet after a few weeks of it not being vacuumed once my Dyson broke. The Dyson was a beautiful machine. It was a lot more complicated to keep track of all the different attachments. (I believe it was my neglect and impatience that caused the issue with the vacuum cleaner that broke. And that came from my not keeping better handle on the various attachments). But back to the Hoover, I am pleased with how easy it is to handle and it looks like it has great suction as well. The recurrent complaint about the chord not being very long has some validity if you have a rather large home. However, it isn't that inconvenient for my amount of square footage.

I needed a new make up bag, and I specifically wanted to find one that would hold all of my brushes. I am so happy with this bag. First of all, it is really cute! I love that the brushes have a designated spot that is separated from the rest of the make up and contents in the bag. This will keep them clean and in great condition - yay! I also love the double decker aspect of this bag. There are two zippered compartments: one large compartment on the bottom of the bag, and one smaller compartment on the top of the bag (where the brushes are). This helps me keep everything organized, and I finally can find what I am looking for instead of digging around in a bag. I am very pleased about this bag and I would definitely recommend it to others, especially at such a great price!
It works great! It is well made. I really like the top padding. I set my Keurig Vue on top of it.

For the price you can't complain much. Yes there are slits on the corners, but they do cover the bed and I don't see between the slits. I use pins to hold the skirt in place, so maybe this helps with the corners not exposing the box spring. Yes, it's thin and cheap, but what do you expect for the price. I just wanted something to cover my box spring to protect it and not spend $40 plus on a skirt. This does the trick for me.

I'm a huge Cuisinart fan and this one was a must have.  Easiest of all to fill with water.  Bought a reusable filter which saves money.  Just love to smell fresh coffee as a wake-up in the mornings and this brews some really great coffee.  Fits right under my cabinets.  I keep it on a mat so I can easily slide it out to fill with water and coffee and push it back underneath the cabinet.  Never sorry for purchasing Cuisinart.

PROS:SimpleConvenientReally does cut down on prep timeChops and dices to uniform sizesMuch safer and easier to use than a mandolin type slicerEasy clean upEasy storageComes with helpful cleaning toolIntegrated measuring deviceCONS:Not for large jobsVeggies need to be cut down to size before they can be used in the deviceNot suitable for softer fruits, vegetables, or cheeses or veggies that are too pulpy (e.g. soft tomatoes)Very fibrous, not so crisp sweet potatoes were a bit of a challenge (but a crisper, less dense variety worked famously)Cutting blades are not meant to be cleaned in dishwasherLess versatile than a mandolin slicerSturdy, but not heirloom kitchen device qualityThe Freshware Onion, Vegetable, and Cheese chopper is a simple kitchen tool that just does the job.There is really nothing all that fancy here: basically the device is a simple hinge.  You select from three cutting grates: large squares, small squares, or slices.  You select one of the grates and place it on the base of the device, place the food on the chopper blade, and push the hinged lid closed.  This forces the food through the grille and--voila--your food is chopped.As an extra bonus, there are measuring lines drawn on the side.  If you tilt the device on end, you can see if you have enough, say, chopped onions without having to use a measuring up.Is this genius?  No.  Is this new, innovative, and oh-so-different than anything out there in the market? Absolutely not.  However, the chopper is simple, easy to use, and light weight.  Whether you are making sweet potato fries, chopping onions, or cutting harder cheeses in cubes or strips it is simple and just works.  This is an easy to use, easy to clean, device that doesn't take up a lot of room, but might save you a lot of time.The device could probably chop just about anything but, for me, worked best on larger more solid types of food.  Potatoes and crisp sweet potatoes worked exceedingly well. (Note: very fibrous sweet potatoes that weren't so crisp didn't work well in the system.  For some reason they were trouble.  However, another crisp and seemingly less fibrous variety worked famously in the machine.  You may have to experiment at first with what works.)  If you want strips or slices you give them one pass.  If you want cubes, you put them through for a second pass.  Solid fruits, such as apples and firm pears worked well too. Onions were diced with one pass.  Note, however, firmness is key. If the onion is on the riper side, it still works, but there can be some slippage.  Celery, carrots, and parsnips all worked pretty well, but were less convenient as you need to cut them in strips that fit on the chopper blade and you can't really stack them.Certain veggies, such as tomatoes, didn't work as well.  Sure, if you have a more solid beefsteak tomato without a lot of seed or pulp it would probably be okay.  But if your have a less meaty tomato that has a lot of pulp/seeds, you will pulverize more than you chop.  The same goes for ripe pairs, bananas, softer cheeses etc.  Softer things that don't hold their shape don't work as well.Given the incredible sharpness of the blades, there was little slippage of the food while chopping.  With a tiny bit of pressure, the food anchors quite well.  The sharpness of the blades is also key when it comes to ease of use.  You do have to apply some pressure for things like hard, firm, white potatoes to initiate the cut, but so long as you put a little of your weight into it wasn't a problem.  Once again, if the blades should become dull, this might be a bit of a chore.Clean up wasn't bad at all.  The bulk of the device can easily be cleaned in soap and water and--I believe--is even dishwasher safe. There is a cleaning tool that will help you easily pick food pieces from the top of the device, where there is a square pattern that helps prevent slippage.  Without the tool, this would be difficult to clean.  The blades are dangerously sharp. There is a thick plastic frame around each, so handling isn't a problem.  They generally rinsed clean well, but as far as I can tell, the blades themselves are not dishwasher safe.  Be very careful when cleaning to avoid injury.  (The blades are razor sharp the way blades on a mandolin slicer are sharp.  The thing that makes this device safer than the mandolin-type slicers is that everything is covered while you are doing the chopping so you don't expose your fingers to injury the same way.)Blades can be stored in the bottom of the closed chopper.  This is nice, as it means that there are no exposed sharp edges to snag and cut you if you are reaching for the device in the cabinet.One caveat: this is not the device you would use for industrial sized cooking.  The area of the cutting blades is small and some larger vegetables need to be cut down to fit the size of the cutting surface.  Additionally, you have to be careful about vegetable height, as the vegetable can't be too tall for the hinge.  But if you're preparing dinner for 1-8 people it worked just fine.  Another issue: the effectiveness of the chopper really depends on the fact that the blades are razor sharp.  They will likely become dull over time and if that happens the device will be close to useless.  The device--with the exception of the blades themselves--is made of hard plastic.  This is not an heirloom kitchen device that you will pass on to your children, but in practice seemed sturdy enough for the job at hand.On some level, this is a 3-trick pony: it slices and cuts strips in two sizes.  It is easy to discount this as yet another superfluous kitchen device, but the fact that it is small, easy to use, and does the job quickly make it a real asset and something that I used far more than I ever thought I would.  Simple things like chopping up onions for sauteeing: just strip the onions, stick them serially into the device, and--bam--you are done.  No lengthy dicing and the size of the chopped onions is uniform.  The same was true of making fries or cubing cheddar.  It was all much faster than usual and actually justified the time it takes to clean up the machine afterwards.I'm not a person who likes buying a kitchen device for every little chore, but although it's repertoire is limited, this one actually seems to work well and has become a go-to device in my kitchen.  Surprisingly, I like this device and see myself using it a lot in the future.  Recommended.
summary: A surprisingly useful kitchen gadget that does what it does exceedingly well

reviewText: There is something extremely satisfying about using a garlic press. A knob of peeled garlic goes in the hopper, swing the arm over, and squeeze. Stress relief, plus perfect garlic! Entertaining though a garlic press might be, is it really a necessary tool in your kitchen? In its favor, a garlic press is very handy for giving you a uniformly “minced” garlic that’s much smaller than we could get by hand. For those of us who love garlic flavor in every bite, or if you’re a little shy about your knife skills, this is fantastic. A garlic press is also very useful for those times when we need to crush a lot of garlic at once. On the other hand, it’s a kitchen uni-tasker that takes up space in our drawer. The hopper gets clogged with garlic skins and becomes difficult to clean, especially if we forget to do it right away and the skins start to dry.When we’re chopping vegetables for dinner anyway, it feels easier just to mince the garlic along with everything else rather than pull out another tool. If you’re nervous about mincing something so small with a knife, it’s just as easy to crush it with a dinner fork as it is to use a garlic press. On the whole, we’re not convinced that this is a necessary tool in our kitchens, but that doesn’t mean it’s not handy!I was sent the Propresser Garlic Press Stainless Steel Garlic Mincer and Ginger Press Garlic Press: Should You Buy One? ~ Review to check out for myself and I honestly have to say I really like it. If anything, it looks appealing! What I like about it is that one does not have to peel the garlic. Just put it into the compartment, vigorously squeeze, and scrape out the crushed peel. It’s that simple! The results come out amazing if you ask me! I found that the press is sturdy and feels as if it will hold up quite well for plenty of future use. I particularly love that it’s made of stainless steal just for that reason.Also, I found the handles to be ergonomic and comfortable for use. After pressing the garlic MOST of the cleanup was done by simply rinsing the press in warm water for a few seconds. I gave it two swipes with a brush and it was as clean as new. This unit is dish washer safe and of course we will always clean it with hot soapy water or in the dish washer. Overall I’m quite impressed and like the garlic press. While I don’t think it’s a needed kitchen item, it’s definitely useful!

I have been eying this cute little red ceramic egg holder. I already have a white ceramic egg holder that holds nine. But I got this cute red one too anyway. I have so many uses for it.I use it to store a dozen eggs in the fridge- and it makes me happy to open the door and see that bright red. (It also means I don't have to open the cardboard container to access the eggs because there they are waiting in that red egg holder all ready to grab!I use it when we do a batch of soft boiled eggs for breakfast as a cute way to serve them.I use it for deviled eggs.It also holds  in a clever way, a dozen small appetizer quiches, stuffed mushrooms and other appetizers similarly sized.Have I helped you justify this purchase?
summary: Let me Help you Justify This Purchase!

reviewText: The quality and shape make these easy to use and the perfect pick for making nut milks. The shape also allows you to do it by yourself. I squeeze the pulp, dates and sometimes fruit to strain out all the liquid and the bag is still holding strong but showing signs of use. I suggest getting a two pack so you can alternate them.

I wanted a scoop that was stainless steel to replace a very similar scoop that had been painted silver and was chipping.  This is great for scooping out rock-hard frozen items, like ice cream or yogurt.

The description does say a throw blanket so I shouldn't be surprised by how light weight it is.  I thought it would have been a little fuller to give more warmth.  Will be great in the spring and fall months, just not enough for winter.
summary: Pretty but a very light weight blanket

reviewText: This is a terrific little pan!  I use a little bit of butter in the pan when I cook, but that's more for preference and taste than it is necessarily for non-stick.  As other reviewers have mentioned, though, these pans do definitely conduct heat more effeciently than my old pans did.  So I need to start with a heat setting about half what I otherwise might have used and then increase from there if necessary.  A cinch to clean up, a great non-stick cooking experience, a well-balanced pan, and a very comfortable and sturdy handle.  I love it so much, I've ordered the 12" size as well and can't wait to try it out.  Be sure to get the OZERI brand though.

Hi,I purchased the "Cuisinart FP-14DC Elite Collection 14-Cup Food Processor, Die Cast" used. It came with a DVD to show you all of the cool things that the processer can do. It made me hungry! My wife loves it.It fit nicely on the counter with plenty of room to clear the cabinet above. It came with a tool box full of the blades and extender that you need to work any job. The  Cuisinart FP-14DC is built like a tank and seems to do its job without strain. I would recommend this to any one that likes to cook and who wants a processer that also looks as good as it works. It seems (to me) to be well designed and easy to use. Will it last a life time? Who knows. The main thing is that my wife is happy with it.
summary: Cuisinart FP-14DC Elite Collection 14-Cup Food Processor, Die Cast

reviewText: Love these sheets and pillow slips,  feels good to lie on , looks nice too.What more could you want?GFunner  July, 2014
summary: Love these sheets and pillow slips

reviewText: So easy to assemble, I did it myself in just a few minutes. Sturdy once assembled and can hold a lot of stuff. I bought two, and plan to buy more very soon!

Very convenient vacuum, had such high hopes for this one.  Trying to replace my Dirt Devil that is small, corded, and so loud it is like vacuuming with a  747.  But has such suction I think it was wearing my rug out.  Looked all over for one had this 100 dollar budget.  I love it has no cord easy to put together and it does pick up well goes from rug to hardwood very easy but in heavy traffic areas it just does not pick up as good as the one before it.  for light t pick ups  it would be great.  But I was hoping for something with more pick up I am keeping it.  I just bring out my loud one still to pick up when I need more clean up.
summary: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD NOT

reviewText: Really like it, the only issue I had is the 30 second or less cooking time, while getting one off the other starts to over cook. The machine stays hot for a long times after it is unpluged. I was hoping my grandchildren could help make cookies but it is just to hot for them to be around.It took some getting use to, but I think I have it nearly masted.

I've had this rice cooker for a few weeks now, using it primarily to make brown basmati, and have been very happy with it.  The timer function works great: put in rice, water and spices in the morning and it has perfect rice ready at the time you select.  I have found it easy to use and easy to clean.Regarding the chemical smell others have reported: I removed the sticker from the inside of the rice cooker (underneath where the cooking vessel goes) before using it, but I did detect a chemical odor from the heating element area the first time I used it.  The odor did not permeate the rice though, and I have not detected it again.  Many small appliances will emit a chemical smell when they are fist used and manufacturing oils and solvents burn off; my guess is that this is what is going on here and that it does not indicate a problem.

I usually use this pan for omlets because it is better than most of the older t-fal or teflon pans that we currently own.  However, this Orgreenic frying pan does not perform as advertised and it was a disappointment from the very beginning.At whichever temperature setting we use, the food sticks to the pan.  If I slow cook at simmer, food sticks; if I set it on medium or high, also sticks.  I usually make sure it is well washed then use some olive oil and it doesn't do too bad, but some food still sticks.  Fortunately, it can be scrubbed clean with some hot water and a brush, but beware: the advertising is deceptive, and that is a major disappointment.
summary: Deceptive advertising left us disappointed with this product!

reviewText: We have tried some other organizers before.  She really likes this one.  We plan on getting more since she has a lot of full size spice bottles.
summary: Gave as gift, she loves it

reviewText: this 9 x 13 pan is wonderful. It is lightweight and that's what  I like most about it. So easy to use with these handles. I would buy this again.

My garden produces lots of veggies and herbs! Usually, it's more than we can eat, and all at once we're inundated with good things that will go to waste if we don't act to save them.  Because dried onions and tomatoes are so good, and so expensive, I decided to try drying them myself.  Hence, my first foray into the world of food dehydration.Our onions are bolting, so onions initiated this dehydrator.  Pretty good for a first try!  Here's what I found, what I liked, and what I am not so fond of:Food should be sliced very evenly.  If you're a skilled chef, this may not be a problem.  Otherwise, get yourself a mandolin to insure even drying.The machine does not distribute heat evenly throughout the drying trays, so food on the two bottom layers was browned as well as dried.The machine gets hot.  I should have realized that it would, but next time, I'll place it somewhere other than the kitchen counter.The machine is noisy.  I started it at night so I thought I wouldn't notice the noise.  Wrong!My onions turned out crispy after about nine hours.  Even though some were browner than I prefer, the overall product appeared to be very good.  I vacuum-packed them and stored them for winter use.On the whole, I am pleased with the dehydrator, with the exceptions I've listed.  I expect that, over time, I'll get better at drying produce and will save money and have better products than I could have purchased at our local grocery.Three and one-half stars!
summary: Good Results from a Noisy Machine

reviewText: This would have been fine except the size of the burgers appear to be small vs what you get at a fast-food restaurantEasy to use however as long as you placed a piece of hamburger wax paper at the bottom of the press and on the top..
summary: Makes perfectly roung burgers of any type..beef or chicken

reviewText: Sharpener is easy to use and very effective.Am very satisfied. Believe that you will be, too.Highly recommended.!!!!!

First off, this is a coarse weave cheese cloth, not fine weave, and as such this is a great value... other than that not too much to say about this cheese cloth. I like it, it works just fine, cleans up really well and it's unbleached. The cloth is a good price, especially when you factor in the free shipping / free shipping eligible on this product.And for the cheese makers giving negative reviews, read the description please....-Green Seal of Approval - no bleach is used to make this product-Lint free for dusting and cleaning of furniture, windows and cars-Can be used in the kitchen for steaming, straining, basting, poaching, canning, cleaning and as a spice bag-2 square yards per packageIT DOES NOT SAY IT'S TO BE USED FOR CHEESE MAKING!

I was looking at getting a memory foam mattress topper, and believed this one was. At $139 for a king-size memory foam mattress topper, it would be a good price. But this is not a good price for an oversized 5" thick piece of foam. This arrives folded in half, then rolled and shrink-wrapped, without any directions for use. It still has undulations and irregularities, even 5 days after it was first used. It is very firm, and unless you have back problems, you will find it too firm.

This mat has worked well for me baking biscuits and rolls, and cleans up beautifully.I have not used it for roasting meats, because I prefer to use aluminum foil, which I can run up the sides of my sheet pan to catch the juices and keep my pan clean.

We put these on our registry for good starter red wine glasses.  We're not fancy or super into wines, and these are a good generic red wine glass and attractive at a good price.  Riedel is top quality.

pros:  it is pretty, well made, no loose threads, easy to wash.  cons:  directions say to dry it on fluff, which would be fine, except for me that is forever.  So I dried it on perma press.  I don't know if it shrank or not, but the size I measured this morning is 48" x 58"  (off by 2 inches from advertisement).  I think it would be good for a child's quilt (to sleep on) because you can wash it easily, and dry it on perma press, if you don't mind the shrinkage.  I don't think it would keep me warm as a throw, as it is very light.  Overall:  it's ok if you are trading ease of washing for lack of warmth.  It's not a blanket.
summary: well made, easy to wash, size of a baby quilt

reviewText: All of my life I have wanted feather pillows and they were too expensive . For some reason all feathered products have dropped in price so I spoiled myself and bought them . They are like sleeping on clouds , I look forward to bedtime now !

I've frequently had problems cooking rice in saucepans... bottom would get burnt or liquid wouldn't evaporate well.  I made Uncle Ben's Long Grain and Wild Rice (love this) and it turned out PERFECTLY!  Nice, light, no burned bottom and all liquid evaporated.

I am surprised these spoons have so many high ratings.  They're not accurate.  After several cookie/cake recipe failures using some of my tried and true recipes, it finally occured to me that perhaps these spoons were off.  After going back to my old Amco measuring spoons, sure enough, the baked goods were right back up to par.  I filled the tablespoon of this set to the rim with water and then poured the water into my other spoon and was surprised to see just how off they were.  The volume was significantly short.Also, these spoons are quite lightweight and I find the handles bend very easily.I don't recommend these.

Works perfectly to defat anything!  It does the best job if you have at least a cup of liquid to separate, though.  I love the large capacity, the shape of the container makes it stable, and the strainer keeps the larger bits out.  I don't put plastic stuff like this in the dishwasher, but it washes up really easily in a little hot soapy water.

This product is worth the investment as it is SO much better tasting than microwave popcorn. I can't ever see myself going back to the microwave bag now. We've used ours several times now without any problems, but I've noticed several other reviews say the gears tend to break. If so, we'll simply call the company like one reviewer did, and ask for the free replacement gear.But we got this for a gift this Christmas, it's *NEVER* something I would buy and at first I thought "meh". After trying it, however, we're sold! We can't do movie night without it.

Being on a fixed income, I spent a long time researching electric pressure cookers (PC) before purchasing. Nesco got my order because of reviewers stating that it reaches 15 PSI. As mentioned many times, you put the food in, set it and walk away to do other things. I have gone back and checked it thinking nothing was happening as it is totally quiet, and found it almost done! As mentioned in other reviews, even after browning items before cooking, cleanup is a breeze.My favorite PC cookbook, "Pressure Perfect" by  Lorna Sass requires at least a 6 quart PC for most of her recipes or tells you to cut the recipe in half for a 4 quart. Now I have a 6 quart and can cook any of her recipes with no worries (I sometimes cheated and did not cut the recipe for a 4 qt stove top cooker and was lucky). To get the most out of your Nesco PC, I highly recommend the book as each recipe has many transformations and variations listed and everything so far has been delicious. Happy easy cooking!

The market is full of Eames DSW chair reproductions.  They can be found here on Amazon and also in other online marketplaces.  The problem is telling the quality chairs from the cheap knockoffs.  Having now owned a pair of these chairs for a bit, I can tell you these are very high quality chairs.The two chairs arrived in one box, but they were well packaged and protected for shipping.  They each took 2 minutes to assemble with no hassle and no tweaking necessary: simply tighten four screws to attach the preassembled base to the shell.  The bottoms of the shells have sturdy screw holes that look like that will last and be able to handle constant use.  The bases themselves were made of nice wood dowels and the metal supports also seem strong enough for regular use.  I weigh about 200 pounds and there is no sign that these chairs are going to bend under the pressure.One of the bases had some slight black scuff marks on them that wouldn't come off easily.  They were relatively minor, but when I raised the issue with the seller they quickly insisted on sending a replacement base.  Given how well packaged the chairs were and the excellent customer service, the only possible conclusion was that this was a rare fluke.  I have no hesitancy from purchasing from this seller again.I don't need to describe the beauty of these chairs, they are classics.  I was surprised, however, at how comfortable they are.  The shells have just the right amount of flex to give a little when you lean back, but they also don't seem flimsy.  They worked just as well for me, at 6'4", as for my shorter wife and even my little children.  I was a little worried that the white chairs would quickly look dirty, but with a quick wipe with a damp cloth they look as good as new.  Everyone that has seen them has loved them and asked where I got them.  I'm sure I will be sending them all to Laura Davidson soon, and even picking up some more for myself!Note:  the seller graciously provided me with a pair of these chairs to review.  I made no promise of a positive review and this review is a true reflection of my thoughts about the chairs.
summary: Excellent, High Quality Reproductions of a Mid-Century Classic

reviewText: I have tried the store brand and cheaper brand. They are BAD !!  This is the only one to buy if you want great coffee !!
We love this fryer. Simple to use and clean. Works great. Our food comes out perfect every time. I would highly recommend it.

I bought this pitcher as part of a set with matching Iris slate blue drinking glasses, see my review for the glasses, no product link.As I found the glasses to be quite structurally delicate (i.e. easily breakable) I keep this somewhat pricy pitcher on the top of the cabinets, just for looks.  If that's what you would be inclined to do with it, it is attractive, nice size and fairly heavy.I'm concerned about the pitcher's longevity, given the experience I had with the matching glasses.

I have the Jack Lalane and the Omega Vrt.  I put the Jack Lalane in the box and it is stored in my upstairs closet.  Have been using the Omega Vrt every day since getting it.  The Jack Lalane causes oxidation of the phytonutrients and thus, one has to drink it immediately upon juicing.  In contrast, the Omega Vrt goes at a slower RPM (70-80) and thus reduces oxidation.  I like the Jack Lalane though, it was fast, quick and easy to clean.  However, I like the luxury of storing the juice so that I can come back and drink it in a few hours.  Yet, I find that I always drink the juice immediately and never store it, so regardless, if you drink your juice immediately after making it, then it really doesn't matter Jack Lalane or Omega Vrt.  I like the Omega Vrt better though...just knowing it is not oxidizing my nutrients...it just a preference.

I have a Ginsu knife that I found in a house I moved into in 1994 that's been cutting through steaks with ease for over 15 years now.  (The house was in Baltimore, so maybe I should have taken the knife to the police, but I'm reviewing knives here and not The Wire, so I digress.)Despite the cheesiness associated with the name, I chose this set to replace the knives I had at home that were dulling or had handles that were breaking apart.So far, so good.  Effortless cutting, no need to saw at your meat.  I cut through reheated chicken this evening and barely had to try, it was like cutting noodles with a fork.No, they aren't snobbishly elegant, or uselessly hefty, and you might even get a few giggles when people read the name Ginsu on the blade, but they do a fine job.
an awesome little knife, exactly the shape, weight, balance  and size I was hoping for.  I really Love this knife.
I've owned this trash can for roughly three weeks and already it has malfunctioned.  The foot pedal is broken and the lid only opens partway and is lopsided!

So the vaccum is pretty precise with the rest of the comments. I've only used it a few times and realized my brand new carpet (replaced about 10 days ago) is DIRTY!! This things seriously has come sucking action and is defintely doing it's job as of now!A few things: There is no where to put your additional parts like your extender thingy and the pet hair attachment. Instead it comes with a bag and it's pretty inconvienent. The other thing is it doesn't work well on stairs. I tried to vaccum it without the attachments (something my old vaccume could do) but because the bottom part automatically stops rotating it's brushes when it's almost vertical, it's not condusive to stairs.Other that that, it's a pretty lavendar purple-y color and looks very "professional". It's doing an amazing job right now.. but I'll update my review in a few months.
summary: Awesome Vaccum! But it's the heaviest 15lbs I've ever held!

reviewText: love it and very happy I purchased this. Saves allot on my food for in the freezer... definitely recommend to others

reviewerName: Hobbyist "Chemistry for fun, Computers for mo...
reviewText: I read an article recommending not to use wire screen filters such as most French presses contain.  The reason is that certain chemicals in coffee are normally filtered out by drip makers using paper filters.  The concern is that the less filtered coffee can raise your bad cholesterols.  Why take chances?  I use these in my reloadable K-cup.
summary: If you don't know there are chemicals removed by paper filters...

reviewText: Pops the perfect batch of popcorn.  Never burns and almost every single kernel pops.  The only complaint I have is that the top is  thin metal. I've cut my finger on the sharp edges.  The metal is just a bit too thin so handle it carefully when you wash it.
summary: Perfect popcorn but be careful when you wash it

reviewText: I ordered this board to replace one that has outlived its "beauty." This new board is a good size, but it has a number of flaws, in my estimation.  It has no place to grab when lifting it, which makes taking it out of the cabinet difficult.  It is also very heavy to lift without a holding spot. Also...there is a good deal of "slipping around" when actually using it.  I would look for these missing features when replacing this board.

The Bodum Canteen 6-Ounce (0.18-Liter) Double Wall Glass Thermal Tea Infuser Set is not only functional but beautiful as well.  I own several Bodum pieces from the Assam, Ceylon and their Traditional line but this is the first piece that I have owned from the line known as "Canteen". Bodum has won many reddot design awards in the past and with this new line it's easy to see why. This mouth-blown glass double wall three piece set is just what the doctor ordered when you need a quick "cuppa" for yourself. The Canteen Tea Cup Infuser Set is perfect for all types of loose leaf tea and even coarse ground coffee. I have brewed loose leaf tea, herb tea and coffee in my Canteen and it has yet to leave any sediment in the bottom of my glass. You may pour boiling water over your tea/coffee or you may also microwave the water right in the glass itself.  All the pieces in this set are microwave and dishwasher safe which makes for easy preparing and cleaning.This tea infuser/cup features the cup itself, infuser/strainer and lid that converts into a saucer when the strainer is removed.  All parts are made of beautiful, clear, mouth blown, ultra-light, temperature safe, borosilicate glass.  Borosilicate glass substitutes boron oxide in place of the soda and lime used in traditional glassware. This medical grade glass is the same kind of glass used to make scientific lab glass items, is super light in construction while being very strong, resists scratching and will maintain clarity much better than your average, traditional glassware. It really holds in the heat due to the double wall construction  while the outside of the glass remains cool to the touch. After your cup of tea or coffee has been brewed, the glass filter can be removed and used again to re-infuse your loose leaf tea or coffee grounds.All in all, another SUPER product and beautiful design from BODUM Inc.
summary: Have A "Cuppa"!  Another Beautiful & Functional Product From Bodum

reviewText: It's certainly better than the others I've tried (the enameled type that loses its finish).  It's quite well made and very sturdy; and it's really easy to keep clean.  Also, I particularly like how big the bowl is.

I grow my own greens, this is fabulous for getting the water off of my salad greens.  It is fabulous for washing berries and draining cooked greens.... I am just quite happy.As a plus, maybe, the kids love to spin it for me.

I used to have the food saver but it died a while back. With the exception that this item isn't designed to pull vacuum on a container this works well.  I had one bag that lost it's seal but I figured out you can seal with the vacuum procedure then slide the bag out and double seal it like you do to make a bags from a roll, since then I've not had a problem.

I did a great deal of research before purchasing this bag and couldn't be more pleased.  I actually purchased a couple of these bags and they are absolutely fabulous.  They hold so much and now I can honestly say that my linen closet is totally organized.  Under my bed and neatly stored in these wonderful bags are our excess blankets, throw pillows, beach towels, etc.  - I like that these bags are made of a linen material that does not have an odor like most plastic types of storage bags/containers.  Highly recommend this item!!

I had a carbon wok, in keeping with the traditional flavor enhancing carbon steel, but couldn't keep up with the rust, and didn't have time to season it, so i got one of these and it is great for doing kale and stir fries. I have a wok ring but don't need it for this wok, which allows me to move it from burner to burner with its flat bottom. heats up fast, and cooks faster than our previous pot, a large fry pan.Requires very little heat to do the job, so saves gas. The lid is large and heavy, but I like it b/c it is domed up and high, no longer have to stuff the kale into the pot, and can see it turn the dark green. Lots of room to play in as well, less spillage over the side. I love the weight- we have a Kirkland set and weighs tons- hard for us with carpal tunnel! This one's nice and light, but be careful with banging it around, and using metal utensils (I use bamboo spatulas) as it is thin guage- but I like that. Helper handle very helpful.Nice design! A little nervous about the glass lid,but will be careful with it based on reviews of the past (2011) Hopefully they went after that in the QC dept.

It looks very sleek and modern. The grind size is clearly marked and easily changes with a twist. The cap is only held via magnet and has a tendency to come off, in fact, it arrived with pepper spilled all over the box because cap had come off and there's no wrapping to speak of.

This is a great little steamer!  I have used one for many years and have been very pleased with the results.  I have only used it on carpet but it really shines in that area. Well worth it to have this handy anytime you need it.  Leaves the carpet looking a smelling great. It doesnt have all the powered gizmos but I dont think you need those. It really pulls the dirt out. It is small enough that it takes up very little space in the closet when your done with it.  The water bottle is so easy to use, plug&play operation makes filling it a snap.

We tested the Powerfresh on ceramic and marble floors and we are very happy with the results. We didn't test it on any hardwood but the manual suggests caution (test it on a small area) when using it on hardwood floors both waxed and unwaxed and it suggests never to use it on unsealed floors.The mop is very easy to assemble: snap in the lower body into the mop head, slide the handle assembly down and tighten the one supplied screw. You're done in 2 minutes.Operation is as easy as filling in the small tank with water, plugging it in and waiting for the steam control light to stop blinking (a few seconds) and then select one of three steam levels and do the mopping. Out of the box you get a removable and washable 'easy scrubber' (attached), 2 washable and reusable mop pads and 2 Spring Breeze Fragrance Discs which go into a packet of the mop pads and a pretty good manual that explains assembly, operation and the 2 year warranty terms. The manual mentions an optional 'carpet glider' part that's not included but should be available to order from Bissell.I was surprised how quickly the mop started to produce steam, within seconds of plugging it in, and how effective and easy to operate it was due to the swivel joint connecting the mop's body to the head. The mop travels almost effortlessly on the floor unless there is some mess to take care of in which case you may want to lower the scrubber attachment to clean the grout between tiles and/or let the mop rest on top of an area that needs some more serious sanitizing.The fragrance discs are quite... fragrant if you use a full disc but you can easily cut them and use a half or less for a more bearable 'fresh' smell. They are soap-like and one disc or half disc should last for more than one steam-mopping session once its inserted into the pad's inner pocket. Replacements can be ordered from Bissell or from Amazon:BISSELL Spring Breeze Freshening Discs, 8 inserts, 1095We are quite impressed with this product and are likely to use it on our floors.
summary: Steam mop away, young (or not) person

reviewText: this thing really works. easy to clean. you just take it to the shower, pour a little detergent on it and spray till clean, both sides.. replace. it will lift on one end if you don't fasten it down as it is very fine and can restrict the air flow a little. we had to have the house terminally cleaned as my allergies were so bad, at the same time we put this filter in the 3 air returns. I cant tell you how much better I am, I have a useful life back. and the filter is part of that.

I really like these stands. I had two of my 6 speakers on a shelf. With these I now have one on each side of the TV - what a difference! They look great meaning all you really see are the speakers, you hardly notice the black tubes.They come with the only tool you need to attach the tubes to the base.The tubes are adustable from about 27 inches to 40 by simply loosening the connection between the two pieces which works really well. The photo above is hard to see but you need to place the bend of the tube running with the LONG EDGE for stability and they won't bend or droop in carpet. I have mine completely extended and have no concerns about leaning or falling over.You can run the wires right down the tube so that they are hidden from view. My wire is a little thick so I first ran a string down then taped it to the wires and pulled them through.The only drawback to some may be the one type of bolt and wing nut to attach the speaker but in my case it worked perfectly.For the price these are a great set of speaker stands.

Love this thing. Its a lifesaver. I had an older model about 10 years old and decided to upgrade to a bissel. Worst mistake ever. After less than a year the bissel starting falling apart and breaking. This thing is made solid. No small parts that will break or spring that will pop out. Perfect if you have kids and dogs. I wouldn't call it a steamvac though as it does not generate any steam or heat. You must use hotwater.

I got this model for a wedding shower gift in 1983!It is now 25 years later, & I am still using it & it never had to be repaired, unbelievable!And, the blades are still sharp. Mine came with a book ;)Works like a charm!

I got this to help my daughter with her small NYC kitchen and the challenges that entails with organization and space. This looks nice and is low profile and not too deep, yet you can put a few things on it and get them off the counter, yet be within reach, and it is pleasing to look at visually.
summary: Another solution for tiny kitchen challenges

reviewText: Some things I learned after buying this kettle: 12-cups does not mean 12 actual 8-oz. cups.  It is 12 cups as you would see measured on a coffee maker carafe, which is 6 oz. per cup.I read a lot of people complaining about how thin the glass is.  Yes it is thin, but I don't feel like it is any thinner than a coffee maker carafe.  Gotta be careful you don't bang it into anything.I bought it mainly to brew tea for iced tea, and I was not aware that you could not put your tea bags directly in the pot.  I don't understand this warning, and I can't find any explanation anywhere as to why you should not do so, but since they warn against it I now have to pour the hot water onto the tea bags in my plastic pitcher...which is what I was trying to avoid in the first place.We have well water here, which is hard water, and after using the kettle only 3 times I noticed how foggy the glass has become.  I can clean it out with some vinegar but I would like to be able to leave the kettle sitting out on my stove between uses and not have it look 'dirty' until I get the time to vinegar-wash it.  I know I should have thought of that before I bought a clear glass kettle!Now here is the reason I wouldn't buy this again...I have an electric stove with coils.  I must use the diffuser under the kettle as per the instructions.  The transfer of heat through this diffuser is so slow that the first time I tried to boil water with the kettle 3/4 full, it took nearly an hour to boil.  I had set the stove to medium heat as recommended.  I've since learned that I have to set it on at least medium high if I want my water boiled in less than 1/2 an hour.  I don't think I'm supposed to use it on heat that high, so I'm halfway expecting this kettle to crack wide open some day soon.I really don't care about the whistling feature, but I will mention for people that do care--it is a low gentle noise, not a high-pitched whistle that you could hear throughout the house.  The first time I heard it I immediately thought of the sound of wind blowing in an empty bottle on a windy day.Since I use this kettle on the small electric coil on my stove, I have not experienced any issues with the handle getting hot or melting like some other reviewers have mentioned.  I think the key would be to always use the small burner on electric stoves, and keep the flame down on gas stoves.I think I'm going to try to find one of the old Corningware kettles to replace this pot.  Those did not require diffusers, were sturdier, and were not clear so they will hide the hard water film.

The design of this push up pop container is wonderful.  It has the tall cap instead of the flat lid.  I was doubly pleased that it is BPA free.  The seal is tight. It even holds liquids.  I am planning to make some frozen shots for a wedding party.

i LOVE this product! i didn't think there would really be a difference, but my bf told me to get this product, so i did and am so glad i took her advice. absolutely worth the purchase. i have told all by girlfriends to get one!

This is a big help but still requires strength in your hands. I bought it because I had injured my right hand and still could not open jars because I still needed more strength in my hand than I had. I can use it now.It is also hard to hold jars while turning - like salsa size or larger.
summary: It is also hard to hold jars while turning - like salsa size or larger

reviewText: I received this coffeemaker yesterday and was excited about being able to replace my present Mr. Coffee (due to what I considered some very serious design flaws).  I followed the directions for having 8 cups go through the coffeemaker prior to actually brewing coffee.  It worked great.  I then set up the coffeemaker to brew coffee for me in the morning.  I came down in the morning and nothing worked.  Even though the on light was illuminated, the maker never worked.  The only thing good about this is Amazon made it easy to return the coffeemaker for a replacement.

My plastic cookie scoop that my husband and I received as a wedding gift 7 years ago finally died.  So I decided to upgrade to a higher quality scoop and hoped that this one would meet my expectations.  So far, I am truly pleased with my purchase.  I'll be ordering the smaller size next for smaller cookies.  Great for meatballs too, if your guy likes large meatballs the way mine does.  :)  Well worth the money - I would definitely recommend this product.
summary: Really could use more than one...

reviewText: These measuring cups stack nicely, have grippy handles, and have six different sizes including the 3/4 cup size, which is nice to have.  They are a nice scoop shape so they are easy to use.  I use mine for dog food and cat food portioning.  They are fine if you want cheap everyday set up cups that won't break like glass or cost you a fortune like stainless steel.  While useful, I find them to be unremarkable, with no distinguishing features.  I think they are clunky and ugly-looking and went back to using my Tupperware set with the sizes stamped into the cup bottom.  These will make a great back up set in case my Tupperware are dirty.

We are very happy with this toaster.  It seems that the overall quality of toasters has really suffered over the years.  The Dualit works as well if not better than toasters we remember from our childhoods.

I am so tired of looking for replacement spatulas for my old ones.  Too many rubber spatulas grow hard with age, and the ones that actually clean the surface of a bowl are difficult to find!  We even went to three upscale kitchen stores and found only ONE rubber spatula that could actually work as a scraper.  And, it was $12 ! I took a chance with these, and they are super!  The handles are not flimsy, and it appears these will last a long time.
I have a Henckel knife block set that the knives are ok but I wanted a knice santoku.  So I bought a wusthof without thinking how I would store it.  Then I found this and it's awesome.
So far so good. No signs of coming off the wall. Overall, for the price we are happy with it. It is not stylish by any means but serves its purpose.
Replace the same model which we had used continuously for 5 years. That is saying a lot in the tropics. They are good fans. Lightweight, moves the air and reliably works.
I bought a king size, after reading reviews, to go on a queen size bed.  It was still much too small.  Returning it.

At times I'm annoyed with manufacturers and vendors who fail to provide important information about a product.  This urban shelf experience is one of those instances.  The instructions are lacking and are the reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5.  Please read below so you won't experience the same problem I had when I tried to put together this easy to assemble unit.In addition to the shelf, you'll receive the legs and bags containing the parts you'll need to build it.  You'll get four of each of those parts.  Pay particular attention to the legs' grooves and the bag that contains 4 pairs of interlocking rubber braces (totaling eight).  Each of those eight rubber braces, which are called cups at the Amazon website, is about two inches high.  Examine the braces carefully, for the inner side of each has a thin linear relief.  The relief has to be aligned with the leg's upper groove before you lock it around the leg with its partner.  If you do that properly, the two parts will snap snuggly around the leg.  Also, most of the legs' grooves are evenly spaced, except one at the end that allows for a longer spacing at each leg's bottom.  Ergo, the longer space is at the bottom of the table's leg and the shorter space is on the top, and it's the area where you will snap the brace onto the leg.  That brace and its leg will now slip into the table's top with ease.  If your hands are too weak to push the leg into the table shelf, you can pound it in gently with a rubber mallet.  By the way, make sure the table's top is facing in the right direction, with its skirt facing down, toward the legs.The assembled table is 16 " high and the top is 13 3/4" square.  To make it high enough for a regular table, you might want to purchase two units.  One will easily piggyback onto the other with the included hardware.  I bought two to use side by side in the tub for clothing that has to drip dry.The manufacturer does warn you not to use this shelf (or table) as a step ladder or permit children or animals on it.  Also, distribute weight evenly.  It's safe and sturdy enough for inanimate objects, such as books, dry goods, or clothing.  I live in a small apartment and I had bought the initial unit with the intention of resting the small Panda washing machine or a wash bucket in the bathroom where they could then easily drain into the tub.  I haven't used it for that purpose, however, since I'm now thinking of purchasing a larger portable washing machine.  Besides, it probably isn't sturdy enough to withstand the vibrations of a washing machine, unless the legs are restrained at the bottom with something as simple as a tightly secured rope or duct tape that will join all four legs together. That can be an eyesore.  The table is still handy to receive a pizza delivery or to rest a grocery bag while I transfer items into the refrigerator.
Use these in our rental cabin. Guests love them and my husband loves it too.  Comfy and cool.  We have two of them.
No electric blanket ever kept my wife warm.  This pad does it on  setting of 3 out 10!  If it holds up it will be great.

Got the item and it works just fine. As mentioned, you can keep it at four different temps. Added features that I appreciate are the push button water dispenser instead of the older pumps. Also there is a lock that prevents accidental dispensing of water. Nice features.

I like it! it a good size for in front of a kitchen sink.  It's comfortable and cleans easily.  I noticed complaints about it being only 1/2 inch thick. The description clearly states this and i think its fine.  If you want a gel may thicker, i am sure there are ones out there
Packaging was pretty cool. Did not have smell like other complainers stated. I was unable to fold this matress on the cheap futon frame I have. 2 person job I believe.
I love this product. It is very functional as a pitcher and stylish as well. I would recommend this to anyone, although I think this particular seller has it priced higher than when I bought it.

If you bake a lot, and find yourself using your mixer more than once a week, I definitely recommend getting an extra flat beater.  Only you know how often you are reaching to quickly wash off one beater in time to make that second batch of something delicious.  For me, it happened all the time.  No more!  My mixer bowl still holds the two flat beaters, bread hook and whisk beaters while in storage.  I recommend keeping things simple and just having an extra flat beater on hand if you use your mixer a lot.
summary: It's so nice to have any extra beater on hand!

reviewText: I've been baking French bread all my adult life and thought this would simplify the proofing but it is not even as useful as pieces of parchment pulled up between the loaves because this pan still allows the loaves to touch and then grow together. Save your money and buy a large rolled box of parchment, which is much more flexible as to size of the loaves you wish to create, and allows closer contact with your baking stone, too.
summary: Rather a waste of money - too expensive for the cost

reviewText: Tall whisks and spoons are top heavy in this caddy but smaller tools that get lost in the standard caddy are perfect in this one.
Using it to put a two wick candle on that doesn't have a holder. Not super heavy duty but works well for reflecting light for those little crystal knick knacks or candles.

Light weight, great suction for a 1 bedroom apartment with hard wood floors throughout. Also decent suction on bathroom rugs, 5 by 7 area rug. Only complaint is that the wire is a little too short, have to re-plug in each room

I have the DC 35, which is basically this machine in a stick vac. I've been dreaming of a machine that would let me vacuum and mop at the same time. The DC 56 does a pretty good job of that, although it isn't perfect.The lack of an on/off switch is shared with the DC 35 and almost caused me to return that unit. Due to hand and wrist pain there is literally no way I can use a machine that I have to squeeze the entire time it is running. With the DC 35 I sewed some Velcro on a strap; with the DC 56 I made a strap with snaps on it. If you don't sew, you might be able to use a spring clamp or cable tie.I agree with some comments that the vacuum function is impaired compared to the DC 35. I'm not sure if it's the squeegee plastic getting in the way or the opening isn't large enough or what. However, I do not have a lot of pet hair, just dirt and fir needles tracked in by my husband and things dropped on the floor in the course of cooking or eating. For those things, the DC 56 does an adequate job.As far as the mopping function, I won't use the Dyson pads. I'll just continue to do what I've done with the swiffer - I made my own microfiber pads (super easy if you have a serger; otherwise you can cut to size and overcast or zigzag the edges). If you don't sew, look online, there are lots of places to purchase reusable microfiber pads. The DC 56 will fit a swiffer-sized pad. I put about a quarter cup of vinegar in a measuring cup and fill the rest with water. I put the cloth in and then squeeze it out and put it on the machine. As I go around the house, I carry the measuring cup and periodically just pour a little more water on the pad. That way no issues about lack of moisture and I don't have to squeeze anything like a spray bottle.My biggest criticism about the DC 56 is the battery. With the DC 35, it pops right out. I bought a spare so I always have one charged, and I know I won't have to landfill the machine once the battery dies out. With the DC 56, the battery does not appear to be removable and the manual says to call Dyson if you ever need to replace the battery. I both called and e-mailed - the people on the phone said it is user replaceable but you will have to use a screwdriver; the e-mail people said it is not recommended to be replaced by the user. When I replied to the e-mail asking about what I had been told over the phone they said it was not recommended for users to replace the battery but it would be possible. There's still no information about this issue on the Dyson website. I almost returned it because of that issue.After giving it a good test, though, I am going to keep it. Bottom line it does an adequate if not perfect job of allowing me to vacuum and mop my hard floors with one pass, and it saves me time and work and leaves my floors looking nice.Dyson, if you're listening, here's my wish list for your next version: 1) please do a combination of the DC 35 and the DC 56 so I can have one unit and just switch out the head depending on whether I want to mop or just vacuum; 2) please add an on/off switch; 3) please improve the vacuum function with the mop head; 4) make the battery is user replaceable like the DC 35.
summary: A good machine but needs some improvements

reviewText: We have a 7x5' bathroom which leaves very little elbow room or storage space. We needed something easy and small to help store toiletries in the shower, and this totally did the trick. It works great (exactly as advertised) and so far hasn't shown any signs of rust. It looks nice and works well. That's all we wanted.Update: After holding strong for a few months, this thing bit the dust in epic fashion. It committed caddy suicide by launching itself off of the wall and onto the floor of the tub. Initially I assumed it had simply been too heavy or needed to be cleaned. After cleaning it and the tile, and removing the heavier items it was holding, I reattached it to the wall.It should be noted that on the occasion the caddy fell, our cat was in the bathroom attempting to do his business. Initially, I suspected no malice on the part of the OXO caddy. However, it soon became clear that there was some sort of kitty vendetta in effect.After reassuring the cat that the bathroom was indeed safe, he mustered up the courage to once again attempt to go. Without fail, the caddy came crashing down once more, this time disassembling itself in spectacular fashion. The cat, naturally, bolted and decided that the bathroom was booby trapped. As a pet owner, this mindset was of particular concern. After examining the caddy and confirming that it was indeed in pieces, I decided that the third time was not, in fact, the charm, and decided that it would be better suited in the trash.The cat supervised all of this, staring at the OXO caddy with a mixture of fear and contempt. As the caddy found its way to its new home in the recycling bin, he would periodically check on it, perhaps to confirm that it was still there, and to mock it for its failure.We replaced this product with a tension corner caddy and so far, that's worked out much better.
summary: Perfect Caddy for our '50's bathroom - UPDATED: Hates cats

reviewText: It could cut from very thin food item like tortillas to steamed carrots and tofu.I like the size of the mold, I could make a few different decoration fora bento lunch, with different color and shapes. Nice.
This product was nice and I thought the quality of the fabric was excellent.  Had the look of a custom made pillow sham.

So the title essentially covers it: AWFUL product- poorly designed, and the "FastLock technology" should be abandoned like the failure it is. Thanks to another reviewer, I finally tried pulling the two sections apart, manually twisting the black and white plastic inserts (counter to the 'righty-tighty' rule, based on the way the label was facing) until it was almost too big to fit into the other tube. Then I crammed them back together, put the rod where I wanted it, and then twisted it a little more to FINALLY lock it into place. This, btw, was only after fiddling with the stupid thing over a 2-day period before reading the review  describing how to dismantle and tinker with it. A stinking tension rod SHOULD just be 'twist-and-lock', not endlessly twist until you're exhausted and then still have to take it apart and rig it yourself so you can actually use it. Now that it's up, it looks fine, but I'd never buy it again. (Shame on me, b/c I always read reviews, but this time I did not-- when I came back to 'trouble-shoot' and see if I was the only one frustrated w/this junky product, I realized nope, not just me-- I should never have bought this.)
summary: Awful, but I finally got it to work...

reviewText: Recently OXO has been redesigning products and putting out new products and so far, I have no complaints. This steamer is great! I love it! Before this one, I was using just one of those expandable metal ones...which was fine, but this one because of the little legs and the flexibility can sit both at the bottom, closer to the water (and therefore steam) or at the top, like my old metal one does. Because it's able to sit closer to the water I can steam things faster. It's also great at holding more awkward shapes. When I pull out the basket the handles are cool and it's very easy to carry and much prettier than the metal one. Sometimes I just set the whole basket on a plate and put the plate on the table...my guests think it's "fun"!

Bought this a few years ago.  It off-gases something from the production process and it used to be very strong and unpleasant.  Now the level of off-gassing is low but if you hold it up to your nose it still smells.  The divider system inside is adjustable, but isn't very high so I imagine the bottles could strike each other with rough handling... I carry it carefully.  I use it, but all in all I just don't recommend it at all.

I have a nasty habit of leaving pizza cutters in the pizza box and then they get thrown out -- so was very happy to be able to receive this one...However, like others here, I had no idea what I was getting when I opened the box.  This thing is HUGE and heavy.  I can honestly say that with the heft and weight, I doubt I will make the mistake of carrying out a pizza box with this hiding in side.It has great balance and feel and does a great job (if not a bit overkill) cutting pizza.  Calling it a pizza cutter is kind of like calling a swiss army knife just a pocket knife... it can be used for chopping vegetables (mincing onions is a breeze with this), cutting through casseroles or pie or even if you want to use cookie dough mix that comes in the tube and you want to slice nice precise round circles.Would I CHOOSE to purchase this?  Not sure... Julia Child I am not!  However, it makes a great gift -- a bit of a simple pleasure/luxury item for the foodie in your life.[NCJVR]
summary: The Lexus/Swiss Army Knives of Pizza Cutters!

reviewText: Perhaps you could save your money and ask someone whistle in your face.  That would be about as powerful as this fan.
summary: You could pass gas and catch a stronger breeze.

reviewText: This is the second set of knives in this line I've owned. The first set was the 15 piece set.They are stamped steel, which is reflected in the cost. I was very happy with my previous set, and used the honing steel on them probably every 3 uses. Not every single time, and sharpened them properly about every 6 months. They have no rust spots, and have been used extensively and regularly for about a year.This set has more knives, in sizes and shapes that I'm already getting a lot of use from. I like the lighter weight, as long as they are kept honed and sharpened as needed, the blades can do the cutting without having to power through with weight. Like my previous set, I'm finding that honing every few uses is working out just right to keep the blades aligned and cutting easily.The shears are fantastic. They come apart easily for cleaning. I use them all the time, to cut corn tortillas to make baked corn chips, on boneless skinless chicken breasts and thighs for soup, to cut the shells on lobster tails and to cut herbs for cooking.The description is accurate.
