Full tang with riveted handles. I recommend hand washing for all kitchen knives. The light colored block and black handles are attractive.

About 15 years ago, I purchased a Chef's Choice knife sharpener.  It was good, lasted a long time, but finally wore out and had to be replaced.  I looked at several sharpening methods, talked with experts, and considered my previous experience.  I ruled our sharpening by hand - it looks like there is a learning curve, and good stones don't come cheap.  When the new sharpener arrived, I was surprised that you only have one "grinding station" for normal knives.  The second station puts on the burr you need for a good cutting knife.  I was skeptical. But, when I tried it, it sharpened ALL my kitchen knives to better-than-new condition.  Even the cheap ones -- Also did a great job on my old Chinese chopper!  I love this sharpener, and look forward to many years of use.  It seems to be built just as strong as my old sharpener - and works much better.
These are to noisy, and really don't give a lot of heat.  Additionally, the 'flame' is really not at all pleasing to look at, which is part of why I wanted these for small areas.

OXO makes terrific kitchen gadgets and tools. They are very comfortable in the hand (especially for those with big hands like I have). These measuring cups are well constructed, nicely and clearly identified by size, nest nicely, and have terrific grips. Specific Devanagari: the flat bottom let's one place them down on the counter with ingredients in them, unlike so many others with rounded bottoms. And I am sure they will last virtually forever. (Dishwasher safe too).
Works well and fits my decor perfectly. Items sometimes slip through the slots in the sides but thats to be expected. Easy to clean and fits all my utensils perfectly.

I have dropped it, submerged it, and sent it though an industrial dishwasher.  I like this model more than the bulb head because it has lasted longer and is smaller.  I think the streamlined design allows it to better survive drops.  This is my favorite thermometer brand.  Customer service is exceptional.

This big mug is my new favorite kitchen gadget.  It's nice and big for those cool evenings with hot Earl Grey but I have had a good and bad experience with it.  The bad:  I was washing the mug in the sink and it must have slipped less than an inch from my hands into the sink.  The little lip on the handle that sticks out at the bottom broke right off.  The good is that the tea-squeezing top is quite functional.  I was eating a scone while my tea was brewing, and I was able to lift the top, drop the bag into the center and gently squeeze the teabag -- all with the use of one hand.  I never put down the scone in the other hand! I know that this "trick" is probably useless to many of you, but it serves to offer an idea of how easy it is to use.

Refurbished a bathroom recently . Wanted a hand held shower head, partly to wash my dogs in the tub. I searched every home improvement store within 50 miles of home. No-one stocked an adjustable caddy like this. I purchased other caddies but they would not accommodate the hose. I did see this one in a store website but it was almost twice the price. I buy value sized bottles of shampoo and conditioner from a Club store and the caddy holds them well

Some people have made this towel rack out to be cumbersome topsy-turby . Because of this I was a little worried about buying the paper towel holder. Thankfully, I did not believe their statements. This is a nice towel rack holder. It stands just fine and looks nice in the kitchen. I'm not rough with it but than again I'm in the kitchen not the garage.

I have been looking for a simple, cotton blanket for a while - 100% cotton is a must have for hot & humid Florida weather.The package arrived in an under-sized box (taped with great care) very quickly (2 days + weekend). I was a bit scared after seeing the box and the word "brown" on an interior label as I had purchased "camel."  I was extremely pleased that it was indeed camel which has a bit of gold in it, so it was more than perfect for our decor. It looks so nice tucked into our side rails that we've opted to remove our comforter completely for spring, summer, & fall. It's made in India and if you've ever been it's alot like Florida - but hotter!The weave is loose and breathes wonderfully. It can be picked easily, but with careful tugging all strands are easily put back in shape, and would be after a wash and dry at any rate. This is after having two small dogs which "nest" in blankets using claws to arrange their space!It shrinks a little when placed on medium high heat in dryer, but as cotton will, it relaxed enough to fit our very deep select-comfort mattresses - enough to tuck in at both sides & bottom. It also shed a TREMENDOUS amount in the dryer - I had to clear lint catch three times (which I saved to send back to seller in case I was unhappy with the product. I guess I can throw that away now :)  We have deep red sheets which the blanket does lint on, but it's worth it.After one night, we slept beautifully, cozy, yet cool which is hard to do in Florida.  Hubby said "buy a few more" ... So I am. Great product for the price - it depends on your needs. This is perfect for us.

After reading the other reviews, I decided to give these a shot.  I love the scissors absolute tons, they work for everything I need them for.  My only gripe is this:  why do I need a pair of scissors to open a pack of scissors?!?!

And rolls for Tuna Salad, Chicken Salad, etc.  Not too much bread to overwhelm whatever filling is in it.  I have loved New England Hot Dog Rolls my entire life and cannot find them where I live.  The rolls made in this pan are exactly what my husband (from Portland, Maine) have been looking for.  We made them for a recent family cookout and everyone raved about them and wanted to know where we got the pan and recipe (We used King Arthur Flour recipe and also their gluten free bread mix for my gluten free needs).

Pepper shaker is fine. Salt shaker has two issues: 1. when the salt is dry, it flows out quickly in a large column. Makes it hard to control the salt and "spread" it evenly on a dish. 2. It didn't take long for humidity to do it's thing... salt clogged up in this shaker. So much for that.

I can't believe I'm reviewing a kettle, however this product is so bad I just have to warn all of you from getting it. It showed me that even when designing a kettle, there's a lot to think of. What's so bad about this one?* The handle gets hot so it's almost impossible to use the kettle after boiling water* the whistle sound is too weak* when boiling a small amount of water (which you would typically want to be doing if you're just using it for 2-3 cups) you need to tilt the kettle a lot for pouring the water which can get dangerous* the top is not easy enough to open* filling it up is not as easy as it should beKitchen Aid makes great mixers (I have one) but this one is just an awful product. I would return it but I don't have the receipt...
summary: One of the most poorly designed products I've ever seen

reviewText: The base of this holder is heavier than I thought it'd be. The unit is overall eye pleasing, which I don't think was coinsidental. I am satisfied with my purchase and it shipped in excellent timing.

I bought 2 of these units for my apartment.  On low you don't know they are running.  On high they are like white noise, a low hum, but they put out a lot of air.  After 2 days I am already noticing a decrease in the amount of dust in my apartment.  I think I'll buy another one so that I don't have to move them around so much from room to room.  The units are lightweight and easy to move around and they are not so bulky that you cannot easily find a place to park them while they eat dust.
summary: A sturdy and basic HEPA air cleaner

reviewText: I ordered the 25 pack. They shipped fast, and I had no problems with them, none were broken, and they are sturdy enough to hold sweaters/jeans. I have about 200 of these and none (from this company or others) have broken.

I received this product free to review for my honest opinion . I could not wait to receive this cooking thermometer to use it. great quality  I love the fact that it is easy to read and is digital . Love the fact that I can use this on all kinds of meats and actually know when when my meat is done cooking. I will recommend this product.
summary: Works great and easy to use !!!!

reviewText: Bought these for my husband and for myself.  So much easier when we are both cooking to have two pairs handy to cover both of us.

if you leave the toaster plugged in all the time, the led display is on all the time, which is a waste of energy for those of us who don't toast every day.  also, as others have said, the plug is a nuisance in tight spaces because it sticks out so much. yes, it's easier to pull out that way, but it takes up too much space and if they had an on/off button one wouldn't have to keeping plugging and replugging.  i am sending this back.

Bought this for my daughter's 14th birthday. Wasn't sure how she'd react to getting a blanket for her birthday. To my delight she was thrilled.  She says its so cozy and so incredibly warm.  She takes it with her when she spends the night elsewhere.  Now my other daughter wants one for Christmas.

We are a family of 5 and we were able to fit 2.5 weeks worth of clothes in 2 large suitcases by using these space bags. We ended using two boxes of the space bags (so a total of 10 bags).We pack each person's clothes in separate bags and put a label in each bag (facing outward so you can read the label without opening the bag). The label has the person's name and what is in the bag. That way we can reach for the bag that has exactly what we need.To take the air out of the bags, we usually lay the bag on the floor and then just lay ourselves across the bag. Essentially, we pretend we are Superman on the bag. It's the quickest way to get the majority of air out of the bag and best way to still keep the clothes in the same spot you placed it in the bag. Then we finish off by rolling the bag to get the little bit of air out.

I bought this iron hoping for a more powerful steam stream than my old iron.  I do get more steam and NO LEAKS as advertised which is great because my old iron sputtered frequently.  I am not sure what I think about the "lifting" feature of the iron-that is odd and a little tricky and takes getting used to.  The iron heats up HOT and quickly which I like.  So far I don't have many complaints.

If you are going to roast a chicken, this is must have product.  It saves time and really works.  Just place as directed on the instructions given with the Ronco roaster.  I will continue buying this product.

I had the Bonjour mini frother for 3 years until my baby threw it down the stairs. I got this one on sale thinking it was even more stylish & sturdy. It is a little better looking with the stand, but the button is a little recessed and very awkward to hold down. I have to use 2 hands which defeats the purpose - with one hand firmly gripping the body and the opposite thumb pushing down hard on the little button, I can't get it into cups of milk. Also, this one "stalls" and stops whenever it pushes too hard on the side of the cup. The mini frother was so much easier and more user-friendly - I'm giving this one away and getting the cheaper one again.
summary: Difficult to hold button; no better than cheaper version

reviewText: I looked at what seemed to be a million blenders.  I do a lot of vegan and raw foods but I didn't want to spend upwards of $400.  I love this blender!  It has handled everything I hoped it would, including frozen fruits for smoothies.  It is very quiet for a blender.  I like the die-cast base, the simple controls (who really needs 14 settings?), and the pulse setting.  The only minor flaw is the difficulty in getting out the last 1/4 cup of whatever I've made.  Overall, I very much recommend this blender.

I was apprehensive at first since the box was delivered partially open with many loose pieces inside the box - the bag of connection materials was broken open and the nuts, bolts, washers and screws were all scattered. Thankfully everything was still in the box. The long narrow box is very heavy. I emptied out all the pieces individually so I could carry everything to an upstairs bedroom for assembly. Once everything was laid out it was very easy to put together. I only had an issue with the slats pieces - needing a hammer to get them in place, it was a very tight fit but worked out well. I did use a screw gun to secure all of the slat pieces, there are a lot of screws (was short one). I think doing that portion by hand would have been a pain. The covering goes over the top and sides. It's loose until you pull the cord and then it tightens well enough to stay in place and looks neat. I am happy with this purchase and found this box spring to be a nice alternative to one already assembled.

These are really nice kitchen tools.  They have quite a heft to them and the handles are nice and chunky.  The should hold up very well.  The manufacturer recommends hand washing, but my guess that is more to preserve the shine than they won't hold up to the temperatures of the dishwasher.  The food prep utensils are supposed to be safe to 550*.The cake server does have a serrated edge.  It is only on one side, so if you hold it in your left hand, that edge won't be down for you.  I am left handed, but I tend to use my right hand for things like this.  Comes from growing up when there were no scissors or can openers for us (yes, I am old!).  The spoons, both slotted and solid, are a nice size with deep bowls.  The spatula isn't huge, but I find the big ones really don't work well in a small skillet.  These tools will work nicely.
no drips or spills; keeps ice overnight; fits in car cup holder. good looking design, but WHY the key ring on handle?
summary: Throw Out Your Other Travel Mugs

reviewText: These are strong, well built and spring-loaded. Twisting a bag tight, and the clip holds it tight. I have noticed it keeps bread fresh longer. Lots of other good uses for these clips such as  rice, nuts, beans, dried fruit, frozen foods and more. Great buy! Worth the money!

I bought the 12-by-16-inch version of the cutting board because I got tired of the small cutting boards at home, and this one is nice! The board is big enough that things aren't constantly falling off it, yet not super big that it's clunky to use.The board has bamboos going in two different directions and the board has 3 layers of bamboo. It remains to be seen how this is going to discourage morphing because I only had the board for a month.People were complaining about the 4 little bumps on each edge to raise the board off your counter, and some say when they're chopping things the board kept jumping. I did not have this problem. My board remained in place while I chopped things, so I'm not sure how much force these people are using to make the board jump. Maybe they should upgrade their knives.

THIS WAS THE PERFECT LITTLE SIZE WE NEEDED FOR THE SIDE OF THE COUCH!!  PERFECT SIZE IN HEIGHT AND THE EXTRA ADDED SHELF ON THE BOTTOM GIVES US A PLACE FOR A BASKET WITH BOOKS THAT WE HAVE RIGHT NEXT TO WEAR WE SIT!!

Bought these for a guest bathroom.  They are thick and big for the price you pay.  I was very pleased with the quality verse the amount of cash I put out for them.  I haven't tried washing them yet, though.

I've tried many different methods, ingredients and times with this thing so far and its so easy to use and gives great results. The best part is that clean up is so easy and takes only seconds.This one came with the filters even though it didn't specifically say so.Its pretty easy to make a really good cup of coffee with the AeroPress I recommend it.
not using these for storage as was intended by manufacturer but rather at the office for a different requirement and they are fine. bought 2 and am pleased with the quality

Nicely done, these came after getting them for $25.00 on a lightning deal here on Amazon.  They are lovely and look like the picture.  The coffee press and glasses were a bit larger than I anticipated but I it was a welcome surprise.The only thing I noticed with the quality was that the bottom of the press is snapped together with the side, so it isn't one piece but two.  Overall I'm happy with my order and the quality esp. at $25.00I am not please with the shipping and packaging.  These were for a gift and came in a box with no padding whatsoever.  The box was ripped so I have to send it back as it looks like I picked up the box up at a garage sale.So the quality of the products were great, but the shipping and packaging were not.  Sending it back for replacement, so I can give it as a gift and have it look nice and new.I recommend, just be aware of the shipping and packaging.UPDATE 11-15-12:  I returned my unit for a brand new one and the packaging was not torn nor tattered.  I'm still surprised they shipped this again without any cushion.  Lucky for me I got it in one piece.  Great Buy!Vidimo Se!
Does the job quite well. Just take your time & let the weight of the knife do the sharpening. No need to press hard. Get the right angle, keep your wrist rigid & your blades will be very sharp.

I ordered this as a gift for my sister. She wanted a pan that she could put in the oven so that she could make Frittatas. I was a little nervous when I first opened it because it was humungous! My sister loves it though and her Frittatas turn out well. She has a standard size oven range and she says it heats evenly and fits fine in her oven.
summary: Big, but works with standard oven range

reviewerName: Amazon Customer "Not all who wander are lost-...
reviewText: Looking forward to a small-bowl processor with all the extras like the hand blender for smoothies and the whisk for egg whites, I tried this gadget out on a few different things. That is what it's for, after all, use on different foods in different applications. That's why it comes with so many different attachments, and claims to have 5-speed turbo. Sounds like great options and versatility! Here's my opinion about the instructions of use and my experience using it.The instruction booklet isn't well-organized.  I found myself flipping back and forth through the pages trying to learn which blade to use for which function:  Photo page, chart with each blade, "Blade" pages, or reading little 'tips' on random pages. The emphasis in the instruction book seems to be on the product before the function.  For example, there should be a listing of functions, such as "Whipping egg whites, cream, frosting,..." then indicate the Aerator Blade.There are some confusing instructions: P. 5 PicaTutto blade "Crush" lists Frozen Drinks.  P. 8 shows the MiTutto in the beaker with what appear to be ice cubes.  Pg. 14 states "To Crush Ice Use the food processor to crush ice".With 6 different attachments, it seems as though this product is trying to do too many things with too many pieces.  I would prefer less blades and one or two that are more versatile. However, the blade-removal tool does work perfectly and easily. Also, I would prefer the numbers on top for speeds be painted or somehow easier to see.I would not utilize the wall-mount bracket at all.  With all the pieces that need to be stored, it's just as easy to store everything in a drawer or cabinet put away.The puree function of the processor bowl was exceptional on cooked pumpkin. After 6 uses, the "ON" button doesn't work, only the Turbo.  It has been used to puree, whip egg whites, and make smoothies with small frozen fruit. These are hardly the foods which would exhaust a motor, and yet, it's exhausted. At this point, I can't use this product since it quit working on the normal speeds.Overall, this is a kitchen tool trying to do too many things with too many pieces and not enough power. I will look for something simpler and hopefully more reliable.
summary: Worked great 6 times, then it didn't

reviewText: I love boiled eggs but hate them so hard they look green or so soft they may as well be raw so this ames the guess out.  If you like them with the whites done and the yolks soft, I cook them to between the sift and medium and immediately run them under ice cold water-they are perfect every time.

As previous reviewers have stated, these towels only get softer with every wash.  Extremely absorbent, and ribbed cotton towels are simply the best. The price is right on these for commercial use, as well.

Had to replace a much loved tea kettle and wasn't able to find the same one.  After scoring all the reviews at Amazon I finally settled on this one.  While I'm not crazy about the shape, it works just fine!  We're daily tea kettle users.  No dripping.  Easy to fill (we always fill in the middle...handle easily moves to the side, yet is still secure enough on top to pour with).  Has a nice whistle.  Handle is not hot for pouring.  Heats up water just like the old one.

I purchased another juicer at a nearby store (Target) and used it once a day to make carrot juice. I wasn't thrilled at how loud it was but dealt with it. The on/off button stopped turning it on so I returned it vowing never again from these folks. Recently my mate came home with a Jack-La-Lane (Costco) and couldn't believe how much quieter it is and supplies me with less gritty juice, unlike the other joke of a machine. I wanted to buy this here, which is why I mentioned the stores, but felt others should know.

I'm a brand new "juicer" and after watching various documentaries on food, I just had to pull the trigger.I've used this for about 5 juicing sessions so far and it has been great! I clean up immediately after I am done, so I don't have to deal with any caked on food. Clean up can be annoying, but such is life! Anyone who complained about the cleanup process has to realize that there is no easy way to do it. Unless you have some magical $5,000 self-cleaning juicer, suck it up! Seems to be a great value for what I paid!

This is a great knife.  It's a very handy, usable size, sharp, and a good weight.  It's perfect for slicing meats, such as ham or a firm roast.  It is also a good size for chopping vegetables or nuts.  It is dishwasher safe but I would hand wash is just to avoid dulling.  If you don't have hundreds to invest in quality knives, this is a nice, reasonable alternative.  I am very pleased with my purchase of this, the paring knife set, and the 4-1/2-Inch Round Tip, Wavy Edge Knives I've recently bought.  Watch for deals and dropped prices and I think you will be too.

There's no doubt that this unit is the very top-of-the-line, the Cadillac of mixers. I own the colbalt blue model, which was a birthday gift from my wife. (Actually, I would have selected a different color but I wasn't about to complain!)Before you buy one, do you have a place to put it? Mine resides on top of the refrigerator in my small galley-type kitchen. If you have limited counter space, it eats up quite a bit of room if you plan to keep it there. It won't set on top of your microwave oven unless you have a big commercial unit -- it's simply too heavy and might cause problems with the microwave. If it's stored in any spot not protected from dust, then you'll need to buy a cover for it right away. These are available as an accessory but my mother-in-law made one for me and it works great.I cook from scratch mostly about five out of seven days, I'm retired and my wife still works full-time. She likes to cook (and bake) on weekends. I use the KitchenAid about once every two weeks and my wife uses it with about the same frequency. If she's just doing a little job, she grabs her older hand-held electric blender with the pop-off beaters and that way she doesn't have to get the small stepladder and wield the HEAVY KitchenAid from the top of the fridge. We pretty much reserve it for bigger jobs.If there's going to be several batches of cookies made or bread dough whipped up, then it's for certain a KitchenAid job. I also make bulk amounts of Italian salad dressing with the Kitchenaid which has to emulsify over a 20-30 minute period -- with the KitchenAid, this is a hands-off process, easy.I also use a meat grinder attachment for making up four-pound batches of ham salad spread. This attachment is an extra 50 bucks but well-worth it. My brother uses this same attachment plus one other unit to make home-made Italian link sausage and it's well up to that job too.The KitchenAid is a breeze to clean, with no difficult hideaway places to have to dig dough out of. The dough hook, blender, and whip are just dropped into the dish water and they clean right up, very easy.This unit will do a great deal more than I'm using it for. Any KitchenAid Mixer will last for years and years, a lifetime I'd say.So, to finalize, I give the KitchenAid Mixer my highest recommendation:1. ...so long as you can afford it along with any additional necessary attachments, and,2. ...so long as you have a convenient place to store it.
summary: Things to consider when buying a KitchenAid Mixer

reviewText: I'm not sure why I follow everyone else's reviews so carefully. My mistake in that this cutting board is too small for my needs, and it is well over-priced. The worst part is that it slides around on my ceramic countertops. It looks nice, but I am giving away as brand new to a needy family sponsored through work. I'm sure they will love it -- I do not.
I have this hanging over my bed, and I bought a poster frame to put it in, and it's absolutely beautiful! It goes great in my room, and it looks like you're looking out a window.

I must to admit to using  two of these ; one of these for bread baking and one of them for soap making. For each type of use these work - and work well!Breads brown well and slip out easily.Soaps come out clean and uniformAll in all, a great addition to the baker's shelf or the soap makers tool box!

They are $25 sheets. I will start by saying that I will never buy these again. I would spring for a set that is $10 more, maybe. They are soft. But, they are paper thin. They also don't breathe well. I sweat more with them. HOWEVER, they are $25. If you're on a limited budget, they're soft. The color is exactly like the photo. It's kind of a seafoam, powder blue. It's kind of a cheap color. Definitely no frills.

Shun's blades are among the best,  Ken Onion's ergonomics and handle feel and balance are among the best.  Great knife.  This is my second.  Since Ken no longer designs for Shun these will eventually be impossible to obtain.  Since this is one of my favorite knives I bought one for strategic reserve.
Received teapot without the tea then they finally sent the tea. It is lovely, butthe Teapot itself could be a little larger or offer two sizes.  Glad I purchased it though.
This bar mat is perfect to make drinks on so my wooden bar cart does not get stained. Easy to clean.

My son's class was able to bring in magnets to decorate their lockers at school.  I found this on Amazon and thought I would buy it.  I also bought different seasonal magnets.  All the kids loved this in his class (3rd grade).  That was 3 years ago.  It is now on my refrigerator and my kids although now older still every so often stop to work the gears on it.

I have one of these mixers.  It does not have the tilt that this one has and has a weaker motor.  My daughter liked mine and said she had always wanted a stand mixer since she uses only a handheld.  I ordered this from Amazon for her at Christmas and got a better mixer for a cheaper price than I paid for mine at Sams wholesale and I did not have to pay shipping.  Great deal.

I assembled this product myself without too much trouble.  I filled it with clothing, and the next day the whole thing fell apart.  Some of the poles were bent and broken so it cannot be fixed.  Waste of time and money - very frustrating.  Do not buy.
summary: piece of junk - do not buy

reviewText: This scale is flawed by design IMO. It won't work on carpets, even hard thin carpets, you'll get different reading every time.Move it an inch, same result, different reading.I tried it in every room in the house, I got different readings every time, by up to 70 LB difference!Granted my floors are not perfect, but I never had such an issue with a scale.The culprit here IMO is in their pressure sensing mechanism, which is built into the bottom of the scale and facing the surface the scale is on.This is a very optimistic assumption, that everyone has a perfect floor. I lived in 7 different apartments in NYC and never had a perfect floor.Unless you're confident that your floor is perfectly straight, stay away from this scale.As for the built quality and overall feel, this is actually a very attractive, solidly built thin scale(that's why 2 stars and not 1).It's a shame I have to send it back.
summary: Buy only for perfectly straight floors!

reviewText: Hard boiled eggs with the yolk over easy was a hard thing for me to do until I got this kitchen helper.  You need an average sized egg for the timing to be right but it's easy to adapt to larger or smaller eggs with a little practice.

I've had it for a total of 24 hours and I'm quite impressed. I've viewed a great deal of flimsy plastic garbage cans in Walmart and other major retailers. I've been through many of them myself, metal and plastic. They all end up breaking after a short time of use and you can usually tell the longevity of a can within the first few hours I've noticed.This bin is made for pets, but I purchased it because I have a toddler. Having a locking lid is INCREDIBLY useful when he decides he wants to start yarding on the pedal. All I need to do is click it closed and no more up and down of the lid for my boy.The lever is incredibly simple, just a metal rod that connects to a few different areas. The plastic is quite thick and slightly elastic. Plastic that is elastic, rather than rigid, has a longer lifetime as it's less prone to cracking.Lastly, the opening mechanism is very quiet. A plus for me. It opens all the way and then slowly closes, no slamming of the lid once your foot leaves the pedal, giving you time to throw more things in if needed.A smart design, a fair price and I'm satisfied with my purchase. My mum has an automatic bin that rarely works and she's jealous of mine now.

My old (6 months) can opener quit opening smoothly and made a mess in the process. I wanted something with quality as the first priority and this for the bill: American made, 25 year life, simple no frills design. The first time I used it I exclaimed "butter!" It glided through the heavy top of a large can of whole tomatoes not missing a beat. It gets daily use and shows no signs of slowing down. It doesn't get much better than this!
These place mats are perfect for our breakfast table.  They are attractive and easy to keep clean. We use them every day.
These are great!  All the sizes I needed and a good value.  I haven't used them with high heat yet, but I'm pretty confident they can handle it!

Pretty cup - sent in a nice presentation bag.  It keeps the cat away from my toothbrush, which is always nice.  It is small, so it's not going to hold a really heavy or tall bunch of things.  But perfect for me!
summary: It would make a nice gift

reviewText: After years of making less expensive knife sets work, we are very happy to finally replace a block set with 3 quality sharp kitchen  knives.  Items arrived quickly and happy with the change.
Very good grinders.  it smashes that salt and pepper up just like it should.  Adjustable dial to change the size of the end product.  Easy to refill. Looks great too.

It is pretty funny that a SEEN ON TV item would be actually workable and liked,  but this one is the exception.  I am a gadget freak but really do love this.  It chops things fast and almost effortlessly and actually is pretty easy to clean with the little brush thing they include.  I do recommend it as a great helper in the kitchen.

This set really surprised me. For the money, you get a nicely weighted set of knives and a pair of scissors, and really, it's very simple to put the block together.The scissors could have been "finished" a little better, as the rubber handles exhibited some rough edges from its assembly. The knives, though, are very sharp, and you can balance the handle of the largest knife on one finger without any trouble. I liked that!Overall, a nice set. While the knife block isn't fabulous (the knives occasionally lean over in their holders), it's definitely eye catching. For the money you really can't complain!Tip for putting the knife block together: Use a pair of latex/cleaning gloves otherwise you'll have fingerprints behind the glass that you'll never be able to get rid of without disassembling the block.4 out of 5.
summary: Great first set of knives, block just "OK."

reviewText: the hooks it comes with are nice and thin making you closet door close with ease unless you door frame is tight to the door.  i bought two of these one for an adult and a childs room.  kids shoes pending on size can both fit in one slot maximizing storage.  over all not a bad item

I was skeptical that this would work, considering the low price. Happy to report that I was very pleasantly surprised!  The machine arrived very quickly, was packaged well, and included all the parts including six cones and a measuring spoon.I couldn't find any floss sugar locally so I used regular granulated sugar and it was great!! Following instructions and letting it pre-heat, we got big fluffy cotton candy clouds. One scoop (approx 1 tsp) resulted in one fluffy cone.  For any additional cones you have to turn off the machine, wait for it to stop spinning, refill, and turn it back on again. For a home machine it's really awesome. Cleanup is annoying but not unmanageable after soaking in warm soapy water. Would definitely recommend for home use.The instructions say you can use flavored drink mixes but I noticed that those didn't come out as good. We used Kool Aid drinks in different flavors mixed with white sugar and it didn't come out well at all - it clogged the machine and made clumps. Will be purchasing floss sugar online for flavor/color and using only that and regular granulated.
The price was right and these store easily.  Cookies and candy slide right off so no need for waxed paper.
I did not pay attention that these are MINI cups.  I was expecting standard/larger size.  BUT that is my fault for not READING the info.  Still a great price and I will use these!

I just received these tongs, but the weight is good, and they look like good quality. They are like ones I had years ago that were so useful. I'm happy to have found them so reasonably priced.I do most of my online shopping with Amazon, because of the quality of their products and vendors.

The photo for this item shows 4 curtain rings but the organizer doesn't come with them, you have to use your own hooks/rings.  But as for doing what it needs to do, it holds a lot of stuff securely.  However, it can add a cluttered look to your shower and can look a bit bulky (my husband bumps into it a lot), but if you have NO shower shelf space to put bottles of shampoo and body wash and your razor and your exfoliation gloves, etc etc, a cluttered looking organizer is the last thing on your mind, right?  Because it's better than putting all that stuff on the floor, hands down.  Great for those little RV showers or if your house/apartment has a small shower (or if you have an old-school freestanding tub with a shower curtain around it... this organizer will be a blessing!).
summary: If you have no shelf space, this'll do the job

reviewText: I remembered the Corelle my mother used to have holding up well to abuse, so I decided to replace my old tempered-glass dish set (with many missing pieces) with these. I didn't want heavy dishes because I have arthritis and am not getting any younger.Instead of buying a boxed set of so many place settings, I opted for the six-packs of dinner plates, luncheon plates, and bread-and-butter plates plus the Fun Pack that has the serving bowl and four large 28 oz. bowls. I plan to get colorful mugs and placemats to complement the dishes.The dinner plate is perfect as a microwave cover for the serving bowl, and the bread-and-butter plates are perfect to cover the individual bowls. The plates stack efficiently in my cupboard; using one of those Closet Maid-type shelfs, I can stack all six of the dinner plates and bread-and-butter plates on the top and the luncheon plates (with serving bowl on top) and the four bowls stacked side by side underneath in just one small area of my cupboard. For an apartment with relatively little kitchen cabinet space, this is a real blessing.Some have complained that these bowls seem thin, but remember: they are Corelle, and the Vitrelle material they are made of is not your usual stoneware or tempered glass. I actually dropped a plate on the floor the other day from sink height (not something I'd recommend you deliberately do!), and it bounced on the vinyl flooring and did not break. I expect these dishes will hold up very well in daily use (microwave, dishwasher, oven), and they won't off-gas dangerous chemicals in the microwave like plastics will.
summary: Wonderful for main-meal salads, stews, soups, and breakfast bowls

reviewText: I bought this for weighing yarn (I'm a knitter) and it is really great for that. I also occasionally use it in the kitchen and sure enough, it works for that too! You can put any bowl on it and press tare then weigh what you need to weigh. Perfect!
summary: Wonderful scale - perfect for kitchen and for yarn!

reviewText: I really like this scoop.  It will work on really hard ice cream, but I still prefer to let the ice cream soften a bit.

Originally I ordered my Cooking Thermometer from Magic Touches with the intent to use it on the grill. Little did I know that I had some issues with the grill and could not get it to work. So, what next? Well, I have a Rotisserie Grill that I use to make rotisserie chicken. Usually, I have to keep poking it with a knife to see whether the center is done. Although, there is a timer based on what food you cook, I want to be certain. So, this handy pocket size thermometer came in very handy. It's more reliable than this other smaller plastic thermometer that I had. I've also done audits for restaurants before and this would have come in handy as well since the digital reading is very clear and concise as well as accurate. Furthermore, when testing meats baked in the oven, simply pull out the shelf and test it. Do NOT leave this in the oven as it is not meant for that. Even though I haven't used this for the barbecue grill yet, I can still take advantage of this gadget's multi-purpose attributes.Pros:-Pocket size is great (just a word, why not keep this in your purse so when you go out to eat, you can make sure that your meat is done properly. So many people get sick because of under-cooked meat - now you can be proactive instead of reactive)-Multi-Purpose usage (use in the kitchen or outside with the grill, carry with you out to eat, use as appointed)-Clear and easy to read LCD display-Great safety cover so your thermometer won't become damaged in your kitchen drawer-Hypoallergenic Stainless Steel Probe-Power Saving Auto Shut Off feature-Bonus Included- Special Cooking Mastery Guide eBook-Lifetime Satisfaction Guaranteed (wonderful benefit for a product like this)Cons:-None reported.About the Seller:I ordered my Cooking Thermometer from Magic Touches on 7/15/13 and it arrived on 7/17/13...on time and neatly packaged. The seller also sent properer verification as to when the product would be delivered and when it shipped. This gratuitous product was provided commensurate for my unbiased review and equitable opinion. Furthermore, I received follow-up emails from the seller to ensure my satisfaction with helpful tips and instructions. The bonus was also quite helpful for any cooking aficionado.Recommendations:To the Manufacturer: Try making brighter color options for the person who likes choices and who wants to color coordinate their utensils.To the Seller: Great product and thank you for the lifetime replacement guarantee.To Potential Customers: If you want to step outside the box and use this is various ways...go ahead. Often times, products like this have multiple usage options so try it out for yourself. Hope this helps!

Darn-near instantaneous.Small puncture in meat, so little loss of fluid."Yum, yum, eat-'em-up!"  (Fifty points if you're old enough to know where that comes from!)Used it when cooking our 26.68-pound Butterball for Thanksgiving.  Checked the temp of the stuffing, the thigh and the breast.  Instant result, even when switching, and the bird came out perfect!!
summary: Great for the grill or the kitchen!

reviewText: Maybe my apples are just too big, or maybe the Norpro is just too small. Either way, it seems I have to do at least two passes with the Norpro corer to get the seeds out of any apple I've tried.Actual use is pretty straightforward. Put your apple on a table, align the tube with the core, push, and hope your apple doesn't take off / that your table isn't scratched when the corer goes through the apple.Definitely not for children, many seniors, or people who aren't very coordinated.
summary: I think I was expecting something more

reviewText: Recently redecorated by kitchen. Went with the white with black trim. This fits pertectly on the end of my cabit and gives it a finished look.

I had to really bend these curtain rings to fit my heavy liner and fabric curtain, but these rings stood up to a lot of bending out of shape and back again.  I was relieved and am happy they worked out.  The bronze looks nice with my decor and they do not slip off the rod like most rings do.
Holds all my wraps and was way easy to istall.  Comes with the 2 screws you need took me about 2 minutes.

Pros:~small pan, good for making eggs, fry small vegetables and stuff.~glass encasing allows visual inspection.Cons:~small pan, you can't cook for more than 2 people and am not sure if this would be sufficient for everyday cooking at dinner.~expensive at $49.99If you are looking to cook for more people, you need to buy a bigger pan.

This garbage can is so cheaply made and to attach the inner lid to the top is next to impossible once it comes off.  Wish I never took it off to try and secure the bag, should have just put it on top because now what I have is one big mess that I cannot put together! Who needs this kind of stress in a garbage pail!
summary: What a piece of cheap garbage!!! LITERALLY

reviewText: Humidifier works well. Had to refill each night which is fine. Works best in a room about 300 sq feet or less. Watch out because it drips on things nearby. My bag was sitting 3 feet from machine for only about 2 hrs. (The machine was on high.) I noticed there were three rather large wet areas on my expensive leather bag. I tried to wipe it off. It did not come off. The wet areas produced a blue green stain on the cognac leather.Overall I would recommend it because it gives off a lot of humidity. But hide your stainable items such as leather.
summary: Works we'll in 259 sq.foot room but dripped on my leather bag with blue green stains

reviewText: I have a thing where I don't like anything scratchy on my feet.  That being said, these sheets, while nice, are scratchy on my feet.  I have to wear socks in bed, which makes me hot.  I sacrifice body temperature just so I don't feel the scratchiness on my feet. Other than that, they are nice sheets.  They feel nice on other parts of my body.
This is so pretty! Got this while set for my bathroom and I absolutely love it! The sequins are pretty and it all goes very well together and best price for all this that I could find!

I love going to Shabu Shabu but it can get rather expensive. So I thought, why not bring the shabu to my dinner table? I did so with this pot. It feeds enough for at least 4 people and worked wonderfully. It heats up pretty quick and brings the water to a boil after 5-7 minutes. A bit pricey, but well worth it for the amount of money I will save cooking shabu at home.The ONLY drawback is that it omitts a funny smell while cooking. I rinsed the pot out before hand, but it still had this weird odor that smelled up the kitchen. I've only used it once, so hopefully this is a one time deal.  Otherwise, its a good purchase.--------------------UPDATE: 1/10/2013I've used the cooker a handful of times in the past few years and still am satisfied with it. The smell isn't as strong as it originally was, however, there still is a plasticy odor when I heat the cooker up. Besides the smell, it fuctions like it was brand new and looks great.
This icemaker is well built and cranks out the ice. It makes some noise but is minimal. Having 3 different ice size options is great.

I love using this on mangos and kiwis as it does a wonderful job of peeling them without cutting too deep and wasting fruit.  I tried it on peaches and nectarines and it did an okay job as it was much harder to keep a continuous cut going.  The only real complaint with this is that you need to wash it immediately as the serrated cutting blade is difficult to clean when the fruit is dried onto it.
This is so wonderful.  I have been unable to find it other than here and sure am glad that I found this supplier.  And after I use it, the decanter is absolutely wonderful to use for other things.

It leaks, makes very weak coffee, and is just a utter waste of money and time.  I tried to cut a K-cup open and use that filter in addition to the one included, as instructed on some reviews, and that did not provide any significant difference.  I then stumbled upon the Solofill Cup, Refillable K-Cup For Keurig K-Cup Brewers and its better than the my k-cup.  I do not want to use K-cups due to the environmental factor, and the Solofill is probably a 3.5-4 star item, but still much better than the My K-Cup.
summary: Nice idea, but not worth it...

reviewText: UPDATE: 3/2009 - I have had this pan for about a year and a half and it is going bad.  The non-stick coating is no longer working well and I am going to have to order a new pan.  The non-stick coating on this pan was always a good deal "rougher" feeling than the Revere-ware pan I purchased at the same time - and now it is starting to let food stick.  That's why I am on Amazon today, ordering a new (NOT Anolon) pan...Wow, I more or less just wasted my $43 on this skillet.  I'd return it, but it will do as a 12 inch skillet for me.  But I am very disappointed.I had a T-Fal skillet that measured about 11 inches at the base, with a gradual slope up the sides that would allow me to pile a fairly good amount of fish, or pork chops in the pan quite easily.  I have no idea where it came from, I may have gotten it by default when I got married.  It has served me well over the years.But it has some scratches and the non-stick coating is getting rough (still doesn't stick, looks like it is slightly bubbling.)  I read that this means it is time for a new pan.So I came here looking for a slightly bigger pan to replace it, as I always seem to have one filet or chop that won't quite fit or I have to cram the food in tightly.So I settled on the Anolon 14 inch skillet that I am reviewing here.  I also ordered aRevere Convenience 12-Inch Skilletthinking it could replace my smaller 10 inch pan that was also showing some scratches.I received the Anolon 14 inch skillet and hauled out my tape measure and it has roughly a 10 1/2 inch base.  The same as the cheaper, and smaller sized Rever Convenience 12-Inch Skillet.  The top is 14 inches in diameter, but the base is the same as my 12 inch skillet.How is that helpful?  This is just a more expensive, takes up more space on the stovetop skillet with the same cooking surface area of my 12 inch Revere skillet!I am not happy at all with this.  The sides are very gradually sloped, so I can see that this might be useful if you are using it as a WOK or for vegetables, but for meats that you want solidly on the cooking surface, this is just a bulky, space stealing pan.You're better off with something else.
summary: WAY too small for a 14 inch skillet!!!

reviewText: The price (through Sears) was very reasonable and, for a change, they had it in stock.  About the only feature that bugs me is the door opening button.  It is so stiff that I push the unit across the counter to fully depress the button.  Will this change as the unit is used?  More later.March 5: Returned the microwave to Sears.  The troublesome door button was more than I was going to cope with.  Sears said they have had no complaints about that: check the Sears website and  you'll see exactly that.Can't be replaced because there is a 30-32 day wait on units.  Sears must not want comments on its website because it makes it an ordeal to do.  On the positive side Sears was very, VERY  helpful in the return and full refund.  I was in and out of the store in less than 5 minutes.  Went to Best Buy and purchased a SHARP Microwave.

I love OXO bowls. I already owned one bowl that was much larger than the largest one in this set and used it a lot! It didn't come with a lid or colander however. These bowls are great! The lids make them so much more useful than a regular mixing bowl. I replaced some old glass bowls with these and have been very satisfied except for these not being microwave safe. I did use one in the microwave for about 30 seconds and it was fine but I won't be doing that for longer times or frequently. I did notice others complaining of staining but I have not had any issues with this. I've used pasta sauce, tomato sauce, and pizza sauce.The different sized colanders are more useful than I thought they would be!UPDATE: Taking one star away because I did finally have a bowl stain!
This isn't a cheap thin cutting board. We keep ours next to the stove. Not only is it a great cutting board but looks. Nice too. Would recommend this product.

I didn't even notice the back of the quilt in the picture.  It is beautiful! (am uploading a pic.)  The front is lovely too, as pictured.  It is pretty comfy, only a little stiff (and I haven't washed it yet), and well worth the $30 when compared to all the plain throws out there.  It is a little shorter than I'd like, but from what I can tell almost all of them are this size.

fit and finish OK except for wood pins that fit too loose. Pretty easy to assemble, should budget 1 to 1 1/2 hours to get it done. That includes some set-up time for the glue.  I didn't like theirs so I used titebond waterproof.  Works for me.  Little foam balls go everywhere. the vac crevace tool seems to work OK getting them out.  This is not the greatest and classiest product.  In fact I didn't like the stand at all. Seems a bit tacky to have that around the toilet.  So It's outside.  I just attached a bac to the top part and hung it just like a cabinet.  Looks good and doesn't have the legs that get in the way of the flush lever.

I've been drying clothes outdoors for 25 years.  My last clothesline, very similar to this one, would have lasted forever if the movers hadn't damaged it.  I thought I was replacing my old one with one just like it, but my old one must have been galvanized steel and this one is aluminum.After reading the reviews, I knew I would have to clean it before hanging out clothes and it was indeed very dirty - both the pole and the clotheslines themselves.  And there was a bad odor.  I know I will have to tighten the lines from time to time.  But these are problems I am very willing to solve, because hanging clothes out is just so much better than using a dryer, especially in the summer.This is definitely not as good quality as my old one - but nothing is these days - things were always made better many years ago.  But I think it will hold up well and should last a very long time.I think the seller could improve by sending an email upon shipment, with a tracking number.  I really wanted to know what day to expect it and so I emailed the seller.  I received a nice reply - right AFTER it arrived.*******************I've had the dryer for just a few weeks and I WOULD NOT GIVE IT FOUR STARS NOW - maybe three at most.  The bad odor remains, even after washing it several times - it is quite obnoxious.  And one of the arms on top, held to the horizontal string pole by a plastic bolt, had the bolt pop out and I can't get it back in.  Two of the arms are fixed with a metal or aluminum "bolt" - the other two have plastic bolts, which makes no sense to me.  I emailed the seller, who contacted the manufacturer.  The manufacturer has promised to ship out a new one.  Hopefully it won't have the same problem.  I keep the dryer opened up in the garage year-round - I don't think it would hold up well outdoors in the sun and weather.
Bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas and he loves it! It works really well and it is easy to clean. Great price for something that we will definitely get a lot of use out of.

Almost perfect!  The top of the table came scratched, do you blame shipping or the manufacturer for not having enough protection...Besides that, the table is nice and sturdy, had a few missing screws but they were replaceable via Home Depot.Is it worth the money?  Only if you really want that style table.  As far as value I would say on a scale from 1-10 it would be a 5.All Stainless Steel construction is a Plus for what I am going to use it for so for me it's perfect.
I have had several different mini choppers, this one beats them all! Very easy to use and clean. Motor doesn't burn out like other choppers I have had. Great product!
summary: Takes a beating and keeps on ticking!

reviewText: Such great quality at such a reasonable price.  I was shocked to see such quality for that price! Couldn't be more satisfied

bought these for storing cereal. I like to mix cereals for better variety as that is my main breakfast meal. you won't be able to empty an entire bag into this unless you buy the small cereal box. Thus I would get the 3-2/5 model if you wish to put a big box of cereal into this or mix multiple cereals.works amazing for its size. my kid can easily open the top. seals well. stays fresh thus far. easy to clean. strongly recommend.note it is a bit pricey, but I believe worth the cost. Ikea sells a different style cereal container for about 5$ each. Those don't seal as well thus freshness may be sacrificed slightly but they have a more functional lid with the flip-top.

I am the only coffee drinker in my house, and this is a perfect size for my morning coffee. It makes just a bit more than I drink (1-2 large mug fulls). I got a reusable filter to go with as the smaller paper filters are hard to find. No complaints, I would buy again.

these are the greatest things since sliced bread - I love the brushed nickel look - they look beautiful hanging on my wall by the door for all the coats and they actually stick to the wall - what an awesome product
I have used this rice cooker many times, and it completely meets my expectations. I am a rice eater and cook frequently.

This is exactly what I was looking for: a simple, classic frothing pitcher.  It's nothing fancy, but it's well-made.  It's easy to clean by hand or simply put in the dishwasher.  The handle allows you to keep your fingers away from the pitcher while steaming so they don't get burned.  This is a pretty large pitcher, but I like a decent amount of steamed milk in my lattes, so it works well for me.  If you prefer less milk consider a slightly smaller one, unless you plan on making two at a time.

I received this through the Amazon Vine program.  It is small and sturdy.  When I started using this I was comparing it to my larger  pepper grinder.  The Peugeot does not hold nearly as much pepper.  You can vary the size of the grind by rotating the nut that keeps the lid screwed on.  It takes more effort to use this crank grinder than it does to twist the larger twist pepper mill.  I use pepper often and abundantly and prefer the larger twist mill for the kitchen but the Peugeot makes a nice pepper mill for the table.  It is very nice to have but if I could have only one I would choose a larger twist type pepper mill like the one I already had.
summary: Small, sturdy hand crank pepper mill

reviewText: I can see how some people might think it's too big for a queen but I haven't had any troubles.  It's easy to put on, and I just tucked it under in one spot up near the headboard to keep it secure.  SO much easier then a traditional bedskirt that goes under the bed.
summary: I think it's nice and fits well

reviewText: Beautiful sheets. Very soft and comfortable. They fit pretty close to perfect and dont slip around one the bed. I have washed them twice and they still look new, no pilling. They don't seem to wrinkle much. They are a little thinner than my other sheets, but they sleep great anyway
Bought 4 of these pourers, wanted to use on oil and vinagar bottle also. Pourer is only good for wine bottles. Very disappointed.
Very Comfortable Pillows--love memory foam pillows--great night sleep.

I really loved the style, and you can say I am a big kid in an older body. You have to be super careful with these because the parts scratch very easy. The bolts would fall out of the bottom quite often when connecting it to the bottom railing. If you move around it shakes. It has a beautiful design and that is why I bought it. I just wish it was more sturdy and durable.
summary: I don't recommend for Adult use.

reviewText: I am pleased with this product. It is small, equipped with retractable cord for compactness, safety on/off button for better control and the stainless blades that grinds spices well. I use this in my kitchen for grinding black pepper and it works very well. I have not tried with other spices but looking at the comments of other reviewers, it looks like it could be used for many other spices. This machine is easy to use, just plug and go. Easy to clean with a cloth and it is reasonably priced. I have rated five stars for design, quality and overall satisfaction.
summary: Great design and works well for grinding black pepper

reviewText: Five minutes after removing the chair from the box, I had it fully assembled. The 4 bolts required for assembly come preloaded with a lock washer and flat washer. There is an extra bolt, as well. The allen wrench you will need is also included.The chair is solid. It does not feel flimsy or cheap. The design won't set the world on fire but it's generic looks will fit in with most office environments. I have a large mahogany writing desk. This chair is not the perfect match but it does not look out of place behind it.A task chair is not designed to be luxurious and plush. The task chair is sitting in while at work completing, yes, tasks. This Hon chair has a sturdy and comfortable mesh back, it provides excellent lumbar support, it is easy to adjust up and down, it can be as easy or as hard to tilt as one wishes it to be, and has a very firm, but not too hard, cushion on which to sit. Because it does not have arms, it is perfect for anyone who uses a keyboard at a desk. Indeed, it is perfect for anyone who dislikes chair arms hitting ones desk.With Amazon Prime shipping, this chair is easy to order, easy to setup, easy to sit in, and a great value.

I purchased this tool to get the little places that I just couldn't seem to get clean - like at all.  I am a self-admitted cleaning-challenged person.  I simply hate to clean and pretty much won't spend time on hands and knees with an old toothbrush getting those nooks & crannies.  My back problems pretty much prevent this. Hence, my purchase of this product.  I have found that it works just as I expected - great for nooks and crannies.  I'm not super psyched about the wedge tool for flat surfaces, but then again, my flat surfaces are not my problem.  Time will tell if this gets used much.  I will say I love the mini brush tool (two come with the steamer) and I can see how I will wear these out rather quickly!  I wish there was a mini cone brush attachment (for inside tight spaces instead of just direct steam) is my only wish and I also wish there was an extension rod for it so I didn't have to get on hands and knees with back issues...I would recommend this product however.  It works great for what it is designed to do!  The large slender tool worked excellent for getting under and around the refrigerator and dishwasher in other places that probably haven't been cleaned in years!  I must say my husband's shower (which in 16 years we've lived here I personally have cleaned less than 5 times since he usually does it) was quite disgusting - many stains of black and yellow on the bottom and mold around the corners.  I worked about 15 minutes on the bottom of the shower with the mini brush tool (perhaps a bigger brush would also be handy?) and although I have more work to do, I can see this machine making the shower look new again once I have the opportunity to work on it more!  Big difference - and we have tried many other cleaners/combos of cleaners etc.  This is the only thing that has touched it!
summary: Great tool for the cleaning challenged!

reviewText: I got these for my mattress that has a pillow top on both sides. They fit perfectly and the colors r true 2 . I would order again from this vendor

The trays work well as long as you take the advice of several buyers and let the tray sit about 90 seconds before trying to release the cubes. The plastic isn't all that flexible, so the few seconds of melting time is critical.Pretty little cubes result.
As advertised and quick delivery
I love these spoons.. I have never been happier.. My granddaughter loves them too!  Just perfect and I would give them a 10 thumbs up.

I wanted brown and got red. I sent it back (fairly painless return process) and requested a brown replacement. They sent another red! It was pretty cold here so I gave up and kept the red. Other than that, as light as this wrap is, it is incredibly warm. This is NOT something you'd want to wear around the house (way too awkward to keep wrapped) - strictly for snuggling down in one place.

Been using this brand in my FoodSaver off and on for a few years now, this very large roll needed to be cut in half in order to fit in unit, but worth the trouble at this value. Performs at about the same level in my opinion as FoodSaver brand.
summary: Works just fine, at a pretty reasonable price.

reviewText: Which means they're great.  The salt shaker even works with sea salt, which is something many don't handle too well.
summary: Typical OXO design and manufacturing quality

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: Let's cover the carrying case first - While it's well made, it's poorly designed.  Everything in the case falls out of the holders and rattles around after only a few minutes of use. There's no way I'd use it to transport the blades or accessories. I own several carrying cases and bags/soft cases for knives - they all have on thing in common. A blade hold-down - be it elastic, leather or wood, to prevent the blades from sliding out of the holder.  If you use the case, you'll need to keep the cardboard sleeves on the blades. Eventually the sleeves will slide off during use. They'll also be useless after a couple of dozen times sliding on and off the blades. The case also had pockets for business cards, pens, etc.Speaking of blades - these are the sharpest I have ever seen out of the box.  The edges are works of art, the blades perfect, the synthetic wood handles would be the envy of lesser blades.  I literally shaved with the parer! The blades extends through the handle (full tang) and have three rivets securing the wood handle. The Le Cordon Bleu line design is based on Japanese knives - bolsterless, thinner blades, steep sharp edges and lighter weight. They resemble the less expensive Wusthof lines of knives, but are far lighter.I don't think you'll find a sharper or better quality knife anywhere - and I have a lot of knives. I felt like "Dexter" unrolling this set.The knives and accessories are fantastic. The travel knife roll (case), not so much. It's the standard Wusthof eight pocket Cordura roll. If you plan on using it, you'll need twoWusthof blade guard 8 cooksand oneWusthof blade guard parer- then you'll have a decent knife roll (but they'll still rattle around.)Take a look at my photos for details and a description of what's included..
summary: Excellent qualty blades, poorly designed case

reviewText: cute, very small. i used to keep it out on my counter but i use it less than i thought i would so i store it very easily in a cabinet just above.
This works well for small amounts of cords.  For larger cords get Velcro straps and hide them behind furniture.  Good product overall
summary: works well for small amount of cords

reviewText: Bought to check oven temp, used with an other brand, both showed oven off by 20 degrees. So I would say it works.

Fast delivery and excellent packaging.  Item as described and pictured.  I purchased the 70 round and it fits perfectly on my table.  Nice material and beautiful colors.  I highly recommend.  I would buy again!
I purchased this as I was unsure if the FoodSaver machine I purchased at the same time came with a roll of bags. It did, so I now have plenty! Love this item!

I still can't believe how affordable this set was! The pitcher feels really durable, and the glasses hold just the right amount to not have your margaritas melt before finishing them. The mouth is even big enough for me to stick an immersion blender in to make frozen Margaritas! The only con is the spout will sometimes drip, but it's not too bad. Would definitely recommend this!
Bought these, along with towels to match for a friend's gift.  She seemed to like them.  I would buy again.
These collapsible products are WONDERFUL! Well made, and a major space saver. Much easier to throw in the dishwasher also. Love them! Highly recommend.

This is the very best peeler I have ever had and I've had a few in over 50 years of marriage,  The last two were Oxo's which I thought were the best until now.  Will never be without the Messermeister Pro-touch Peeler in the future.  I have given two as recent gifts (I like to share exceptional cooking gadgets)and plan to give more for little Christmas gifts.  My dear husband (and resident tomato peeler) thinks it is awesome.  Have had lots of tomatoes given to us this summer and have made numerous batches of gazpacho.  He has peeled a lot of tomatoes with this new Messermeister Peeler and thinks it's great.  Buy it--you'll love it.
summary: Where have you been all my life?

reviewText: I bought this as a gift and the recipient seemed happy with it.  I thought the box was a lot smaller than I'd expected, given the number of pieces.  I don't tend to like plastic food storage, but it seems durable and versatile in having so many various pieces so I'd buy again.Update... thus far no serious dishwasher warping, and only a little discoloration, so not bad for the price.

I brought this Nuwave year 1/2 ago. I used it 4 times and then stored it. Went to use it today and it will not power up. Called company and was told to purchase a new power head 70.00. It wasn't that great when I did use it, but I had two whole chickens and thought I would try it again. Not worth it, beware the power heads go out and the plastic around them crack, they even had a recall. Not worth it, its also very big, if you have a small kitchen do not buy, also hard to store.

I love this pot! Its a beautiful color (Island Spice Red), washes up well, and does everything you'd want an enameled cast iron dutch oven to do: holds heat well, nice even heating, can put the lid in the oven, and everything you'd NOT want it to do: break the bank. I can't figure out the difference between this item and the much-higher-priced versions (LC - I'm looking at you) so save your money and buy this!
summary: all of the features I wanted without breaking the bank

reviewText: This mixer is pretty good. I had the previous model, that I owned for around 8 years before it broke. This one is nicer - the turbo button is placed MUCH better, so you don't accidentally hit it. The slow-start is nice. I wish the slowest speed were a little slower, although it's not super-fast. My biggest complaint is that the mixers are squared, which is really annoying since bowls are round.

I have purchased this item for myself at a local store box store. It came in an Oster box.  This one came in a cardboard box with labels all over it.  I purchased this as a bridal shower gift and thought I would open the outer box pull the Oster box out and wrap it and give to the bride.  I can't wrap this box with no outer Oster box with labels all over it. It looks like I bought it at a garage sale!!!!! I'm wondering if this product was a return and repackaged and that's why it was so cheap and packaged the way it was.  I would post pics but do not have that option.  I'm only giving it 2-stars because I already own one and I really like it.
summary: Packaging of Product Bizarre - Appears to be a return - Where's the Oster Box it Should Have Came In

reviewText: WOW! This is my first Kyocera - but it won't be the last. I just got it today and put it through it's paces.........a very soft tomato, went right through it, crisp celery, neat and clean, no strings, pared a tater in nothing flat. By comparison, I received a less expensive ceramic knife set for Christmas..........not nearly as sharp as the Kyocera. Can't wait to get a few more. Highly recommend this brand - no kitchen should be without at least one!

I like the white color with light grey buttons. Accurate and works good. I now own 2 of these scales. My first unit I bought about 5 years ago is truly white, while this new scale is more like an off-white. The display numbers are a little smaller on the newer scale. Most of my food is weighed. You can put an empty bowl on the scale, press the button, and it will go to zero, and then you can add and weigh the food. You can choose to take the bowl off the scale and add the food to the bowl on the kitchen counter - the scale will show the weight of the bowl in the negative - then just put the bowl with food back on the scale to get the weight of the food.

Design:  nice and modern.  Compact.Performance:  Good so far.  I have been grinding beans for coarse mode - french press coffee.  Mostly consistently same size.  Some fine grinds in w/ coarse grind.Noise:  moderate.  Not quiet.  Not annoyingly loud either.The burr seems to be made out of hard metal (steel type???).  The chute is plastic.

I read reviews on a lot of different canners before I ordered this one.  The reason I settled on this one is because someone said it was "really big" and mentioned stacking quarts.  Well, sorry folks, it's not tall enough to stack quarts, apparently you can't do that in any of the canners that sell for less than $300.  You can stack pints and half pints, but you can do that with most of the others, too.  Yes, it's a nice canner, has a nice book with it and everything, but if I had it to do over, I would've bought the model that has the pressure guard that lets you know when the pressure is going too high or too low, as I generally am busy preparing the next load while one is processing and it would be nice not to have to watch it so closely.  If memory serves, I believe that one was a different brand, maybe a Mirro.
The tea press is perfect for my desk at work. Just enough tea for a break freshly brewed instead of out of a papercup from a tea bag! Easy to use. Easier to clean!

I grabbed this to replace our kitchen scale largely to accurately measure grains when homebrewing beer. It works great for that purpose! I also use one of their more accurate/less capacity scales to measure hops and salts.
I bought this poster for my daughter, I was impressed with the size and the quality.  It looks great in a poster frame.  You won't be disappointed with this purchase.
Great for price and one can assume it's doing the trick.  I originally bought to use as a sham since they are so expensive but decided to use as a dust mite protector.

it came in a box that was not well protected and the product came in multiple pieces. you would think that a company that makes delicate objects such as these would be more careful. the glass filter holder (if i remember correctly) did not come with any padding inside. needless to say, i returned it. i would like to buy again but don't want to go through the hassle of getting another broken object and having to return it =/would have given it 1 star but they accepted the return--i guess that's a good thing
summary: i would like to buy again but don't want to go through ...

reviewText: Revere ware has never failed me, and I am sure this one will not either.  I would recommend not burning Quinoa in it though, 'cause it sticks like Gorrella Glue!!  The price was quite reasonable.

We have been using a hand-me-down Tupperware lettuce keeper for years as a colander. My wife put this on her wish-list so I got it for christmas and been using it every week since. This a very heavy-duty plastic colander with silicone grips molded in the handles and feet. You can pour boiling water right into the colander with no fear it will suffer any damage.

This is the second or third butter bell we've owned, as we keep accidentally breaking them, but it's the last model we'll ever buy.  It looks great in the kitchen or on the table and the handle on the top is very convenient. Others I've owned made you grasp the edges of the lid top open them, which explains why they kept slipping out of our hands and breaking.  As long as you remember to change the water every few days it will keep butter fresh for up to two weeks without refrigeration, and having soft spreadable butter for your toast or English muffin in the morning is, if not the best thing ever, at least a little nice.As for previous reviews that said the butter falls out into the water, I've had this happen once in a while, but only very rarely.  The trick is to make sure the crock is dry when you load it with butter, as any water on the inside walls will prevent the butter from sticking, and to pack it firmly.  It also helps to soften the butter on the counter or in the microwave before you pack it into the crock, and if you're going to scoop some butter out and then put back the unused part, make sure it's soft and that you pack it firmly onto the butter that's already there or that extra little bit _will_ fall out easily.

What can one say about a basket to hold cutlery? It is light weight, easy to carry around if you need to and does what it is supposed to do! I have a service for eight stored in it. I bought this to hold extra cutlery at a beach house - it does its job.

I don't blame Amazon because they are just the re-marketer for this product.  This product is a farce. A 10 cent piece of cheese cloth would work as well. Weights around the edges??? I guess if you consider 8 tiny pieces of plastic about 1/2 the size of an M&M weights, then there is truth in that statement. Save your money. Just a note, this is actually the 1st bad review I have ever written about a product purchased through Amazon and I am a good customer.
I like that this set is all in one.  Fine quality!  Nothing crazy special, but nice design.  It's pretty discreet.
Super cute baking cups. These are perfect for springtime cupcakes! I like that there are multiple color choices to buy as well so you could make a garden of cupcakes.

I tried using this many, many, many, (probably too many) times (hoping it would work) and this pressure cooker just would not heat up properly - since day 1.For example, it took me more than 30 minutes to sautee a diced onion using the "sautee" function!!  Not only did the sautee function not heat up properly, the "pressure cook" function also did not heat up or work properly.  I had to send it back.  After reading many good reviews, I'm assuming I received a "lemon."I replaced this with a similar electric pressure cooker, "Secura," which works GREAT!

I hate curly bacon. I like my bacon cooked uniformly and I like it flat. I got this thing to cure the problems with curly non-uniform bacon and it totally does the job. Better than that, it doesn't require much cleaning. Love it.

I am still getting used to this timer so my rating is mid-range. The feature which I don't like is while turning the black dial which sets the time increments, I have moved the silver knob which changes the timer number I am setting.The feature I most like is the four timers are situated like the four burners on my stove top, so I don't have to remember (or write down) which timer is for which item on my stove.  I also like that I can see up to two timers at once.I hope once I get used to this new timer, I will be more satisfied, especially since I paid more than I've usually paid for timers in the past.

There are other knife sharpeners  available and perhaps some as good as this one however this is the one I bought and quite simply it works.  Now owning  this machine  has an added benefit in addition to having sharp knives which are a pleasure to use and that is you can dispense with all those very expensive  knives and knife sets.  How long a knife holds its edge is no longer important as it is so simple and quick and convenient  to bring it  up to the highest standard.  Yes you can dispense with the  need  for those outrageously expensive knives and  purchase commercial knives  from a commercial supply store as Sam's.  They come sharp and with this machine they stay sharp and to make everything absolutely perfect just buy in addition a pull through knife sharpener  for  the top of your counter.  Your inexpensive knife may not need it but with the conveninece at hand a quick pull through assures a razor sharp edge and a smile on ones face.  Thank you.

This is everything I wanted and all I will ever need in a mixer. Plenty of power and a large capacity. I have several attachments for it that I use frequently. This piece of kitchen equipment never fails me. I expect this to go to my grandchildren some day, and my son is still in grade school. Everything should be made like this. Everything used to be.
More compact than comparable in-store shakers, this the perfect size for over the stove or on the table. Very nice finish and weight, smooth mechanism, and easy to refill. Very good product! Love it!

I guess I just expected more from this product, especially for the price.  I have arthritis and thought that the mats would make it easier to stand at the sink and the stove.  AS yet I haven't noticed that much difference.  They are soft but I think I expected them to be a bit thicker.

This Kitchenaid cookware set is a 10 piece nonstick set. It's of average quality, very similar to my T-Fal set.The set includes:1 qt. saucepan w/lid2 qt. saucepan w/lid3 qt. sautepan w/lid6 qt. stockpot w/lid8.5" skillet10" skilletThe red is a beautiful color. It's an easy to clean porcelain exterior. Handwashing is always best for the non-stick interior of pots and pans. The lids are tempered glass which is good for keeping an eye on your food and stainless steel handles with a soft silicone grip to prevent hands from getting burnt.
