The set is oven safe to 400 degrees.None of the lids fit the 8.5 skillet if you need one. The saute pan and stockpot lid both fit the 10" skillet but not really well, it makes a loose fit if you're just needing a cover for your food.This set is suitable for solid plate, radiant ring, gas, ceramic, and halogen ranges.
The other kind with no bar is really flimsy and doesn't perform very well since you have to be super careful when you pull it out from under the bed  It was also not easy to assemble.
summary: Get the one with the bar on one of the four sides

reviewText: Overall, this is a very versatile steam cleaner and we like it a lot.  The myriad attachments allow us to use the cleaner in ways and places that we could never do with our stick-mop style cleaner.  Presumably because of the tank capacity, it does take the full 8 minutes to get up to steam, but it keeps that head of steam all the way through to the end of the tank even with continuous use.We have been running full tankloads of 40-45 minutes aggressively cleaning wood floors and it does a very good job with two caveats.  First, the floor extension (plastic) doesn't seem to stand up well to aggressive mopping action.  Second, the velcro-like method for attaching the pads doesn't keep them very secure when mopping - and the pads don't look like they will last very long before needing replacement.  Perhaps the answer is a lighter mopping action, but it seems that scrubbing pads are for scrubbing.  We shall see.
summary: Very versatile with a few caveats on the floor mopping.

reviewText: The Good: It's light, it's compact and it sucks real good.The Bad: It's real noisy, it has too high a profile for getting under things and it's hard clean the filter.But all in all worth the price

It fits my mixer, though a tiny bit (1/8th inch or so) longer than the original. My mixer is from 2002, so maybe they are all longer now. Anyway, it doesn't hinder the function in any way. The original screw's plastic knob had broken.

I use these once a month & I've never had a disposal problem.  Not only do they make the disposal smell fresh, it cleans out all the goop that accumulates from the occasional food product that goes down the disposal.  It even cleans the other sink & the rubber disposal splash guard as well because of the foaming action.  Nice clean smell.

We have tried several humidifiers in an effort to bring moisture into our son's room, especially during the winter months.  This one absolutely works.  We keep a gauge in his room to measure the temp and humidity, and although the air has gotten as dry as 15%, with this humidifier running, it maintains on average around 40%.  This is a significant difference!  This humidifier doesn't just keep saturating the air either.  When it reaches a certain level, it backs off.  On the driest nights, the humidifier will be close to being out of water in the morning, but on warmer nights, it will have more water in the morning.It is also super easy to clean!  The clear plastic bottom part is the easiest part to clean, but there are 2 other parts that you can also easily clean.  With our last humidifier, I had to really poke my fingers in to wipe out slime.  This humidifier doesn't even grow slime.We are ordering another one of these for our bedroom.  My only recommendation is to buy the filters directly from Lasko.  I have tried ordering them online from amazon and keep getting the wrong ones for a steep price.  So, I went directly to Lasko's website where they only cost a few dollars each (significant difference!).Overall, after several humidifiers, this is the best, most efficient one.  It doesn't make a lot of noise, and the lowest setting is all we need to keep the humidity at a comfortable level.That said, it can leak on you if you're not careful.  Just turn off the unit when refilling it, and make sure not to overfill it.It really works!!
summary: Best I've Tried, But Do Be Careful When Refilling

reviewText: I found this created a bit of a bump in the bed, I  think it's good if you have two identical twin beds of the same age. I have a set but one bed has seen more use than the other. Another thing to note is this works if you use a metal frame or a platform bed that is meant for a king. This doesn't work as well if you have two twin frames that you push together, the gap caused by the frames coming together makes the gap too large to use this with comfortably.
summary: Good in some situations, just not for mine

reviewText: It keeps my coffee warm but of course if you put cream or milk in your coffee be aware it will build up "scum" on the top.  That's my only complaint but it's not a fault of the warming function just a fault of the user...who likes 1 cup of milk with her 1 cup of coffee :-)

The red lid isn't airtight even turning the slotted ends.  This is a thick glass product.  I have no idea about the Oxo counterpart but I would have checked out the Oxo if the Oxo had existed when I got this.  I have owned this for years and it is necessary for Nigella's choco loaf cake recipe because the recipe requires half a cup of BOILING hot water.  I mainly use this to bloom yeast or stir up waffle batter.

I can tell that this juicer is going to be my best friend during canning season. I normally think of a juicer for making juice of course. I don't drink a lot of juices so I had never been that interested in a juicer. I realized that a juicer is for much more than just for making juices. You can use them to process and juice fruits and vegetables to be used for variety of uses.I can and this processes tomatoes lickety-split. The old way, I would blanch the tomatoes and then process them in a food processor. The process took forever. With the Big Boss Power Juicer, it takes just minutes to process a whole batch of tomatoes and have them ready for canning. I can't wait till summer to really put my Big Boss juicer to work. I'm already thinking of ways to incorporate the juicer into my canning routine.In the meantime, I've even made a few juices that the whole family likes with the Big Boss.The Big Boss juicer is easy for me to assemble and disassemble. Clean-up isn't much work either. The instruction manual has instructions for the assembly and basic usage. Beyond that, you'll want to pick up a juicing book so you will have some recipes and also to give you ideas on how to use your juicer beyond juicing like canning.

I got my Chantal teapot in record time: I broke my old one Saturday and had this one Tuesday by early afternoon! I think the little teapot looked even better than the photo. Beautiful blue glaze inside and out, the lid has one of the best designs I've seen to insure that it doesn't accidentally come off. There are two tabs, one you insert under the inside rim, the other fits into a slot on the rim. When you turn the lid, it does not come off!  Also, the teapot does not drip after you've poured your tea. The handle is very comfortable. Great price for such a beautiful little personal teapot. I like it better than the Brown Betty it replaces. I may have to get an additional one in another color!
Nice size and weight. Easy to use. Processes 5 cups of flour with ease. Find the crank easy to use. Had the press handle before and it used to irritate my torn rotater cuff. Would recommend.
summary: Nice tool; does what it promises

reviewText: CLASSIC ORANGE JUICE LIKE IN THE HOTELSVERY BEAUTIFULWE LOVE THEMFOR ORANGE JUICE BREAKFAST LOVER'S - THIS IS A GOOD PURCHASETHANKS
summary: CLASSIC ORANGE JUICE LIKE IN THE HOTELS

reviewText: I'm trying to cover my small appliances that only get occasional use and was having difficulty finding a product that I liked.  I ordered two covers initially; one for my rice cooker and one for my blender.  After getting those items, I was better able to select covers for my 5 qt. crockpot, my large oval slow cooker and my 3 qt. crockpot.  I know this cover is square, but it fit quite nicely over my round 3 qt. crockpot.  My small appliances are now covered and protected - and, hopefully, will remain clean between usage. And, my appliance shelves look great.

Not that you be expecting much from a sub $30 table, but I was still disappointed with the quality of this one. The collapsible drawer is difficulty to pull in and out of the table, tending to catch on the legs as it does so. My particular table is somewhat uneven, and one leg sits a couple mm off the ground, causing the table to rock when things are placed upon it. The entire thing weighs in at around maybe 8 pounds, and will move quite easily.
summary: You get what you pay for.

reviewText: I've bought a lot of "some assembly required" furniture and accessories in my time, and my dogs have learned to hide under the bed as soon as I start gathering tools and laying out pieces; they know a lot of snarling from me is about to ensue.  I haven't assembled furniture that was as easy as the Yube Cubes since the days when assembling furniture meant stacking bricks and boards to make a bookshelf.  I'm really surprised that some folks found them hard to put together.  Maybe I lucked out and got really well-matched pieces or something.  I also found the pictorial instructions easy to follow, with their printed tips at just the right points in assembly.Each piece is made of lightweight, eco-friendly materials and is easy to handle.  In addition to being lightweight, the pieces are small enough to maneuver easily, with no awkward juggling, twisting, and turning, no getting up and down off the floor or longing for assistance to hold one piece in place while you finagle another.  The pieces snap and clip together with almost no tools involved - the feet attach with screws, so if you choose to add feet, you also need to add a screwdriver.  The panels are easily paintable to coordinate with any décor.A terrific feature is that the cubes mix and match in infinite configurations.  You can add or subtract shelves, doors, feet, and drawers.  You can use them singly, side-by-side, or stacked.  The snap and clip assembly disassembles just as easily, so you can change your mind and reconfigure them to fit any space.As I was working on them, I was thinking "5 stars all the way on this one!"  However, when I opened the packet that accompanied the feet, labeled "8 screws," I found only four.  Each foot requires two small, self-tapping screws.  It wasn't hard to scrounge up four more, and they aren't visible once the cube stands upright so the mismatch doesn't matter.  It wasn't a big deal, but it was disappointing.Assembly took about 75 minutes, from unpacking to finished cubes.  The second cube took about half the time of the first once I had the gist of the system (and I lost a few minutes dredging through my fastener odds `n' ends looking for extra screws).  The unit looks pretty nice considering the effort that went into it, although I'm on the fence about the price.  I'd like to add more components and make a larger storage system, but for now I'll wait to see how it holds up to day-to-day use and abuse.
summary: Handy, and I thought EASY to assemble

reviewText: For a reasonably priced coffee maker we're happy - now that we got one that works properly though.  We had to send it back for a replacement and Cuisinart paid for the shipping (can't recall why, but man what is it with Cuisinart's consistency issues?).  So far so good....

I no longer fear for my lower regions being doused with hot oil when skinny cooking. Also, the lightsaber adds a certain degree of masculinity to my food. Alas, the dishes have yet to respond to my commands to wash themselves.
summary: I no longer fear for my lower regions being doused ...

reviewText: First one got accidentally put in the dishwasher. (well meaning friend) and is still usable but looks kinda like the bubba keg version of the Leaning Tower of Pizza.These are the most amazing mugs. Cold drinks stay cold all day or all night long.
summary: Second one of this size. Love the bubba kegs

reviewText: I've never slept on a mattress pad before, but I have slept on many pillow top mattresses. I didn't have any particular problem that was trying to address with the mattress pad except to extend the life of my current mattress. All in all I think this is a good product. They treat the foam with a green tea scent or something like it, so its nice not to have too much of a chemical smell. I did leave it in my basement for a few days to air out though.Pros: no plastic smell, fits my queen mattress pretty well, can't feel my partner's movement and wiggling when we're sleepingCon: makes the bed feel significantly warmer than before (bad in the summer but good in the winter!)

The hand vac is working great so far.  We read the instructions on how to charge and discharge the battery as well as other reviews on this subject and to date the battery holds up Great.  The only disappointment is that the color of the vac we received is not the green one that had been pictured, but rather grey.  Other than that the vac came to us in a very timely manner and overall I would buy it again if I was choosing today.

It's okay.  Works okay.  Feels okay in your hand ... handle is easy to grip and hold.  Weight is 14 oz.  Not as heavy as I would have expected.  Would prefer a little more heft like the one my mother had.  It is made in China.  I'd like to know what the head is made of.  Says it's BPA free ... okay, but what is it made of????  The finish looks like that of non-stick (toxic) coating on pans.  I don't guess I'll be heating it, but material is still a concern for me.  I should have researched this better before purchasing.
summary: Made in China... but what is it made of ????

reviewText: It’s cute.  A tad clunkier than I thought it was going to be, but for what it is you can’t really complain.  The detailing is a tad on the cheap side, and I think that thinner wires would have made this feel more elegant, but the wide mouthed cup will fit a handful or two of corks and make a nice display.  For wine lovers who like the look of the corks and want to make them a part of their kitchen décor, this is a great addition to the house.
summary: A nice way to display your corks…

reviewText: The picture shows 6, but if you read the description, you only get 4. But I realized that from the get go. I wasn't sure how big these were, they are a little smaller than I had hoped, as I really wanted small seafood forks, but all the actual seafood forks are those picks that come with the crackers, etc. I wanted actual forks. These will do, they are 5 inches from tine tip to handle tip. The tines are 3/4 inches long and the tips are 1/4 inch apart, as pictured, 2 tines per fork. They are bright stainless steel. Hope this helps you..

A *perfect* solution for rinsing rice before cooking. Nice, tough plastic with a thoughtful grommeted hole for hanging. The bottom has an array of small holes. It works great!! Better than any other colander or sieve I own. An excellent tool. Very pleased.

I've had a Bunn, Cuisinart, and all sorts of expensive coffeemakers after my old Braun died and haven't found a good one till this cheapy! Amazing. It brews a nice hot cup of coffee and the quality/flavor is EXCELLENT!  I used the 1st one for about 4 weeks and decided to buy a 2nd one for the day the 1st dies, but what i did is to clean and dry out the 1st one which proved to work well,it's now the spare for later and i've been using the 2nd one which also works perfectly and has been for a few months now. No leaks - no problems, it just makes a great cup of coffee. Actually, all my old makers used the #4 cone filters so being i had an abundance of those i use it into this one and put grinds in that. Works great so i keep doing it and getting paper cone filters. Regular basket type need more coffee grinds so it saves me $ to use the cone type. They stick up a bit but the lid squished it down and it's never folded over or anything, just makes GREAT coffee! :)

I've had my "Sodastream" for well over a year, & still use the first canister! Has this happened to anyone else? Granted, I'm not a heavy soda user, but I'm filling the bottles regularly with as much as much carbonation as they'll hold. I'm interested in the re-fill issue some other users are having, but it hasn't com up yet. "Sodastream"s total cost so far is much less than half what I would've spent on similar quality club-soda, to say nothing of the green aspects, & not having to hoist heavy bottles home every week.
summary: So good, it almost seems they made a mistake!

reviewText: replacement filter are what they are.  Lasts for a few months as expected.  Does a nice job removing tastes from tap water.Great for coffee too.

This is a treat from Lenox.  Most other patterns are far more expensive so I am not surprised that so many people own this pattern.  It is not too grandma like the Royal Albert Old Country Roses but individually the pieces are better than clumped together as pictured. The colors are milder and less intense than the picture.The best thing about this set is how nice they feel in the hand - much nicer than the crockery for similar prices and that is where Lenox beats out everyone else in this price category.I would definitely recommend this to anyone on a budget but since I can afford it, I would personally just buy the Lenox Eternal pattern.  However, I would never have considered the Lenox brand if not for these dishes.  I don't know if these are  loss leader for the company but every piece including the mugs looks nicer in reality and each piece is thoughtfully designed.  All three sizes of plates can be placed without needing to be adjusted because like great pattern designes of yore, the designs intentionally allow for it.  That's why the butterflies and sprigs are placed the way they are.If you don't like the stock photo.  Search on Amazon for each individual piece and you will see that the pattern is better than this group photo.
I wish I would have had these when my children were all little and everyone lived at home! They are a wonderful size!

These are, by far, the sharpest poultry shears I have used.... professional grade.  I first used them to halve raw Cornish hens, and the chickens were no challenge for these sturdy scissors.  Cutting through the bones was effortless.  They come apart easily for cleaning and are dishwasher safe.  Be warned.... they are sharp!

Yes, That's right. This thing will make you violent, because it makes you realize that you have been lied to your entire life. All that money you have spent on K-cups, Mr Coffee's, Starbucks swill or that $1000 professional espresso maker was all a waste. You could instead have bought a plastic plunger from a frisbee manufacturer for $25 and spent the rest on hookers, booze, a masters degree, or whatever. Oh and for $25 you would get a better cup of coffee or espresso or cappuccino or latte.I've become like a militant jehovah's witness going door to door to ask people if they have found AeroPress. I troll the local Williams-Sonoma. I shame family members who use Keurigs. Even my wife who had a pathological Starbucks habit, uses the AeroPress now. I'm even going emigrate to Norway to be close the Aeropress World Championships. That's how good this thing is.
summary: Smash your old coffee maker. Punch your barista in the face. Get an AeroPress

reviewText: I love this product.  I use it at least a couple times a week.  It sits out on my countertop and looks great.

it is a nice heavy quality material, but they put mesh side vents in where the side shelves are and water gets in when it rains...what a strange design...who needs vent in a grill cover...we don't put it on until the grill is cold...
summary: weber gas grill cover 7553 genesis series

reviewText: My old baking set was about ready for retirement, so I decided to go with the Calphalon baking set. The price was right especially considering Calphalon's reputation. After a few weeks of use, I am extremely happy with the set's performance. The surfaces of the pans have maintained their original non-stickiness. Having read the numerous reviews about rust, especially from those who washed their pans in a dishwasher, I have opted to hand wash my pans. I also take a moment to dry the edges. So far I've had no rust! In the past, I've used flimsier pans which ultimately bend. I like the firmness of my new Calphalon set. I suspect that the heavier construction of this set will make the pieces last a bit longer. I'll be curious to see how long the non-stick surfaces last and whether or not the pans develop rust. So far so good!

I love these people's stuff. German quality (even if it is made in Vietnam). Their cromargan finish, whatever that means, is the real deal. This stuff has a hard-finish shine that is amazing to look at and lasts a long time. Unlike my Henkels or Oneida stuff that went dull after a dozen or so runs through the dishwasher, this stuff remains the smoothest, shiniest flatware I've ever owned. Has great weight, finish, and design. I love it.

I've had a Roomba 600 for almost one happpy year and was interested to see how well the LG HomBot 3.0 compared.  Here's my take on the LG robot vacuum.PROS:There's a lot to like about this vacuum.1.  Running after I had already cleaned with the Roomba 600, this LG robot vacuum cleaned up additional dust and pet hair.  It appears to have greater vacuum suction than the Roomba.2.  It's fun to watch the LG learn about the shape and barriers in the room, backing up and restarting.3.  The LED lights on the vacuum cover are nice and bright, and the voice tells you current settings and indicates some, although not all, problems.4.  The vacuum comes with a cleaning comb and extra brushes and filter.5.  The vacuum can be set for automatic running by using the included remote control.  Also, the remote control has a handy home on the charging unit so you don't have to look around for it.With all these nice features, you'd think I was thrilled, but the vacuum has problems as well.CONS:1.  The cameras on the vacuum view fabric skirt on lounge and easy chairs as barriers, so it does not clean under these chairs.  The Roomba does clean under chairs and all other furniture without getting stuck.2.  The vacuum is too tall to clear the underside of most of my furniture.  It gets stuck. Repeatedly.3.  The maximum time it has run without my attention is eight minutes.  Sometimes I understand why it has stopped; other times, not.  It plays a brief tune to let you know it has stopped, but if you have to be in the room with the vacuum to keep it going, it defeats the purpose of a robot.4.  The collection bin is small and fills up rapidly.5.  This vacuum does not like to run over cords and will stop.  Although the instructions clearly state to remove cords before vacuuming, with all the electronic stuff in most houses, this is not practical.  The Roomba simply runs over cords and keeps going, usually for about 1  hours without additional attention.Overall, the problems I've encountered with the LG HomBot outweigh its pluses.  Apparently, there is a version with a removeable mop plate for the bottom of the vacuum, but it was not included in the package, nor could I find it as an accessory on the LG website.If you have large rooms with not too many pieces of furniture, this might be an excellent choice, but for small apartments and houses, I'd suggest the Roomba instead.UPDATE:  July 1, 2013I'd love to love this vacuum because it clearly provides superior cleaning power when compared to the Roomba, but I'm frustrated with baby-sitting this machine.  Often it gets stuck or simply stops within two minutes of starting.  And, yes, I've timed it.  In addition, after carefully following the written instructions to set it for automatic starting, it has failed to start on its own 100% of the time.At the price charged for the HomBot, I would expect superior performance in robotic action.  A redesign is in order.
summary: Superior Cleaning Power, but Not the Best for Small, Crowded Rooms

reviewText: This is a fine lid, if you happen to own a pot that it will fit. I bought it as a replacement for a Farberware pot which seems to have lost its lid along the way, and it does not fit. The diameter of this lid is 7 3/4 inches on the inner lip which fits inside the pot. Wish that the description would have stated that clearly and I could have saved myself the trouble of buying it and then sending it back.

I ordered this product to complete my kitchen make-over. The product is fine but the installation is hell. I put a hole in my wall trying to install and its very heavy when assembled, so that makes it even harder to install. The anchors were to large which means drilling large hole in the wall. I had a very hard time attempting to put it up even with help. And have yet to complete the installation. I will need to get some one else (handyman) to do it.The pot rack itself is very nice and I love the decorative balls that connect the pieces. The color is great (red is my favorite color) and its well made. But the installation is a hassle.
summary: Installation was very hard for me.

reviewText: I owned the previous version of this.  I used it many winters until I sold it in a garage sale.  We replaced it with a fancy humidifier, but we couldn't stand it.  Anyway, we went back to the old trusty Vicks Vaporizer.  This newer model seems to be better actually.  It works great!  And what a bargain!
Our Grandaughter Christina wanted to learn how to make poached eggs. So we ordered the egg cups and the lifter for easy cooking. She loves them.
I purchased this paring knife to replace one from my block that got lost. It is Chicago Cutlery...what else can I say??
summary: Chicago Cutlery Walnut Tradition 3-Inch Paring/Boning Knife

reviewText: This microplane makes quick work of lemon zest and nutmeg, which is what I use it for most often. I will purchase again when this one dulls.
summary: The best one I have ever used

reviewText: Love this pillow! The fabric is heavy duty, and good for indoor or outdoor use. The design is beautiful; looks fantastic with my decor. And best of all, it's made in the USA. Will definitely be looking at future products from Manual Woodworkers & Weavers!

This is a really good design. The board is light weight so it is easy to lift and move around. The food slides right off the board through the pour spot. So far I have 4 areas of concern.I am not sure the cutting board will last very long. Just putting a cooking pot on top of the board scratched the surface. I think it may be too soft.There is a green border around one edge. That has already started to turn black. Whatever is causing the discoloration, it won't wash out.The raised edge along the left side means you have to be careful when the board is lying flat on the counter. The side is raised high enough to cause something set on top of it to spill.I am left handed and the raised edge can get in the way of a knife blade. You have to have enough room on your counter to turn the board at an angle so that the blade doesn't hit the edge.

I bought this because it was recommended by Cook's Illustrated. I'm so glad i did. Ity's heavy weight, with a quality non-stick finish. Corn muffins come out cleanly...crisp, too, if the batter is poured into a hot tin with shortening in each cup.
Good product.  Doesn't deflate while you are plugging it up after inflation, so stays pretty firm.  I am happy with them.

Have had problems with the air getting out of these - but also had that problem with the major brand too.  I use these for storage and to keep dust off towels, blankets, pillows and garments both in closets and in drawers.  I have ordered this brand over and over again
summary: Use for storage - not necessarily for compacting

reviewText: Despite some reluctance to try this product, after expereincing having to wait long time periods for a bottle of red wine to open and breathe,  I decided to try this product.  The immediate difference in taste and aroma of the wine was amazing.  It brought out the full bouquet and taste immediately.  I  compared this with less expensive bottles, more expensive ones, one that had been opened the day before and some that were decanted the normal way for an hour and it made all the wines much better without the long decanting wait.I bought eight more for family and friends and we will start taking one to restaurants with us for better tasting wine.

ordered this table in cherry with the white marble(with grey lines and shading).  it was very easy to put together and all parts were in great shape.  the finish is perfect.  the table is great for a plant, or can be used for 2 plants as 1 can be put on the marble top and another 1 can be put on the bottom wood level.  sooo glad I ordered it.
These pans exceeded my expectations! The grease even bacon grease just rolls right off them with a very light wash. I recommend not putting them in the dishwasher to keep them working properly

Made in the USA, which is always a plus for me, thick and a bit heavy. I also noticed it doesn't slide on the oven racks as easily as the cheapers ones did. But....from what I can see, I expect this product to give me years of use. I've tried cheaper ones and they rusted out within the first year! I really like that I can shape the loaf right over the insert, then set it into the holder with ease. Removing the cooked loaf is just as easy to do. I've only used it twice but I see no reason to need another one. Both times there was plenty of grease left under the insert, not touching the loaf at all. I really love this loaf pan!

This entertainment credenza is lovely.  It has capacious storage and looks great in our small den.  It makes the room look larger without dominating it.  It took several hours to put together, but was well worth the effort.  It was in perfect condition on arrival.  The package was damaged, but the packing so good that the credenza was unblemished.  Delighted with the purchase.
Lived with target/walmart set for 8+ years and feel like a grown up with this set. Great variety of sizes, worth every penny.
These bowls are awesome, heavy duty and great for anything from serving bowls to mixing bowls.  They are just the right size, not to big or to small!
summary: HUGE AND GREAT FOR JUST ABOUT ANYTHING

reviewText: Great tool for any kitchen.  I'm really enjoying using this for sauces and soups.  Clean up is quick & easy and storing it away is so much easier than my counter top blender.  This also made an excellent Christmas gift to my sister as well.
summary: Soups and Sauces just got easier

reviewText: I was in the market for a coffee maker to replace my old, awful Mr. Coffee machine, read all the reviews here on Amazon, and decided to give this Cuisinart a try.Very glad I did.  This is a terrific little machine.  If you buy it, read all the instructions, including running clean water through it first before you brew any coffee.  I grind my own coffee beans to the medium-fine Cuisinart recommends.  Love the water filter that's included.  Love that the pot doesn't leak coffee when I pour a cup (which other brands of coffee makers that I've owned, especially Mr. Coffee, seem to do--I've owned a few--and some other brands of makers do).  Love that it has a "clean" indicator.  Love the taste of the nice hot coffee it makes.  I don't feel the machine has design flaws at all.  I do leave the filter in the machine when filling with ground coffee.Great coffee maker for the price.
summary: No negatives from this coffee addict

reviewText: These sheets are very soft and look just like they do in the picture. The pillow cases are large enough for big fluffy pillows and the fitted sheet easily covered my pillow top bed.

Allows sweaters to dry much more quickly than just laying them on a towel.  Used to take a couple of days for a sweater to dry, and I would turn it a few times to help it dry more quickly.  These stack so nicely with plenty of space between the racks.  The material in contact with the mesh dries quickly so not necessary to turn sweaters over.  Wish I had learned about these years ago.
summary: Dries sweaters in a short time.

reviewText: The jar openers I had been using wore out.  I think all the beer bottles finally won.  The Easy-Grip is thicker than my old ones and does a better job of protecting your hand from rough edges.  Looks to be a long lasting product.

I ordered this specifically for canning in a regular stockpot.  I needed something that kept the jars from sitting directly on the bottom of the pan.  It really is an excellent trivet and I've been using it almost daily to put hot pots or dishes on the counter.  I love that it's so non-slip.  No risk of a baking dish sliding sideways on it.  I may order a couple more of these just to have.
summary: Got it for canning in a regular stockpot

reviewText: Good Product, I like the espresso made into a latte every morning. Make sure not to put water past the line inside Bialetti or it will not suck all the water up. However, I've tried other electronic espresso makers and nothing gives me as hot of espresso as this and I will continue to buy this brand. Love it.
summary: Great Espresso Maker but watch the water line!

reviewText: We live in a rural area with well and septic, therefore it is imperative that we keep food debris/refuse out of our septic system.We have a double bowl stainless steel sink that requires two sink strainers.  Our previous sink strainer was a wire mesh type with a stainless steel rim.  The "positive" of that particular model is that the rim fit quite snugly onto the drain;  the "negatives" being that  1)  it required rather frequent debridement due to clogging issues, and  2)  the wire mesh was prone to breaking, causing scratches/pricks to hands and fingers whilst cleaning them.Secondary to the routine injuries caused by the broken mesh wires, our old sink strainers had become significantly stained, discolored, and were in dire need of being "retired".  While searching for replacement strainers on AMAZON.COM, my intention was to simply reorder two of the wire mesh strainers, unfortunately there was only ONE remaining in stock - and I required TWO.  As fate would have it, the same vendor offered this model for nearly the same price, so I thought I'd give it a try.  I'm so glad I did as this model is more solidly constructed with larger holes that promote faster drainage.  (The wire mesh model extended deeper into the drain, and somehow seemed to promote a "scummy" build-up on the mesh portion, thereby restricting the flow of water into the drain.)This NEW STAR INTERNATIONAL model (while not as deep as the mesh one) allows better water flow while still managing to capture food debris.  This new model is also much easier to keep clean and not likely to come apart and cause injury as the mesh one did.  In fact, the NEW STAR model has been in use at our house for about 3 months and both have retained their shiny stainless steel luster without any fuss, muss, or cleanser.The only minor caveat of this model might be the fact that it is slightly more "mobile" than the wire mesh version -meaning- it appears that the stainless steel ring portion of the strainer is perhaps just a "hair" thicker than the mesh model and as a result doesn't "seat" as securely into the top portion of the sink drain.  But this is the only "minor flaw" I can relate with the use of this particular strainer.  Other than that; no complaints.  We'll see how well it stands the test of time.  (My previous wire mesh model only lasted a couple of years.)I HIGHLY RECOMMENDED THIS NEW STAR INTERNATIONAL HEAVY-DUTY 18/10 SINK STRAINER.  (I only wish the vendor had applied a shipping discount when TWO items were ordered.)
summary: GREAT KITCHEN SINK STRAINER... better than the mesh ones.

reviewText: I gave up on my old cheap toaster over and purchased aBreville BOV800XL The Smart Oven 1800-Watt Convection Toaster Oven with Element IQseveral months ago and was more that pleased with the build quality and performance of the oven so I thought that I'd try the matching toaster. I wasn't let down at all and this thing toasts bread perfectly and with great control. The two sides are very accurate producing perfectly matching slices from either side. The controls are very repeatable with LED lights glowing behind the segments of the browning scale. The toaster is very quiet gently raising the bread at the end of the cycle or with the "lift and look" button. Cleaning is easy enough with individual trays under each pair of slots. The power cord matches the our Breville oven with an easy to grasp loop in the plug. This is a well built and very well designed toaster!
summary: The Best Thing Since Sliced Bread

reviewText: Even with 2 scoops of ground beans and filter perfectly centered, once you pour the hot water in it goes through the strainer to fast before get suction top on messing up the flavor of the drink.

I used to have a coat rack that only lasted a few months, it was around $25 at the time I bought it, if my memory still serves me right.So when I came across this one on amazon.com for the price, I was a little skeptical, but based on all the excellent reviews posted by other online shoppers, I decided to give it a try. It turned out to be a good buy. Installation was fairly straight forward, only took me about 10 minutes to set it up with the help of the instructions printed on one single sheet of paper. It looks exactly the same as pictured with a solid metal base and a lot of hooks to hang your stuff. We have our caps, sweaters, handbags, scarfs, umbrellas hung on it, certainly not the prettiest sight at my house, but at least we now know where to look for things. The only thing I have not tried was my daugher's backpack, probably not a very good idea. For the price, I think it's a steal, not to mention I get free 2nd day delivery with my prime membership. If you are looking for a durable coat rack that will last, plus you are not too picky about the design and how it would fit the theme of your room, then buy it now before the price goes up.
summary: Finally, a solid coat rack at a reasonable price

reviewText: These liners don't inhibit the cooking and are tough enough to stand up to spooning the contents of your slow cooker without springing a leak. And when the contents have been spooned out, just gather up the bag and toss it in the trash.They work every bit as well as advertised. A Slow Cooker Must Have.
This organizer is fantastic!  I have all my cardigans and winter accessories stored in it.  I wouldn't put anything heavier e.g. jeans but sweaters and shirts are fine.
It works and did bring my Roomba back to life, but Roomba only runs for 45 min before returning to base on this battery. I think the original battery run slightly more than an hour when it was new.
summary: Works, but not for very long

reviewText: Pros: Nice looking, easy to operate, filter replacements are not too costly ($39), compared to some other companies.Cons: There is a low-pitch humming noise from the unit at the low fan speed that is a little annoying.For $399, be sure you receive a brand new unit from Alen, not a refurbished one like I did.
summary: Power supply hums & watch out for refurbished units

reviewText: As a longtime collector of kitchenware I have had more than my share of rolling pins.  This one is unseasoned maple and perfect for most simple baking needs.  It’s approximately 17-1/4” long and 2” in diameter.  I do love red-handled kitchenware and if anyone wanted, they could easily use a high gloss enamel paint of choice to spruce up the handles.Before you start, you should season the body of this rolling pin with a light coating of mineral oil.  It will keep the rolling pin in decent shape.  Do it now and then and you won’t have to worry about it cracking.  I don’t submerge any of my rolling pins after using them, but rather simply wipe them down with a damp cloth.The Ouddy is a good length and not difficult to roll out pie crust or biscuits.  Wood tends to stick a bit more, but I used flour in between rolling.  It does roll easily with no effort or sticking.  The handles are easy to grip and are wide enough at 3-1/2” for anyone to hold on to readily.  I gave it a workout on some biscuit dough and it performed as expected.If you want to make sure you are getting consistent thickness of your dough, you can check out eitherPerfection Stripsor rolling pin rings.  Just make sure they will accommodate the 2” width of the rolling pin as most of the rings need a wider rolling pin.As far as storage goes, there is no hole for hanging.  What I do with my odd long-handled kitchen accessories or rolling pins is store them all in an old vintage bucket.  They look good and are easy to store.  This is a nice rolling pin that works quite well and is at a very good price point at this time.Sample provided for review.
summary: A nice maple rolling pin that’s the perfect length for rolling out dough ...

reviewText: I wish I had read some of the reviews here before I got caught up in my late night excitement and spontaneity when I purchased this juicer. I most likely would have tried a different one first.I have no previous experience with juicers. I knew I wanted one that you could feed fruit and veggies into without a lot of prep. I had (perhaps foolish) visions of putting whole apples and oranges through my juicer, no peeling etc. Well, I know now there will always be some prep with certain foods. So that fantasy aside, I was still hopeful that for most things I could just feed them and get the pulp one side and the juice the other.This works that way for some fruits and veggies like apples, strawberries, tomatoes, carrots. Others like citrus, pineapple, watermelon need to have the skin removed first which is time consuming.What I like:1. You get a lot of juice. Most of the pulp seems pretty dry for what I have tried so far which is: apples, oranges, carrots, tomatoes, strawberries, watermelon and pineapple.2. Dis-assembly and cleanup is fairly simple and quick. It says it's dishwasher safe, but I have so far just washed in warm soapy water right after juicing and everything cleans well except the filter.What I don't like:1. For most fruit and veggies you still have to prep somewhat. Most apples even have to be cut down since the ones on the market most of the time are too large for the spout. If you were wanting to use the pulp for a recipe, then you should remove seeds and stems if you don't want them.2. The filter clogs easily. And cleaning it is a chore, even with the cleaning brush that came with my "special package" advertised.3. Because the filter clogs easily, if you're making a large amount of juice (more than 2 to 3 cups juice), then you have to break everything down, clean it out, re-assemble and continue. Messy.Having now done some research on Amazon and elsewhere, I would have most likely tried the Breville before this.

Bought this to make sure my new oven is accurate and it's been a great buy.  I just wish I could hang it in my oven, but the window is too small to be able to see it unless it was right in front of it, and then it would get in the way of taking pans out.  I really only use it when I need to change the temperatures while baking, since my electronic readout beeps before the oven is actually at the target temp.

This is one of those cases where I like the "idea" of the product more than the product itself. It is a great idea (having the cracker well and the cheese slicer together in one mechanism). However, it sounds better than it is in reality. Here are a few things I noted after using it that I hadn't considered prior to purchase:1. The wire is slightly crooked. Although there is a paper included in the box that states they come this way intentionally and that it is easily adjusted, as soon as I adjust it (gently pull the bar out), it just goes right back in and the wire remains crooked. I think maybe the bar it is supposed to be tighter? At any rate, it remains just slanted enough to hit against wood on one end. It is still operational; it's just annoying having to pull slightly outward with each slice to manually readjust.2. The board is very small (serves no more than two people), which I knew, but I didn't realize the slicing/storage area for the cheese was so small. There is really no place to put the cheese once it is sliced because you need the area for the brick of cheese to lay (the one you are slicing). So the only option is to set it someplace else (like on a plate) until you are done, and then you can transfer it back to the board. However, if I have to use a separate plate for this purpose, it kind of defeats the purpose of having the one slicing/serving tray.3. Lastly, and probably the most annoying aspect of using this device: The cheese fragments get incredibly stuck inside the slicing area (under the wire)as you cut. This makes cleaning VERY difficult, and always makes me think twice about using it. The only way to really clean it well is to run a knife, toothpick, or some other "crevice cleaning tool" through the area as you wash it.For the above reasons, I am not very satisfied with this product, and would not repurchase or recommend to others. In this case, I feel like I only use the product because I bought it, not because I really like it. I think you are better off with a regular cheese cutter and a plate.

I've only purchased this egg topper because it was in the egg holders-egg spoons-egg topper bundle.It is the most usless item I've ever seen; it barely penetrates the egg shell. I, definitely, wouldn't suggest buying it.

Have been searching for one that doesn't have the sponge fall off the head, is awkward to fill, leak or just fall apart.  This one does the trick.  The only thing I would change would be to have a slightly smaller head to reach into glasses, containers, etc. a little easier.  Small price to pay for something that is going to last.

I thought I would like this product because of it's large size.  That size has come back to haunt me.  We have a ceramic smooth top stove.  Because this item is so large, much of it extends past the edge of even the large front burners.  It does not conduct the heat well to the outer edges.  This translates into pancakes that are brown towards the middle of the pan, and pale along the outside.  After a couple of uses, the pan bowed up in the middle, making oils and batters run to the outside of the pan, into the cool zone.  I think this pan would be fine with a gas stove, but I wouldn't recommend it for a ceramic or element stye stove.

I really love this "Spectrum Designs 65400 Over-The-Cabinet Door Trash Bag Holder, White".  I have been wanting one for a long time and this fits under my sink and is very handy.  Like I said, I love it.
summary: Spectrum Designs 65400 Over-The-Cabinet Door Trash Bag Holder, White

reviewText: It's simple to use (2 buttons, geez), simple to clean, and last but certainly not least...simple to store! I love that since it's so slim and flat, I can toss it in a drawer on top of a bunch of other stuff. All kitchen appliances and gadgets should be this simple and fit into a kitchen this well.
My fault for not doing better research but disappointed that the largest container won't hold a whole bag of flour.
summary: Largest container too small for 5# of flour.

reviewText: This travel tumbler has great portability. Strong product and keeps beverages warm for a long time just like it is described. I highly recommend this product.

I purchased this trash can after seeing it at a friends house.  At the time we'd been having a lot of issues with our garbage because it was just too cumbersome to secure the bag in the trash to have the lid on.  But then without the lid, the bag would end up falling inside the container...  it was bad.  And when we did use the lid, it wouldn't stay shut after a while anyway, so that was useless.I'm very satisfied with this trash can.  It looks nice, and it functions well.  It's very easy to secure the bag in the can, and to remove it, which is a huuuuuuuuuuuuuuge plus!  The lid opens and closes easily too.The can IS lightweight and DOES move sometimes when you open it.  However, just put some anti-skid pads on the bottom, or place it on a rubberized mat, and it's great!  I think that's a small inconvenience and is totally overshadowed by the ease of securing  & removing the bags.  I recommend it and would buy again if something happened to the one I have.

I was disappointed by this purchase through Amazon.  I was expecting the molds to be for the jumbo size not just the standard size.  It would have been nice if the description for these molds had been clearer.  Normally speaking, regular size molds are sold in a 12 counts and jumbo in 6 counts.

Since I am clumsy and drop things I bought these. They have a strong plastic smell and make the beverage unappetising. I have been soaking the insides with a strong solution of baking soda and water for a few days and hope this solves the problem. If not, I'll buy glass glasses and take my chances.
Great product. Easy to set up and very precise. If you use this have a hard floor to put it on.
I purchased this bottle for it's capacity and that it has a swing top. I use this particular bottle for holding peanut oil that I use in oriental cooking and have no problems with it.
summary: Bormioli Rocco Giara Clear Glass with Swing Top Bottle

reviewText: I was surprised at the quality.  I bought it to matche other chrome and white in the bathroom and it matched perfectly.  I would recommend.

I had to send this item back, because it was way too large for our cabinets.  If you have shelves in your cabinets, it doesn't work.  It was very well made and heavy.  But be sure to measure before buying.

I bought three of these - two as kitchen gifts. These are like little toy things, and will break.  If you need this sort of thing, look at Messermeister brand.  For about U$25 you can get a real ceramic sharpener.

The product arrived a bit faster than expected (it's not an Amazon Prime item) and performs exactly as promised. I could wish it had a slightly longer gas hose, but this one is adequate, and appears very durable. I'm now able to carbonate my soft drinks easily, without a hiccup.

First off....don't buy this thinking it is a Keurig.  It's not, but then again this versatile little brewer is half the price of their cheapest model.  Keurig did one or two things better, however I like this better.PLEASE NOTE::: Do not overfill the reservoir.  10 ounces is it and I now use a measuring cup to make sure that is what goes in.  I saw the extra space and figured I could get an extra ounce or two in there and while it will fit, the machine will not disperse all of the water.  It's almost as if it knows what 10 ounces is!  However, if you move the machine, say, to the back of the counter, the machine will then disperse the extra few ounces of scalding hot water and you will get 1st degree burns that will irritate for a day and a half or so.  Stick to the 10 ounces and if that just won't work for you, you really need to look at something different.Onto the review:I thought this was the perfect solution for my house....I like using ground coffee and my husband prefers the KCups. His Keurig died after 14 months and we have decided we didn't want to spend that much money again.  Also, someone had mentioned in a comment that if you registered you Keurig, they will take care of you even after a year.  They don't.I had read the reviews carefully on this machine and carefully measured my coffee.  I have not had any issues with the "coffee explosion" as some have put it. I have used just the regular grind Maxwell House. The taste of the coffee was perfect for me.  I never was able to achieve this flavor using ground coffee in the adapter for the Keurig.You do have to manually push the KCup into place in the holder until you hear a click.  It a bit cumbersome to do, but I figure eventually it will be second nature.  I got a little spoiled I guess with just dropping it into the Keurig and letting the close of the lid do all the work.I am going to admit, I have never liked the taste of KCups....that is until this machine.  I don't know what it is, but somehow this does something different than his Keurig and the coffee is quite tasty.The coffee was very hot, but not scalding.I also found that using filtered water (like a brita pitcher) removed all of the funky plastic taste.  Our water is very chlorinated and nothing stinks or tastes worse than hot chlorine in hot plastic with coffee grounds thrown into the mix.  This plastic taste almost made me return the unit.  Thankfully it dawned on me that in our 10 cup coffee maker there is a filter to filter our water.  Using the filtered water from the brita pitcher made all the difference in the taste of the coffee.Brewing takes a bit longer...about 4 minutes.  But the wait is worth it.  I do believe that is why my regular ground coffee tastes so much better from this machine as opposed to the Keurig.  The grounds have a chance to get a bit wet before the water really starts pouring.The brew light does go off before the coffee is actually done dripping. And unlike the drip or two of the Keurig, this one will continue for about a minute.What I would have loved to see is a refillable water tank.  I bought it knowing it did not have one and for $49 I don't expect that option, but I honestly miss that feature and would have paid more for this model if it had one. But this machine does so many things right that I can live with that.The only reason I took off a star was because of the overfilling issue.  It is a safety hazard.  I understand it is very clear in the directions not to overfill it, but I would rather Hamilton Beach design the machine so that the excess scalding hot water be dispersed somewhere else and not out the spout when you are trying to move the machine.PROS:-Very flexible brewing options-Nice looking machine-Doesn't take up much space at all-Is quite easy to clean-Makes a great cup of coffeeCONS:-There's no getting around the 10 ounce limit with out risk of injury.-I feel that the brew light goes out too early.  A good amount of coffee still comes out after that brew light goes out.All in all, for the price and versatility it is a great little machine.
summary: Pleasantly surprised after owning a Keurig!

reviewText: Bodum products are about being a pleasure to see and use.  TheirBodum Stainless Steel Thermal Press Potis a work of art, and it makes really good coffee too.  This set of dishes is nice, and has some unique features, but it doesn't quite give me the joy that I expect from Bodum products, given the price.Overall they are very thin and lightweight.  The materials are all heat resistant, so they can be used in the oven.  But what these are really a better fit for is the microwave.  You really don't want to heat any plastics with your food in a microwave, but it's hard to find useful containers and lid combinations that aren't either plastic or somewhat bulky for a microwave.  (We're always putting an upside down salad plate over our Pyrex dishes, because we don't want to heat the plastic lids.)  This Hot Pot Set fits the bill - lightweight and heat-safe, both the dish and the lid.There are two dishes in the package, a one liter dish, and a 2.5 liter dish.  (A liter is a little larger than a quart.)  They fit inside each other.  The smaller dish is about 3-1/2 inches high by 6-1/2 across, and the larger is 4 inches high by 8-5/8 inches across.  You can't tell from the pictures, but the top edge is angled outward - the lid fits around that outward angled lip.The lids are silicone, and relatively thin, so very flexible.  The lid is heat resistant to 428 degrees F, so it can be used in the oven or the microwave - I think most people have missed that point - to reduce spattering.Borosilicate is the premium material for heat-resistant dishes.  At one time, the Pyrex products sold in the US were made from the material.  Now they have switched to cheaper glass, and while it generally does the job, it doesn't have the same resistance to thermal shock - Google on "exploding Pyrex."  So you aren't just getting good looks here, there's some substance to them.So these are nice, fairly attractive and well designed, and offer function that's hard to find - but at a fairly steep price.
summary: (3.5 stars) Well suited to microwave use, but design doesn't quite balance the price

reviewText: I am so happy I bought this machine! I have a DeLonghi espresso maker, and it makes great espresso, but the milk frother on my machine is a joke. In looking for a better milk frothing solution, I tried Aerolatte machines, but I wasn't satisfied with their weak results either. Luckily, I stumbled onto this device.To be clear, I was seeking out very thick, creamy, meringue-like froth. My espresso machine and the Aerolatte made foam with bubbles far too large to support this type of froth, so I was skeptical when I saw that this machine advertised "meringue-like frother," yet works on pretty much the same principle as an Aerolatte frother. Nevertheless, I decided to try it out, and on its first run, it gave me exactly what I was looking for: mounds of soft, pillowy forthed milk that looked more like whipped cream or meringue. I was also left with just enough steamed milk at the bottom of the pitcher to make my cappuccino.Making frothed milk with this machine couldn't be easier: add cold milk, put on the lid, and press a button. A few minutes later, the machine automatically shuts down when it's done. As I said, you're left with mounds of perfect frothed milk, and just enough steamed milk to finish your drink. The pitcher has a nonstick surface, so cleanup is pretty simple and doens't take much time.My only complaint is that it's a bit difficult to remove the frothing disk from the bottom of the pitcher, and the instructions don't provide any guidance or tips. My technique is to reach down underneath the disk and just pry up one side until it pops off. The disk is quite firmly connected to the pitcher and is made of thin plastic, so it doesn't seem like the best design. Like a previous reviewer, I was initially scared that I might break the disk, but it hasn't happened yet, so maybe it's more rugged than it looks. There's a little tab that sticks up from the center of each disk--it looks like it's for gripping the disk, but I didn't have any luck removing it that way. Another complaint is that the disk-mounting assembly sticking up at the bottom center of the pitcher is like a little needle! I got a pretty bad poke when figuring out how to attach and remove the disks, and, again, I didn't see any warning in the instruction book.Overall, however, these are very minor complaints, and I'm more than satisfied with this unit. It is a bit pricey for such a specialized machine, but if you'd otherwise be buying your coffee at a coffee shop, you'll make up the cost of the machine and then some in no time!
summary: Exactly what I've been waiting for!

reviewText: Bowl arrived in perfect shape.  This is a very heavy duty gauge steel and was cleanly finished.  The bowl lip is also very comfortable.  Very pleased with the product.

Quality product.  Bought as replacement for OXO.  The measurement labels wore off after a short time on the OXO.  Looked like crap !  The Pourfect has embossed measurement indicators.  Nice non slip rubber rings on bottom on the larger cups.  The variety of colors .... you cant go wrong !  Plus a much larger set than most.  I got the measuring spoons too !  Will say the same about them !
Fog-free?  No, you get free fog with this mirror.  It does stay put with the two suction cups.
so convenient

Got this to use occasionally outside.  It retracts well and pulls out really well and as far as advertised.  However it had those kind of plastic coated lines that stretch. The bracket on the bottom does not effectively hold the line when you wrap it.  I solved that by installing another bracket under the whole thing and I can wrap it tightly with that.beckytrn
Very nice hangers that don't leave "hanger bumps" on the shoulders of my shirts.

A stench developed in my kitchen. I could not find the source. It got so bad I thought something crawled under the house and died. Finally figured out the horrible smell was coming from this dish drainer. I threw it into the garbage. Instantly, the stink in the kitchen was gone.What horrible material is this made from?

This product has very good suction for a little machine, but the weird 'front claws' are alittle strange and are awkward to get around furniture legs or underneath furniture,  the little latch that you are supposed to be able to release with your foot is too small and I have to bend over the push it manually...which makes it harder to use.  Would not purchase this item again.
even on the lowest setting, the fan is quite loud.  powerful, sure, but a lower setting would have been appreciated.  it's not a good model, as it's too large for a desk, but too small otherwise.
summary: small and loud, but well built and effective

reviewText: I purchased a Zyliss Susi 2 garlic press and passed on my older Zyliss (original Susi) to my daughter.  The older Zyliss had a flat surface on the plunger that seemed to press out more of the garlic.  The newer Susi (which has a different plunger surface) leaves more garlic in the bowl.  Mine did not come with a cleaner, but I was able to clean it by running under water and scrubbing with a toothbrush.  This loosened the leftover garlic and was pretty easy to do.While it worked, this was a decent garlic press.  Now the bad part.  The pin that holds the two parts of the garlic press together kept coming out.  I would replace it and it would last for a while until it would come apart again.  The last time it came apart in my wash water, and the pin disappeared down the drain before I had even realized the press had fallen apart yet again.  So now I am left with a totally unusable garlic press.For the price of this garlic press, I should not be having to look for a replacement.  I will certainly not be getting this item again.

This is our second Alera shelf, the first one we bought already set up (from a local store), this one (and an Alera garment shelving) needs some "simple" assembly. But if your favorite tool is a hammer, i.e., you're not tool proficient, the assembly can still be done, but not simply.Quality is very high, much better than standard home shelving and, once set up, very sturdy. The package arrived in good shape, cleverly packed and protected, with all pieces present. No complaints. FYI, the flat box (3 or 4 feet long) weighs aprox 50 lbs, so if you're headed for the cellar . . .Here are some helpful set up tips which were NOT offered in the one-page help sheet:Use a tape measure  and some masking tape to mark where you want shelves placed. The little two-piece hold-clips take some effort and don't always set in the small pole grooves. That's were a rubber mallet helps . . .If you're using the wheels, wait until you're finished placing all shelves. There aint nothing more fun than a half-assembled five ft+ high rack rolling around while you adjust the shelves in place.Have an assistant. My wife helped me and, while there were some challenging moments, we remain married. At least until we try to assemble the still packed Alera garment rack.Again, if you're reasonably handy this is a five star product. All in all, great product and I'd buy it again.Hope this helped.

We had crab tonight, and these seafood picks work really well. The crabs have all the chambers at the connection between leg and body and the picks easily scooped out the meat. These picks are heavy and well made, with a soft grip that comes in handy because our hands tend to get messy from the seafood, so we can get a grip on the picks.I was worried the picks would be dangerous because one end is very sharp and two pronged and I worried that while I scooped with one end I might poke myself with the other, but that didn't happen. The sharp two prong end is perfect for grabbing hard to reach bits of seafood.

Purchased as a gift. Compared to a juicer I recently purchased for $300, this is a great value! It is a workhorse and even when it wears out will be reasonable enough to replace. Easy to wash if you rinse it off immediately. If placed in dishwasher, put plastic parts in upper area of dishwasher.
.....the amount of moisture it pulled out of my camper.  Also put one in my gun safe, works perfectly.  No muss no fuss.

I used this mold last night for the first time, and it was extremely easy.  The package recommended that I lightly dust the mold with cornstarch but I used powdered sugar instead, with great results.  I used the mold to make the beads and they looked great on my cake when finished.  I did learn to make sure to replace the powdered sugar dusting at least every two or three sets of packing the mold or I'd get a bit of sticking, and this was easily accomplished by using a small paint brush.  I also learned to make sure that I didn't have excess fondant on the sides or back of the beads as this made the beads look a bit sloppy, but I just used a small sharp knife to cut away any excess and it only took a couple of seconds.  Highly recommended.
summary: Totally loved the ease of making the shapes!

reviewText: I love these types of pitchers that can mix inside. It is a great product and would recommend it to anyone.

Got this the other day and it looks great.  The material is thinner and silkier than I imagined it would feel, but no complaints here.  I haven't decided if we're going to get a liner or not, but I don't think it'll need it.*eta*  Forgot to mention I'm using the curtain withMoen SR2100OWB Shower Ring, Old World Bronze.
Bright and beautiful!!!!!!  Sure adds a spark to my kitchen!!!!!! It is exactly the right color yellow as posted!!!!! Thanks

I had long wanted glass mugs, as I am a tea drinker and thought it would be enjoyable to see the colorations of my various teas. But these mugs disappoint.  They are very bulky and the glass is of poor quality.  There is a visible line where the two 'halves' were melded. The glass has streaks in it, rather than being clear throughout. It is also very thick, making the mugs excessively heavy.  I am not returning them since the shipping would be too costly, but I do not recommend these.
I complained all winter about not having a way to grill my foods indoors so as soon as I got the chance I bought this item. The first thing I cooked on it was steaks and they turned out great.

The best thing Brew Rite has going for it is the cheap price, and that you're buying in such a quantity, you probably won't run out. Otherwise, they're probably the thinnest filters I've ever used. I already had one accident from the paper tearing when I was throwing the used grinds out.No comparison to Melitta filters, and even the Shoprite store filters are luxurious next to these. My first and last purchase.
It's really good for the price.  I would've given it 5 stars if this company offered more accessories for you to be able to purchase.

Love the Bunn replacement container, Bunn really put thought not only into their brewing system but also the shape of the pot, easy to hold, long neck prevents spilling when walking with the pot and the small opening insures every drop land in your cup and not on the counter or on your table.  I tried an off brand of the same shape with the metal bottom & it started leaking at the seams within weeks,  Pay a little more and get the real thing.

First, I'll address one of the most popular statements in the reviews of this product, that this is a quiet air conditioner. While volume level is subjective, I have to say that this does not even come close to what I would call quiet, even for an air conditioner. I replaced a 5 year old Samsung unit that had the main board go out. I grew accustomed to the sound of that A/C as being at a comfortable, droning level that blocked outside noise and actually helped me sleep. This one has an entirely different noise.There are two types of noise a window A/C makes. One is the noise of the compressor, which this unit does a great job of isolating - the compressor noise is almost non-existent.The other is the noise of the fan. This unit's fan is louder than any fan (A/C or otherwise) I've ever had in my room. It's hard to describe - a mix of a loud whoosh with a little bit of roar thrown in. I slept better the previous 3 nights at 80 degrees with my Vornado fan than I did last night at 70 with this A/C.Pros:The air that comes out is ice cold.Takes very little time to start blowing above referenced ice cold air.Keeps my 156 sq ft bedroom nice and cool.Easy to install due to compact size (I installed it in a slider window - far from a typical installation).Did a great job reducing humidity in the air.Compressor is quiet with no loud noise when it kicks on or off.Cons:Much louder than reviews led me to believe (on both high and low settings).Very weird directional vents that cannot point lower than horizontal (I like to have cool air blowing right at me, and my window is higher than my bed)In the end, I will say that I am mostly satisfied. I would probably buy this unit again given the price to feature ratio.
summary: Not as quiet as the other reviewers suggest

reviewText: Needed a new cutting board and researched everything from the basic flexible models that we have up to the $400+ models and I have to say that I am really happy I went with this one. It works great, has a nice cutting surface with a juice groove, or flip it over and you have a solid cutting surface.The board does get marked up with knife cuts but from everything that I have read, this is a good thing. Many cutting boards like the bamboo models or certain hard woods are so hard that they will have a tendency to dull your knives (something has to give when cutting - the knife or the board). I dont think it looks bad and actually gives it character but that is just me. The board can be tossed in the dishwasher if you wanted to and does not require and oiling which is great.

This is a good size box, we were able to put the rest of our wood spoon collection in it as well. Just one negative thing, the wood tongs that came with it which were very usefull lasted three days before just coming apart. They were just poorly put together. The bamboo box with its wood tools are good quality so I will take off just one star for the broken set of wood tongs. Everything else is very good, was looking for max storage in a wood container and thats what we got, price function and looks all good.
Cheese crumbs get stuck in the opening and sometimes difficult to get out. Works well, but not for very hard cheeses - for these I prefer 8 or 10 in chef knife

I love this mug. If you put hot water in it before you use it, it keeps your coffee warm for up to 6 hrs! Plus the best thing about this is it's spill proof!! I am a truck driver and I don't always have a cup holder in the trucks I use. If you need something to keep your coffee hot and not spill everywhere, then buy this!!!! I have 3!

I teach high school science, and have to heat superglue to fume products for our forensics class. These are PERFECT. They're a bit higher wattage than some I've found (so coffee drinkers will like the warmer coffee), and the switch on the cord is great so that I can have the wamer in the fuming chamber, and turn on the heater externally.

I purchased this fan to help circulate the cool air from a wall air conditioner. It is doing the job. I've been running it daily for the past two weeks without any issues. It arrived quickly and was quick and easy to setup. I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend this fan to everyone.
summary: Love the Lasko 18" Pedestal Fan with Remote

reviewText: These are nice towels for around the house cleaning rags. Not thick enough to use a regular towels. I did find them too large, so I cut them apart and sewed them into different sizes.
It is a great product if you plan on buying one every 14 months. The warranty is only for a year. One day, it just stopped working, and gave off an awful smell.

Another reviewer complained that his/her roaster had arrived with  chips in the "enamel" -- and so did mine.  It was a large "chip" and a dent on one of those sharp handles -- almost the whole of one end handle.  Quandry:  send it back or live with it?  Surely this little roasting pan is just the right size for a Breville toaster oven, and probably other large toaster ovens, and I can't see that another small roasting pan  is available -- a better one at a higher price.I'm old enough to remember real granite ware.  You could buy it at the dime store, or local hardware store, and if it chipped, you could see the depression in the finish, not the item.  It really was a chip.  What's on my pan is really a sort of peel of a very thin coating.  You might think this thing was made in China.  But no:  sorry to say, it's US made.Does anyone know if there is a fix for this sort of thing?  Some wonderful Home Depot product that can be painted on?  I suppose I could go to Home Depot and ask -- I guess that's what I'll do.I'm assuming that a replacement would chip/peel sooner or later.  And sooner or later another, better, company will make a comparable item of good quality.  So I'll keep this and wait for that. And hey!  I just remembered I have a Le Creuset covered roaster.  But alas, not as high a lid -- so maybe no good for a whole chicken.  But for lots of other things it'll be just fine, & we can save this roaster for hams and chickens and baby goats and so on.

The best feature of this salt n pepper grinder is that it is two separate ends so there is no mixing of the salt and pepper as opposed to the other grinder from Ozeri.  The adjustment can also be made on the finer salt or pepper you wish to create.This product is safe and is BPA free and it is small so it does not take much room on the dinner table.  It is easy to fill and easy to use! I also love the silver color!

At this price point, I guess this a decent sheet set. The color is nice and the fabric feels soft. The only thing I don't like about them is that the sheets are quite thin (slightly transparent). I bought them for my son, and we decided they were nice enough to get another set for my daughter -- you can't beat the price.

The top of my bureau is and always will be a bit of a clutter bucket.  I got tired of losing things.  This set -- which look gorgeous, by the way -- have solved my problem.  My dresser top looks beautifully organized, and everything now has a place it belongs.
we moved into a apt that we can't have a grill so I bought this to grill inside and I love it would recommend toanyone oh and clean up is a snap!!!

I have a couple of BodumBodum H2O Travel Mug with Clip Handle, 12 oz., Greencoffee mugs. The screw on lids drive me crazy. They are hard to open after use. A regular jar opener has no room to grip it. I looked for an alternative and found this. It works great, the softness of the silicone with the grippy side down helps me open the mug. Great product!

Because of arthritis in my fingers, I had given up on manual can openers.  I order one EZ-DUZ-IT can opener from Amazon, so my family would have a new one to use.  I tried it and EUREKA! it works so easily and so well.  I'm order another 2,  so I'll always have a good one. By the way, it's MADE IN THE USA.

reviewerName: these pretzels r making me thirsty
reviewText: Returned a heavy duty baking sheet for one with sides.  Thought this looked nice in the picture which it does and it had great reviews but it's not my type of pan.  Everything sticks to it and is so hard to get off, used parchment paper but somehow the parchment paper slipped around and stuff crusted on the pan and edges.  It came bent on one side and I do not like the finish of it.  Wish I would have gotten one with a nonstick finish even if it didn't last long.  I am not going to return this pan too but I would never order it again.  It is lightweight and easy to handle but other than that, I wish I had gotten a different brand.
summary: Wish I had shopped around a little more

reviewText: This item work great, just cut the head off and twirl away, and pineapple comes out, nice.. This is just so easy
we bought these cheap sheets for medical purposes and found that they are actually quite nice for the small amount of money they cost us.  maybe not ideal color options, but certainly worth it!

We had kind of given up on frying because of the clean up mess, but this fryer has us back into it.  Everything but the heating element goes in the dishwasher.  And the auto-drain pan works like a dream.  Several people commented on it leaking, but I think the issue is capacity.  As long as you don't overfill the fryer with oil, it works just fine.  Pop the oil in the tupperware-like tray into the fridge, and it's ready for next time.  Heats reasonably fast.  Temperature seems constant.  My only hangup is because of the oil tray, the unit is TALL, and the  red "ready" light, which is positioned above the temperature dial is hard to see.

I have the original press with shiny metal frame and black nob on top of the silver metal lid. This beaker fits perfect as the replacement for my original expensive 32oz press... and the best price out there I could find!

In 2008, I developed breathing problems from an exposure to roofing dust.  The pulmonologist said to keep the house free of dust but didn't want me to vacuum - I don't have a cleaning service so I went to Costco and bought a Roomba.  I used it frequently for months until my breathing problems subsided and then resumed cleaning with my regular vacuum cleaner.  I then only used the Roomba in my bedroom as I have a very heavy metal bedframe which is difficult to move and that was the only feasible way to clean under the bed.  Then the Roomba died this summer.I checked at Costco and the model carried there just cost too much.  But earlier this month, my dog had an appointment with a dermatologist.  We've been struggling the whole year with his scratching, biting and licking himself and the dermatologist ran an allergy test which showed that, among many things, he's allergic to housedust.  Since my dog crawls under my bed when he wants to be alone or naps under the bookcase headboard, I knew I would have to get another vacuum robot.  So when this Roomba showed up as a lightning deal, I snapped it up.The Roomba will not take the place of cleaning with a regular vacuum cleaner but if you want a tool which will surface clean in between your regular vacuuming and you want to schedule cleaning when you are out, then consider getting a Roomba.

What I like most about this steamer basket is that the legs are 1 1/2 inches tall.  Most others are 1 inch or a little less.  That makes a big difference & you don't have to constantly check your pot to see if it ran dry.

I'm not a good baker. I try to be, but I'm usually an epic failure. But I decided to try this one.This muffin pan makes mini muffins. For the more educated(obviously not myself) they probably would know this. But stupid me thought it was a normal size muffin pan.  I decided to make pumpkin muffins.  I greased and floured one side of the pan and did nothing with the other side.To my amazement, both sides of the pan came out without a lot of trouble. And my muffins were cooked properly.
