They were moist and evenly baked and didn't come out half done or hard(which is typical with me). I was very impressed. I wish I could say it was my talents as a baker, but I know that can't be true.I love this pan and would get others too.  I'll have to see what else Dr. Oekter has.I would also like to note that my oven is old. It is pushing around 20. Yet, my muffins came out great!
summary: Awesome! Works for the nonbaking chick!

reviewText: I really like the silicone grips on these stainless steel spoons, and I also like that they're held together by a ring.  Ever since my teenage son has started doing dishes, I find my cooking gadgets randomly tossed into different drawers.  With the spoons held together like this, at least I know they won't be separated.They're solidly made with the capacity engraved into the metal of each spoon so it won't wear off.  I recently bought a similar set, which made me realize that I definitely want to get rid of my old plastic measuring spoons.  (I could never keep a complete set anyway, considering how often they would melt against the dishwasher coils or a hot burner.)I bought these on sale so I could have two complete sets to use when I'm baking or cooking a big meal.  I like the free recipe book that came with them.  Very pleased with this purchase!

We purchased 6 of these - all were good on delivery.  The triple hook is very useful for our customers.  The only negative thing I can say about these is that the hooks turn very stiffly.  You may want to lubricate them before you install them and let them sit for a day or two before use, but then don't forget to wipe off the oil before you use them - you don't want to get oil on your cloths.

Decent over the door hooks are hard to come by, so I was pleased to find these as a Vine choice.They fit snugly over a 1 3/4 inch (exterior) door and the hook ends are protected with non-marring plastic caps. The hooks themselves are sturdy and well spaced. I think the brushed stainless steel is attractive.For an 1 3/8 inch interior door they don't fit quite as well as the spring tension clips don't hold as firmly as I would like. But since this is going to live on our back door this won't be an issue for us.

I gave this product as a gift.  Therefore, I don't know if it really works.  It was on their registry for a housewarming.  Sadly, I think a friend did the registry (and it was a full registry like a wedding???) so I don't know that the homeowner even wanted this.  I felt bad but, whatever.  It looks cool.

I **used to** love this mug.  The mug could use more refined looks and packaging but it worked very well.  My relatives and friends in China love this mug, too, and I leave mine to them every time I go back to visit.  As the result, I had bought at least 3 in the past and the last was in August 2009 (just checked).  So after my recent trip to China, I ordered 2 to always have one for myself.  However the result is very disappointing this time.  The cap has changed and just looks cheesy and low quality.  It doesn't look like the picture for the product on Amazon anymore.  And there are two real issues: 1. The plastic on the inside of the cap smells strongly, well, like plastic.  I don't think the ones I had bought before had this problem.  I soaked it in hot water overnight and the smell becomes a bit tolerable.  2. When I tried to drink out of the mug, the changed shape of the cap makes drinking a bit tricky -- I feel the rim is not deep enough for me to drink without dripping.  Now I will return the 2 mugs I've just bought.  It's too bad that a good product is ruined by cheap parts.BTW I'v uploaded a customer image of my newly bought mug for the product.Well, I'm updating the review since I want to thank the vendor for what they have done for me.  After writing my original review (all words above this paragraph) I contacted Highwave to return the mugs.  The response came back from Diana Ross at Highwave.  She said the new cap was actually a better, improved version but she had some old caps that she could mail to me.  I happily accepted her offer and the caps have arrived!  They look exactly like the official product picture and was exactly what I had before.  I thank her very much for turning a grumpy customer into a happy one!
keeps drinks hot or cold for a while. sometimes leaks a little and can be hard to clean well. .

This stockpot replaced one that had the handles riveted onto the sides.  Acid from years of chili/spaghetti etc., corroded the rivet sites causing leakage and eventual handle failure.  This huge pot has the handles soldered onto the outsides so that the interior is smooth with no weak points to corrode.  Wonderful!  The 16 qt size allows me to place a tall stewing basket containing a very large stewing chicken inside and cover with water for chicken stock.  When finished cooking, I can lift out the basket, chicken and all leaving wonderful chicken stock that does not need to be strained.  Would definitely buy this again- it is my favorite pot.

This roaster is good quality. I prefer glass pans for cooking. The glass is thick. I am disappointed though because the description said that it would fit up to a 12 lb turkey. I have a 10 lb turkey and it does not fit in the roaster. Now I paid a lot for a pan to use on Thanksgiving and I can not use it :(I'm sure I will be able to use the roaster for other cooking purposes but I'm not happy that I could not use it for the main purpose in which I had intended.Update 1 year later: It is time for thanksgiving again. This year I have an 8.5 lb turkey. It just barely fits in the roaster and is squished. So the description that it "easily holds a 12lb turkey" is not accurate. I did not even stuff my turkey and I still had to break some bones to get the lid to close. Do not buy this as a turkey roaster. I use it for pot roasts and hams and it works well. It is just not high enought for a turkey.
summary: Good quality, inaccurate description for capacity

reviewText: This is the first tension rod for my stall shower that held its ground over time. Once it's in it's in. There is really irritation when these rods slip because it's difficult to re-install them. I highly recommend this Zenith twist tight shower stall rod.
summary: A Tension Rod That Will Not Slip

reviewText: I can't say enough about this company and its product.  After I ordered I got a personalized email, telling me I could have my pillow stuffed firmer or lighter-- whatever suited me!  Or I could get a slightly larger pillow (which is what I opted to do).  The pillow arrived promptly, the quality is amazing, and it is so soft and snuggly I just want to hug it!  They also sell pillow cases for the travel pillows in amazing colors-- I chose eggplant, so it wouldn't blend in with those white pillows at hotels and get left behind.  They also offer an incredible array of goose down services and products.  If you need a travel pillow, this is definitely THE ONE TO BUY!!

I love this blanket!  It's very well made with a beautiful pattern and a lovely warm mango sorbet color.  Was going to use it under my quilt for extra warmth but it's too nice to hide.  Will keep it on top of the quilt folded at the end of the bed.
summary: Beautifully made and a lovely color

reviewText: Got the pan to make small subs and it works perfect for making them, they turn out like mini Subway subs, easy to use and clean would recommend to others who want to made subs. Thank you.

This product works just like it should. It is soft and form fitting. There are no batteries to poke you with. It's light and portable. The price is very inexpensive compared to other car back supports. The only drawback is the pillow is not very wide and unless you are very skinny you'll overlap a bit. Thankfully I'm more skinny than not right now.
summary: Works fine but needs to be a little Wider

reviewText: This grinder does a fine job of grinding, but the process can be improved. The bottom is too short and round for a comfortable grip. When I grind coffee, it's my left hand holding the base that gets tired because of its shape.Adjusting the grind initially takes some time. Basically you grind some coffee and turn a screw a little bit to make it finer or coarser.
summary: Really good, but needs some improvement

reviewText: Installed yesterday, and it works great!  Now our recycle bin won't overflow.  This is made pretty sturdy, and it doesn't take a lot of effort to crush the cans.  The storage bin slides off and on easily.  No stress, and no mess!
Just what I needed in my kitchen. I love this thing. It's one of those appliances you get and you don't know how you did without it for so long.Homemade mayonnaise, yummy!

I thought these would be the perfect for me.  I"m always needing square cookies and I like to use the smaller squares to do decorating.  Well... I should have paid more money for a different set.The largest cutter didn't properly fit into the round container but they squeezed it in there anyway causing the flimsy sides to become distorted.  Not a big deal, I was able to manipulate it back into a square.The biggest disappointment was the smallest square.  It's not even a square!  The two ends were joined together in such a way that the top of the square slants upward.  If I were ever to use this cutter I would have to take a knife and re-cut that one side to make it a square, it is THAT noticeable.I highly recommend you purchase a different set from a different manufacturer.
summary: Do Not Buy! Cheap and Flimsy!

reviewText: Both this for my granddaughter and had about six months or so. It is GREAT. All her little toys are at hand and when done playing it makes for easy pick up. No rooting through toy boxes for the toy of the moment.
This arrived very quickly and boy does it work!!  It works on my dull scissors(which is an added bonus) and works great on my knives, even the serrated ones.

Works great ... I had a HVAC guy install it all with the new Honeywell Thermostat ... a must for winter! Especially if you have wood floors or just want to be comfortable in your home. Your furnace dries out the air .. your wood will thank you! :) I had put one in my old house and just had to have one in the new house! Enjoy and just buy it ...

Easy to assemble and excellent quality.  I was concerned about the specific color of "natural".  It doesn't have that lifeless rubberwood look, but rather, it looks like a nice light maple.  Two of the rolling casters have locks if you'd rather it didn't roll.  I couldn't be more pleased.

I love the concept but it just didnt work for me.Everything sticks, even after I seasoned it, put in oven, cool it down reseason it, over 3 times ... It still stick.My mistake was also that I used it to make acidic food (like tomato sauce), I had no idea and the dish came out tasting odd.I guess this pan is just good to sautee some chicken with onions or to make a steak aybe? I really dont know but it doesnt help my cooking style :( too bad.
summary: Maybe cast iron is just not for me

reviewText: It was cheap.  I probably could have gotten it from the sale bin at Big Lots!  However, once I fixed the problem of havingno holes for two legs and managed to get it together, it works alright.  It is a good height that fits under the chair it's usedwith and I do use it.
summary: Frenchi Furniture Queen Anne Style Footstool w/Storage in Oak

reviewText: This is just great stuff, I never knew that cheesecloth could come in this quality.I'm surprised that I am so impressed over something like this. I even come over here to buy some more (but its currently unavailable)I'll keep coming back and checking if it becomes available then.
Nice towel set, reasonable price. Arrived quickly. My husband likes soft and fluffy towels, I like linen towels, this fits his needs. Hope they hold up to frequent washings.

I bought this slicer to use occasionally for slicing bulk salami, cured meats, cheeses, deer, homemade bread, and beef.  This is not a heavy-duty industrial slicer and cannot be compared to a Hobart or Berkel.  If you are wanting a slicer for more industrious purposes then one of the mentioned thousand plus dollar slicers are perfect.  But this one was less than one hundred dollars and is perfect for small jobs.The first thing I like is the fact that it is small enough to fit under our counter, making it very convenient to get out.  Convenience is a huge factor.  If it takes longer to get the slicer out and set up than it would to use a knife then it wouldn't make sense to use--believe it or not this happens a lot with kitchen appliances.I will concede that there are some plastic parts on the appliance (there's more metal than plastic), but in my opinion that is not a detriment to this appliance because most will not be using it in a deli or butcher shop.  A few gears are made of plastic, etc., but given the intended application of this appliance I feel that's okay.  I've had no stripping of gears or broken pieces as of yet and I've been using the machine for nearly six months.  Just make sure you keep the plastic blade gear lubricated.  Though not USDA approved, an inert petroleum jelly like Vasoline will work fine.I never force anything through the blade and by doing that I end up with uniform cuts.  I'm sure Chef's Choice did not engineer the appliance to perform well using Hulk-like strength to muscle food stuffs through.  If you don't gently push the food though the cuts are un-uniform and wavy looking.  I would recommend gentility when slicing.  Remember, you're not working at a deli or butcher shop cutting hundreds of pounds of meat a day.I've not had any problems using the serrated blade that came with the appliance, but I do like the way the non-serrated blade cuts (bought extra).  I prefer the non-serrated blade, but that doesn't mean you'll be disappointed by the serrated blade.Clean up is easy.  Everything that needs to be disinfected disassembles easily.When I cut jerky, or any meat, I leave the meat mildly frozen.  It will become obvious if you try to cut fresh meat.  If the meat is too soft the cut uniformity will not be there.I strongly recommend the product.
These were a great buy. The price was terrific, they are soft & comfortable, & I really like the color.

This "egg" is a perfect cookie size for sugar cookies. Too many times cutters are small and the thin sugar cookies brown too much. I like this size also because it is a good size for Scotch Shortbread or even sandwiches. Good service from order, also.

This small Lasko heater worked for about 20 minutes then just died. It's a poor quality appliance. Don't waste your money. The much larger Lasko tower heater I also have has worked well for several winters. Don't know what the difference is. They should both be good.
summary: WORKED FOR 20 MINUTES THEN DIED. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.

reviewText: This brand is accurate for the markings. Other brands of this product were so inaccurate as to make them unusable. I use it to soft boil eggs.

Terrible product design.  Ruined my countertop. Stained my light oak cabinets. Leaked all over my floor, filled a drawer and ran down the front of solid oak cabinets.  Dark streaks Stained won't come out and countertop is buckled and has to be replaced.  Still waiting for a satisfactory reply from Hamilton Beach.Initially was told it was a bad gasket.  Now am being told it was the screws on bottom of pot.  Either way, it is a defective product.
these make nice sized paw prints. Can be used for decorations on cakes or individually. I like having that option. Would buy again.

Well, I ordered this to use on the ziploc vacuum bags that others say it works well with.  The little machine works good and it holds a charge for a long time.  But, I ddi not have good luck with it working with the ziploc bags.  The first couple of times I used it with the foodsaver bowl that came with it and it worked really well, then all of a sudden the bowl wouldn't seal.

This set arrived and it's quality was defidently outstanding. They are durable and going to lady a long time. Totally  am glad we got this set. You can't really tell from the pics but all puts and pans are made very durable and Are large enough that you won't have sauces spilling out or things boiling over.

It fits all my need. keep coffee hot for hours, leak free, one-touch open & close.  The blue rubber stopper is removable for cleaning. extra lock to prevent leaking.  I can use it when I'm driving. I love it!

I like this product, and I use it in one of our lower cabinets to store extra stuff - but it has a little extra lip, so I can't put it in all of my cabinets. If the cabinet door closes flush with the shelf, this rack doesn't work. I put it on a shelf that was placed back from the cabinet door and it's fine.
summary: Doesn't fit in all my cabinets

reviewText: I was terribly disappointed when the coating inside the pan just peeled off after first use. The material is so of poor quality. I'm returning this and although I used Amazon's free drop off locker I ended up paying $11 for the labels and a box that fits the pan, plus an extra hassle. Not happy at all.
Really nice tray - wish they made an even larger one!

I don't know how many press pots I have gone through since I discovered that they are the ONLY way to make a really good cup of home-brewed coffee, but I wish I had found this brand sooner.  Not only is it virtually indestructible, but it is also beautiful--imagine yourself drinking coffee with Lotte Lenya in Berlin or with Carla Bruni in  Paris. I have never had coffee poured from a press pot as hot (just prewarm the Frieling with hot H2O while you grind your beans).  The sreening device performs masterly--unlike some others there's no need to pour the coffee through a tea stainer to catch those escaped grinds. Well worth the price, the 4 cup makes one perfect large American-size mug of hot, never bitter coffee--what a perfect way to start the day!  I also purchased the largest Frieling and it is equally as beautiful and lovely to use.
summary: Should have bought this ten press pots ago!

reviewText: This is the best roasting pan EVER!!!  It fits my huge turkeys and has the rack to lift it out with too!

My wife and I are trying to get away from Teflon coated items. And by next year I believe the government of the US will mandate no more Teflon cookware to be sold in the US. Our old teflon coated stock pot had croaked. My wife came back with this pot. (Teflon free :))The quality is amazing! I had heard that Calphalon was high quality and it really is! The heft of the pot along with the tightness of the build is second to anything I have ever used to cook with in the kitchen.The lid is just a micrometer too small so that it will never vapor-lock onto the pot when it gets hot. I have had other pots where it took an act of God and several icecubes to get a lid off. After a month of cooking with this it has never once vapor-locked.You pay a little more for this quality but it returns in dividends in the end, because you will probably never need to replace this. Compare that to subquality cookware where you have to replace it every year or so.The handle looks like it would take a crowbar to come off. I had a handle break off once on a cheaper pot, as I was picking up tomato sauce I had been cooking all day. Lets say I never want that to happen again, and it looks like it never will with this one!A great product!Thanks for reading my review.
summary: The gold standard for home cookware

reviewText: I have it in a area where it would have to run all the time.  Even the bit I have it running it does remove pretty much moisture from the air.  Works well.  I just bought the product too small for my needs.  I will keep it and have it work with what it was meant to do.  Some of the moisture out of the air is better then none taken out.
summary: Works well in Small areas like a closet, bathroom or enclosed hall

reviewText: The first time I plugged in and turned on this mill, it worked for 5 second before I turned it off. I was testing it. And that was the last I got out of it. It never turned back on.The returns process through the manufacturer was very simple, though UPS has yet to come pick up the old machine.The machine that actually works is not too bad. It grinds alright, but produces quite a bit of coffee bean dust, which finds its way easily into the bottom of our coffee pot. I am sure a paper filter would solve this problem, but we use a metal re-usable filter, so we'll have to deal with it.It is LOUD. I don't use it after 8pm because I feel bad for the upstairs neighbor. I mean, it's not THAT loud, but it's loud at night when people are tying to sleep, ya know? I also don't use it in the morning. Same problem.I do like the container that the ground coffee deposits into. It's very well contained... until you open it, and coffee dust spills on your counter. Just open it over the sink and you'll be fine. But otherwise, while it's grinding nothing escapes, and I leave the unused ground coffee in the container for a few days and it seems to stay fairly fresh.The machine is about twice the size I think is necessary for the average person or couple, but if you're going to make plenty of coffee and need to grind plenty of beans, this machine's capacity is great. It IS as tall as my actual coffee maker, though. And to be honest, I like the settings, even though I make my coffee a little less strong. So I just use a little less coffee than the machine seems to think I need. (It supposedly times it to grind for 4, 8, etc etc cups of coffee.)
summary: first one broke, second one's still kicking

reviewText: I had high hopes of this press.  I read multiple reviews and this Bodum model is sold at Williams and Sonomo so I thought it would be great.  Well it leaks.  The first week I took it to work with me, it leaked in my car twice.

I'm getting the hang of this mug.  One little drawback that cost it a star.  The opening where the hot liquid is dispensed doesn't have any indentation for hot liquid to go but onto the drinker, if they spill while drinking.  Contigo's identical mug with the handle has a better well in the lid.
This will keep your lunch kit cool all day.  Just wish the size were slightly bigger.  It does the job.

This is the most superb device ever designed for a bathroom. Period. I have gained a number of gallons in each of my baths now. I simply love how I can now truly soak.. being able to fully submerge my upper back and shoulders, even up to the nape of my neck now(!) without the water automatically draining when it reaches a certain level. It is to be noted that you must take care when using this device as it is entirely easy to overflow if you do not watch your levels. I came close the first time I used it and have since learned the right level to fill for me. Since every body is different, I suggest a few trial runs with this product to discover your proper fill level.

These slow cookers are very good for entertaining.  The looks are really nice and good for display during small parties.  I have a couple of Bella products that I own and have been very pleased with the results.  I think that these products are good looking and functional.  For me, Bella works really well for entertaining.  I am not affiliated to the company, I just like the products.I made chicken wings for a crowd with three different sauces then put them in these cookers at a low temperature.  Each 2.5 qt cooker is able to fit up to 2 dozen chicken wings (wings and drumettes).  The wings stayed warm for several hours without a problem.  I placed signs with the different sauces and everyone was really impressed.  I really like how the lids can be placed in the back and it's easy to serve with one hand (which is really handy when your other hand is holding a plate) Also, be sure to let people know that the cookers are hot on the outside (sometimes really hot).As for the design itself, the cooker has a simple dial on the front with a small indentation that points at the low, high, warm setting.  It is kind of hard to see it especially if the lights are a little dim.  The base of the cooker is not heavy at all is made mostly of plastic.  They attach to each other - there's a really good video from another reviewer that shows this part very well.  And lastly, for storage purposes (stack on top of each other) dimensions are 10" front length, 11.5" depth (including knob), and 21.5" high if the lid is upside down.Very good product but my only concern is the cord.  It's a unique design.  Though cords are really tough and hard to ruin, I wonder if there's a way to replace it.  Overall, I am satisfied with the cookers and hope to use them a lot.
I think if you just need a quiet little fan you will be happy with this for your window. It doesn't sound like a 747 in the bedroom!

**UPDATE 4/27/2013**This pillow soon became lumpy so I tried to wash it (according to the instructions on the tag) to fluff it up. BAD IDEA!!! It never dried even after drying it 10+ times. Ended up throwing it away because it started to smell moldy.
summary: **UPDATED - don't buy if you like to wash your pillows!!**

reviewText: Our four kids all like our old Stir Crazy popcorn maker, but this one tops it!  The kids were excited as we opened it (it is packaged well) and couldn't wait to make the first batch.The machine is easy to set up, easy to use, and relatively easy to clean.  I would have no problem letting my 10 year old make a batch of popcorn.  The only thing that gets really hot is the silver bowl inside (which can't be touched unless the door is opened).  So it's great if your kids love to watch it pop - not too dangerous.As another reviewer said, it doesn't fit under most countertops, so it isn't easy to store.  The cord could be longer, but it didn't bother me too much.  There are a lot of plastic parts on this machine (the windows are not glass), but I'm OK with that because it seems pretty sturdy.  If it breaks within a year, I'll post here and let readers know.All in all, we really like this machine and would recommend it (my kids would recommend it too!).

We registered for these glasses for our wedding and have realized that one set just isn't enough. We liked them enough to buy a second set of glasses. They have held up very well in the five months we have had them, despite overloading the dishwasher.They hold a lot more than most glasses. The large glasses with hold a whole can of pop with ice. The small glasses are wider than the tall glasses and hold a lot more than expected.

So I bought two of these pillows, one for me and one for my wife.We have been on a quest to find the elusive "perfect pillow".My wife has accomplished that feat in this pillow.  I have not.I didn't care for it.  It leaked on me the very first night I used it, and it was not user error.It must have had a small tear or hole in the water reservoir, because it was not leaking fromthe fill valve.My wife's pillow on the other hand, has been working wonderfully for over a month now with not a single drop leaking.It's pretty easy to fill up and you can customize the firmness level you want, which is a huge plus to most people.I did sleep on the non-leaking pillow one night, and still did not enjoy it that much.  It was certainly better than your average $10 pillow at Wally World, but not something I would buy again.I'm sure that my wife will replace hers if anything happens though.So I give it four stars because she loves it so much.
summary: Good for some, not for others

reviewText: the size of the cubes were much smaller than i anticipated, almost pointless to even make ice with this because it will melt so fast in the cup. but it did say mini, just didn't realize it was that small.
does what it is suppose to, and is durable; my only complaint is that the design of the handle makes it take more space than it really needs to.
summary: Heafty & sold, a little larger than it needs to be

reviewText: I bought this set to start out after moving into my first apartment and getting my first real job after college: They are absolutely GREAT! I love the different sizes that come in the set and the steaming basket that comes along with it. The pots are great for sauces, soups and anything that requires boiling a large amount of water. The pans really are nonstick and heat evenly. I've gone through many pans that claim they are non-stick and even heating but this brand truly lives up to its claims! I definitely would have liked to see a bigger frying pan but as a starter set, it's great!

I needed to replace our older style coffee pot and I found this model with great reviews. Great style, stainless steal interior, quiet, quick and the carafe keeps the coffee hot for a long time even after I turn it off.Note: I looked for the extra warming button on my coffee machine and couldn't find it.  After looking at the directions again ... the page that showed the carafe said the warming button is on the model with the glass pot.  No matter ...I hope this info. is helpful.
summary: Makes a great cup of coffee.

reviewText: These are perfect little funnels especially if you make your own lotions or macerated oils or Tinctures.  They fit in the 1 oz and 2 oz boston bottles.
The machine does a good job cleaning hard floors and the polish looks good after applied.  Beats getting the mop and bucket out anytime.

reviewText: Ended up being too small for my purposes. Couldn't contain enough frosting to pipe on 24 mini cupcakes with enough slack at the end to seal it properly.
summary: Ended up being too small for my purposes. Couldn't ...

reviewText: After using this product several times in order to separate eggs, I am inclined to believe that the whole process would have been much easier had I not used the Egg Yolky 96035 Egg Separator.  It's a nifty little product, but unfortunately it's just too small.  It certainly won't settle over a mixing bowl or jug, so you'll find yourself having to hold this in one hand whilst breaking the egg in the other.  I'm certainly not very good at doing that.  The product could really have done with a long handle or something of the sort.  In addition, this product does not make separating the yolk from egg white a very quick process.  I believe the reason may be because the holes are too small-egg white takes forever to drip through into the container below.  Impatience only lead to the yolk breaking and spilling through the holes.  As a final note, a large egg barely fits into the indention, and if you're slightly off by an inch or so when breaking the egg into this gadget, you might end up with egg anywhere but where you wanted it.Whilst it's easy to clean and looks cute, there's not much else going for this product.  Others might have better luck, and for the low price, it's not a bad choice if you're not too picky.  Overall though, I would not recommend and am now in the process of looking for a better alternative.

This coffee maker was recommended to me by someone who did extensive research and is extremely picky about his coffee. When he speaks, I listen. ;)  Good call. This makes amazing coffee. I had no idea what I'd been missing with "normal" machines or even French Press without the precision that is built into this little guy's process.An accompanying burr grinder makes all the difference, too, according to my friend. The combo is perfection.
summary: Wow - I look forward to getting up

reviewText: These are good quality pillows---not think or chintzy in any way. I love that the covers some off for washing---I have a cat and it makes it so easy to keep them pristine. They are classic enough to go with any decor.
Very soft and extremely warm. I have not tried to wash it yet though, which is the reason I bought it so I don't have to struggle putting a duvet cover on anymore.

Just want to express unending praise for USA pans in all its products/  Yes there are heavy aluminum like pans available - but who really wants that oxidizing and etching as you cook with it pan in contact with your food?????  This pan has the silicone coating that seems impervious to food.  It has all the great taste - bread comes out like you had it in a brick oven and I'm getting results better than I've had in a long time - but even better- it releases instantly without cracking or breaking or having parts flake off - you know what I mean!!  And cleanup could not possibly be easier!
summary: Wonderful pan that makes bread taste and feel like a brick oven and more ....

reviewText: Simple, doesn't look like much of anything can go wrong with this knife.  The handle feels cheap, but there is nothing really wrong with it.  The knife is quite flexible and cuts nicely.  I wonder whether I shouldn't have gotten the Granton edge.There is really nothing to complain about with this knife, it just doesn't make you feel happy like when you grab a Wusthof or other high quality knife.  But you also paid no where near what one of those puppies cost, so sometimes that can bring a wry smile!
Beautiful. Functional and makes pies more fun. My children have always liked the nursery rhyme. Just making memories. Making something as simple as a pie a little more special.

I was a bit skeptical when I ordered these but needed a couple of travel coffee mugs I could take with me.  I have to say these are by far the best insulated cups I have ever tried.  Not only do they keep hot coffee hot for a ridiculously long time (like you can drink your coffee an hour or more later and it's still hot) but the snap close lids are completely leak-proof.  Highly recommend this product.
summary: Amazing - You have to have one

reviewText: This iron works well.  However when it was first used it caused brown spots on the sheets.  I presume that it was dirty and we should have run it a couple of times to clean it out.  The instructions are sparse and misleading.  It said that we should run a cleaning cycle.  However there is no apparent way to switch the cleaning cycle on.  It is also oracular on the subject of distilled water.  Seems that tap water is best but 50:50 tap:distilled could be used too.  However reading sheep's entrails is not my way of deciphering the proper functioning of an electrical device and so this iron, despite now ironing well and having a great, non-stick surface, only gets 3 stars.

I bought this with the idea of a more sanitary cutting surface. That was not enough to keep me from disliking it at the end. Every time I used it to cut meat or veggies it would make a loud and annoying clacking noise (with each knife stroke). It also did dull my knives almost immediately. Now I use cheap plastic cutting boards that I replace often. I heard that a good quality butcher block not only lasts almost a lifetime but it also prevents bacteria growth, so I might get one as a permanent solution.
this is a short table that I use between two occasional chairs.  It is the perfect height to put a glass on.  This is a lower table whose top is BELOW the arms of the chairs.
It is a easy scoop to use and clean..I use it over other scoops and it is light weight too.

My bad. I have a set of All-clad cookware, and wanted a steamer. I should have heeded the many reviews that said that this product is not a good solution. The fact that it necks down at the bottom really DOES mean that food cooks unevenly and that things stick to the part where it necks down. The sticking part is particularly true for leafy vegetables. I'll be getting rid of this and reverting to a good, old fashioned, collapsable steamer basket.

Making popsicles with this rig is fun, easy and the treats can be as healthy as you want to make them.  I get three sets of popsicles with one freezing (if they don't involve too many pours - making patterns).  Love all the the diffrent recipes and many diffrent patterns.

The size is good woth 2.5 lb capacity.I have used it with 3 different sizes of casings (19/22sheep, 29/32hog, 50fibrous)Later I purchased the stainless steel tubes matching with the filler because I felt that the tubes wouldn't relesae the casing smoothly enough if they are a little bit tight.Pros:- almost all parts are very easy to clean- optimal size for "household sized" sausage making, up to 4 -5 kgThere are two cons:- It is not very easy to get the gasket ring off for cleaning- the stand could be alittle bit higher to put a tray under the tube. This would make the filling process easier. Currently I am using a small wood board to stand it on and then screw it to the tableI would defenetively purchase this producet again.
summary: Easy to use and most parts are very good to clean

reviewText: I purchased two of these a year ago to use in a ministry that serves people who are homeless.  The coffee pots are very well constructed and are sturdy enough to be lugged back and forth in their boxes in the back of a pickup hundreds of miles on rough roads and still look and work good!They are comfortingly noisy and I love that while I wait the hour for the coffee to brew it smells fabulous!  The coffee comes out a good strength (I use a pretty coarse grind of dark roast coffee) and nice and hot.  I've had no trouble with leakage at spout or lid.Bonus points for getting them for $89 each on a gold box deal.  If they put them on again, I'll be buying two more to use for hot water for hot chocolate and tea.Oh, and clean up is a breeze!
summary: Great classic coffee maker for a crowd

reviewText: I didn't actually buy these to blow air from downstairs up but then it said to try that in the manual so I did.Very strong, very directional.  Sends a huge amount of air from a big area behind into a small funnel up.  The only difficulty I had was that it didn't quite seem to get the air up the stairs, which seems like a problem given I don't have really high ceilings so the stairs aren't that long.  If the manual says it should work, it ought to work.
summary: Strong, directional, doesn't quite get up the stairs

reviewText: This items works great for what I am using it for.  Just the right size to get the job done.  There are not very think, but thats OK by me.
Works just the way it should with the coordinating crock.  Results are the best kraut ever!  If you're going to try your hand at fermenting, this is the way to go!
summary: Essential piece of equipment to go with the 5 liter crock

reviewText: I have never went wrong when purchasing anything made by Kuhn Rikon. GREAT products. This works perfect and is very pretty.I joined Amazon Prime last year and I have decided this is the BEST way to shop. I don't have to have a $25.00 minimum to order and the 3 day free shipping is terrific. What few times I have called Customer Service in regards to an issue....these reps are great to work with.

These serving bowls are sleek, sturdy and modern in appearance.  I love the color, but know that they are far more modern than anything else I have in my kitchen cabinets.  Most of my serving bowls belonged to my mother and grandmother, so you can imagine the style is quite different, however, these are durable and attractive and can highly recommend them nonetheless.This set also came well packaged and would make a great housewarming, engagement or wedding gift.
It arrived my place with a little bit scar on it. It is very cheaply made. Legs are very flimsy and every time I close/open the mirror, it is very squeaky.

My daughters, ages 13 & 10, love these!  They use them for all sorts of situations, and even asked to take them on a recent car trip.The shaggy fabric is so soft and comfy, much prettier than the plain fabric versions of this style of pillow.  The construction is also not as stiff as some plain versions of this that I'd found in the past, making it more comfortable to ease into.  The weight is great too, not so light that it scoots easily when leaning on it, but not too heavy to pick up easily.One girl has the pink, which has a bit of an orange tone on my screens that is not there in person.  The other has the lime, which is brighter in person.This pillow even helped recently when one of them had an awful head & chest cold.  Using this pillow, combined with a couple of bed pillows, we were able to prop her up to get a better night's sleep.  The shape of this pillow made this much easier than when we'd tried it in the past with just bed pillows.Overall a great buy, very pretty and useful - I definitely recommend them.

We have several cutting boards made of wood, and some of plastic, but honestly this is the nicest we own. The rubber end and the indents on both ends to help keep your counter clean really make this a stand out. I know it sounds funny, but really the rubber ends keep the cutting board from moving even when cutting a heavy roast, and the catches at each end keeps the juices from what ever your cutting from ending up on your counter top.A great buy we love ours.

This is a great knife set to consider as a gift for a new graduate or a couple who are getting married.  It's a very attractive and functional set that would fill the basic cutting and chopping needs of most non-professional cooks - especially beginners.  I enjoy the way the handles are balanced and shaped though I must admit that when I actually use the knives the ergonomics aren't quite right.  It's almost as if the shape of the handles were made to feel good when holding the knives rather for actually using them.  It's not that they are "wrong" so much as they aren't quite "right".I've been using Wustof knives for years.  As they are another German knife manufacturer I thought they'd be a great comparison to this set.  The first thing to note is that stamped on these knives are the elements that were used in forging the steel.  My Wustof set states:  X50 Cr MO 15 - the Chef's knives read:  X50 Cr MO V 15 - thus they are composed of the same basic elements.  The Chef's Toolbox set also has an element called Vanadium added to the steel which should lend corrosion resistance to the blades as that element is corrosion resistant to alkalis, sulphuric acid, hydrochloric acid, and salt water.Piece for piece, the Chef's Tool knives are much heavier than their Wustof equivalent.  For example, the Chef's Toolbox bread knife weighs 50% more (6 ounces) than the Wustof bread knife (4 ounces).  The blades are thicker and I find the edges to be a lot less sharp.  In other words, the cutting edges of these knives are thicker than what I'm used to using and are thus less sharp than the edge I can get on my Wustof knives.  Granted, comparing these knives to Wustof knives is a bit like comparing a Toyota to a BMW.  Both are great brands but one of them delivers a level of performance that is measurably superior to the other (and of course has a much higher cost).  My favorite knives in this set are the 2 fusion wave knives.  In fact, the smaller one in the set is likely going to become one of the most frequently used knives in my kitchen as it is wonderfully versatile.  I feel like I exert a bit more effort when using this knife as opposed to some of the others in my knife block.  Its size, shape and balance are such a delight to me that I'm considering taking it in to a professional grinder to have a new edge put on it to see what I can make it do if it were as sharp as the tools I'm accustomed to using.For the money, this set is a great option.  Serious cooks and chefs may want to look for an alternative, but the Chef's Toolbox set would more than meet the needs of the average modern American householder.  Considering the fact that most high-quality knives can easily cost upwards of $150 EACH, I feel that this set presents a very economical opportunity to purchase a good quality knife set that not only performs well but should last a lifetime and compliment most any kitchen decor in the process.  If purchasing this set, you may also want to consider purchasing a stand alone knife sharpening tool as this set does not include a sharpening steel nor does it provide space for one to be added to the block.
summary: These would make a great gift as they are an attractive and high-quality set.

reviewText: I've had problems with this rotisserie because it smokes from time to time. I have to leave my stove fan on and finally I just put it outside.  Then it started squeaking. I put vegie oil on the turning points but it didn't help much. Cleaning the unit and taking chicken out of the unit isn't easy. Why doesn't the inside have a non-stick surface is beyond me. This smokey dirty squeaky mess is now permanently outside. In fact, I think I will go outside right now and kick it.

I love poached eggs.  Used to make them all the time until my old pan's handle rusted and fell off!  After that I tried to make them in a pan with vinegar, used microwave poachers, etc.. and finally just gave up. I was shopping for something else on Amazon and just happened to run into this pan advertised.  It seemed like a lot of $$ to poach eggs.  I read the reviews and ordered it.Life is good!!  Haha. I now have my perfect 4 min. poached eggs again. Put a little water or butter in the cups and the eggs slide right out.  The pan is very useful for me.  I reheat food in it, make sauces, cook small quantities of anything.  Washes up easily! Cups wash right up.I would definitely buy this again and what a fool for waiting sooooooo long to enjoy eggs the way I want them again!
summary: Why did I wait so long....

reviewText: I had just bought two ice cube trays about a couple of weeks ago. Sadly, they no longer stack on top of each other for making ice cubes like they did years ago, but they rather nest inside each other, posing a serious problem when making ice!!They have to be placed & used side by side in order to make ice cubes.Luckily, I found the Better Houseware 1495 Ice Tray Holder here!!! This unique and handy accessory works to help keep the ice cube trays separate from each other and helps prevent messy ice making!!!And it helps make a smart little shelf on top for small items stored in the freezer!!! It fits right on top of the fridge freezer's own wire shelf, and works perfectly!!About the others who wrote to complain about it, I see no problems with this unit. It truly works for me!!! So glad that I bought it!!!!
summary: Great accessory for your Ice Cube Trays!!! Keeps them Neatly Separated!!!!

reviewText: We were in the path of the smoke from the Rim fire for several weeks, although today is clear (wind shifted). But this helped keep our whole house clean, along with a couple humidifiers and running the HVAC fan on continuous. Could sure tell the difference when walking in from outside, having clean air inside. Wore an N95 respirator outside, but that doesn't cover the eyes.

I bought it here about 6 months ago. I dont even own metal spatulas etc so I do use the proper utensils inside the pan. I used it everyday. my pan does not keep things from sticking any longer. It worked perfectly the first two months or so and then everything began to stick. I rarely use butter and usually use olive oil or coconut oil to cook with. It makes me sick as I researced for weeks on the right pan that wouldnt be toxic to my family and that would be used to cook eggs without sticking. I am VERY disappointed in this pan.
summary: 6 months out and everything sticks, so disappointed

reviewText: First of all, I'd never even heard of this...it's not something I think I'd normally invest money in...unless we were using other people's mattresses a lot. Otherwise, as far as I care---my germs are my germs. We use a mattress cover and wash our sheets [and ourselves!] regularly. But then again if you or your children suffer from chronic viruses, allergies or asthma this would probably be a lifesaver, literally.Having said that, here is my pro/con list:Pros:1. it comes with a handheld vacuum for everyday pickups [strong suction]2. i thought it moved easily & my light stayed on 95% of the time3. it cleans bacteria i could not normally just scrubbing [like who does that?] my mattress4. hooks together easily & separates easily5. you can clean the light & filter yourself without replacementsCons:1. the handheld vacuum isn't cordless2. if you don't apply a small amount of downward pressure the UV light will go off3. it is extremely loud [like squeals like a little girl] much louder than just vacuum normally would be4. makes me nervous being pregnant [in the future] and having kids in the house that the UV light will hurt someone5. costs a lot for a luxury of deep cleaning most of us could solve with an inexpensive mattress cover
These work very well on the top of my oil bottles. They do the job they were intended to do.
And this was a huge help.  Really unobtrusive, really functional and comes with a nifty remote.  I can move it easily (there's a handle). It's a little loud, but it's never bothered me.

I went through about 4 or 5 coffee presses over 2 or 3 years, always breaking the glass carafe, before I gave up on them.  This carafe claims to be unbreakable plastic which will fix my problem if the claim is good.  I have had it for two weeks.It has a plastic plunger which works fine, but I replaced it with a stainless steel mesh plunger from one of the broken others.I am very satisfied with the press, but will downgrade later if required.Looks good.  Materials are a little thin, but I could not care less if it holds up.  The carafe removes from the red base, but I usually do not bother when washing it.  I fill it about 3 quarters full of water which makes enough coffee to fill two 16oz mugs about an inch from the top.Those having problems with the plunger should note that it is purposely blocked by coffee grounds as you push downward.  That forces the water, under pressure, through the grounds. Do it slowly.  If it becomes too hard to push, pull up on it a little which will clear the grounds due to reverse water flow, and push down again.  When plunger reaches the bottom, pull up an inch or so to clear the plunger filter so that you can pour all the coffee out of the bottom and to make it easier to clean the plunger.---Sept 7 ---I have gone back to the original plunger.  I had forgotten than the stainless steel mesh plunger had to be taken apart to clean coffee grounds that found their way under the plates holding the screen. The plunger on this press cannot be taken apart, and it does not look as if grounds can get between the plates.----Nov. 8----CRACKED!!!---It cracked from top to bottom and now leaks. Changed score from 5 to 1. Every single glass press I have owned lasted longer than this piece of ___.

I purchased two of these to use with the Moen SR2201CH Shower Rings that I already had.  To my amazement, the grommets on these curtains are too small to fit around the ball of the rings!  It's too bad since I really liked the feel of these curtains - a nice rubbery feel (I'm not sure how else to describe it) that felt nicer than normal liners.  I ended up having to get liners locally (Amazon is constantly messing up my returns, so I'm avoiding ordering things I'm not 100% sure about from Amazon) and lo and behold, normal shower curtain grommets fit fine on the Moen Shower Rings.  So beware if you have rings that are on the bigger side, as these won't fit!
summary: Material is nice, but the holes are too small!

reviewText: It is good looking and easy to handle.  I wish the whistle was a bit louder.  But everything else is perfect.

I was so excited to get this pan to make uniform size whoopie pies.  Unfortunately I found it more difficult to use and not worth the added steps or time!!First of all, the whoopie pies were very difficult to remove from the pan unless I sprayed the pan with Pam with EVERY batch!!  Secondly, even with the Pam, they still left a "film" of crumbs that needed to be wiped out with a paper towel after each batch!!I had to "experiment" to find the correct amount of batter to put into each cavity.  If it isn't precise the cakes were too thin or puffed up way too high.I think it is MUCH EASIER and QUICKER to just use an ice cream scoop (to form uniform size cakes) and a cookie sheet. When I made them this way, I lined the cookie sheet with parchment paper and the cakes lifted off easily and left no residue.In all fairness,I gave this pan 2 stars because I DID NOT use the recipe that came with the pan.  I used a "family" recipe that I've made for years.  But, it still is a disappointment to purchase a pan and only be successful using it with the accompanying recipe.  A good quality pan (non-stick or otherwise)  should be able to perform with any recipe(whoopie pies, muffin tops, etc).I should also mention that I am a very experienced baker/cook and I am usually very happy with the performance of Wilton pans, but this one was an exception!

Wow!  I was really impressed with these peelers.  I thought all peelers were all made the same, but, after using this set, there is quite a bit of difference.They are easy to use, almost difficult to cut yourself, can be used by either a left or right handed person and the price is great.  I espcially like the serrated edge peeler for peeling peaches and tomatoes without tearing the skin.  Very nice!For potatotes, cucumbers and carrots the straight edge peeler is quick and efficient.  Very smooth peeling without wasting the veggies.The julienne strip peeler is great for cheeses as well as for julienne strips of ham, carrots, etc.I also like that the peelers come with a plastic snap on cover for the blades to protect them.  These peelers have become a "must have" for my kitchen and I have put them to good use!
summary: A handy gadget for the kitchen . . .

reviewText: This thing heats up water in like one minute! the color is very nice, but i wish the cord from the base was longer. you can have this further than a foot from the outlet. other than that i am very happy.
It melts and you have to wait too long in between to make another batch for it to cool downI just put my corn chips watch them careful, it does the job and with more at a time.

This is the second touchless trash can that I have owned.PRO:The manufacturer listened to clients and made changes from the first one.  The ledge inside that holds the bag is more pronounced, and the infrared sensor is better.CON:I would desire that the trash can were a little larger (13 gallons (regular size of kitchen bags) rather than 11.1).However, I am totally happy with the way this unit operates.

This little chopper chops more than just onions.  I used it to make cabbage soup and chopped carrots, onions, and cabbage with ease.  Best purchase I have made in a long time.  It is very easy to clean.

Since it resides unseen within my coffee maker it is difficult to really review except to say that it does its job. Great tasting and consistent coffee and the costs are very reasonable. Costs for replacement filters for my old Braun had cost me up to $12 a piece! These last just as long and it is by far a better deal.

I've made hundreds of Amazon purchases over the years and have relied heavily on customer reviews. I cannot remember ever writing a truly negative review on anything I've purchased.This time I ignored my own rule - let the customer reviews make your decision for you. Instead I ignored all the warnings and bought it anyway.I have reviewed and tried most of the tips provided by purchasers and have had nothing but problems. This thing simply will NOT grind meat, whether it's pork, beef, lean or fat. I've tried almost freezing the meat. I've tried cutting meat smaller and smaller. Yes, the blade was inserted exactly as shown in the instructions.Any fat or sinew in the meat will hang it up instantly. That makes pork almost impossible to grind.Once it is hung up, you must take the whole thing apart and untangle/remove the meat from the grinder. Then put it back together again. That is not exactly a fast process when you must repeat it over and over again.After my third attempt and third failure and having over a pound of beef slices that should have been hamburger, the only appliance I felt might chop it up to some degree or other was my wonderful little appliance, the Black & Decker EHC650 2-Speed Food Chopper with 3-Cup Bowl.I was afraid it might turn my meat into a near liquid state if I wasn't careful so I worked it on slow speed and kept a close eye on the consistency.I was super surprised at the results. PERFECTLY GROUND HAMBURGER! I will be trying pork next.So for those who were as disappointed as I was, try your B & D chopper or BUY ONE! [No, I don't work for B & D] This wonderful little appliance has many more uses than my newly found meat grinding.
summary: Worst product of all my Amazon purchases

reviewText: WARNING:  This container holds 6.5 cups, not "8.0".  When I contacted the seller about the issue, I received an email stating the the problem was mine, as I'd done the conversion from milliliters improperly.  Which is odd, as milliliters had never entered into it: it's advertised as a 8-cup container.  Period.  So I called, thinking I could clear up the issue in realtime.  Wrong!  I got a barely-literate and quite obnoxious woman who insisted that milliliters somehow entered into it, and was impervious to all forms of logic.  I hung up on her, called Amazon, and asked them to list this container accurately, which so far has not happened.The container itself is not bad, if you want a SIX AND A HALF CUP container, not an 8-cup.  But after my experience, I would never deal with this seller again.
Mr and Mrs Chili peppers are super cuties.  My girlfriend loves them so much.  Item as described.  Salt and peppers here!

This is a sturdy and price worthy item. You can use it at home or take it along with you on your camping trips. I have used it in my oven at home and I have used it with charcoal outside. Get this product.
These sheets are better than expected!  They are super soft and very light.  I have a 12 inch memory foam mattress and they fit perfectly over it with a little room to spare.  Perfect for summer.
summary: Very soft and perfect for summer.

reviewText: We like the Anolon Advanced cookware quite a bit. The pieces are substantial, well constructed with quality materials, and are non stick.  With this set come the usual pieces as described on the listing page.  In addition to the nine pieces, however, there is a two piece bakeware bonus with this set. These baking "sheets" are terrific, with raised sides to keep items from slipping off and built on silicone handles for easier handling and lifting.Having an older Circulon set of bakeware ( made by the same company) I can see that the pieces are similar though these seem a little heavier. The three quart sauce pan and the 10 inch skillet weigh over two pounds. Fill them with food and the weight can be daunting. Mrs. Spudman recently had shoulder surgery, so I've been doing all the lifting from stovetop to countertop, resting the hot pans on wooden cutting boards.You can use metal with these pieces, but we prefer to use wood or plastic utensils.  We also try to be careful when storing the pieces in a cabinet, using kitchen towels to separate each piece. Even with the care we take, eventually the pieces suffer scratches on the outside.This is our second experience with the Autograph 2 coating, and it holds up very well. On the Anolon site which has lots of good advice and recipes, the user is advised not to use cooking spray on the nonstick surface and not to cook at high heat. (500 degrees plus) We also never put any of the cookware in our dishwasher, but wash with warm soapy water and a kitchen sponge. Never steel wool!Other thoughts:We like the comfortable handles on this cookware, the feel, sturdiness and the shape of them. They are also made so that you can hang the pieces if you would like.The lids are also thoughtfully designed. Handles are firmly attached to the lids that fit securely with metal rims that preclude leaking or overflow from the edges.One piece we would like to have is a four quart two handled pan that is on our wish list and most likely will be a future purchase.Bottom line - This is an attractive, good functioning set of cookware that should please most buyers.

These are exactly as shown in the picture. The color is definitely pink, but to be exact for anyone trying to match other stuff, it's on the blue side of pink with a faintest hint of violet. They are very pretty pillow covers.

This bakes your food just the way the metal pans would and saves the life of your pan.  My only complaint is cleaning the Mat, it just feels greasy regardless of how much I wash it and maybe that is just the feel of the silicone also the size does not fit any of my pans perfectly.

Haven't had it for a long time so can't say anything about it's longevity.Works well.Is easy clean up, though I wash by hand.I make sausage and grind my own ground beef all the time.It is a good grinder and I would buy again.Will review again if it lasts a long time or has a problem.Great so far.

This product is well made and the teeth are very sharp. The package arrived quickly and in great condition.  My garden vegies just did not cut well with it. I really wanted it to work. My carrots are very short, and my zucchini didn't cut either. I will keep trying and post an update if I change my mind about the spiralizer.

I researched many slow cookers, reading reviews, asking other owners about what they like about theirs. Price was not a major concern in my case, so I looked at far more expensive ones than this one.I considered the one which you could use right on the cooktop for searing meat. However, was not pleased with the idea of a non stick layer, which apparently had peeling issues as well.I checked out many of them in stores. Another concern I had was the glass lid, and the screw to hold the handle in place. I read many reviews where the screw started rusting and dripping rust into the meal.When I purchased this one, now 2 years ago, I wasn't sure what to expect as there weren't many reviews at the time.I was extremely pleased when it arrived, the lid fit well on the insert, the insert looked beautiful, ceramic and the options for settings were more than sufficient for my needs.I have used this one off and on for the past 2 years. I love the large capacity, but have also cooked smaller meals in it without a problem (as long as you have enough liquid). I use it mainly for beef stew and beans.Having said that, I do get the same results with my old cast iron pot and low temperature oven, but I still like my slow cooker as well.I would buy this one again. After 2 years, it still looks very good although I do not wash it in the dishwasher. I hand wash and dry both lid and insert (and it only takes a minute or less)Highly recommended!

Ok, i'm a GROWN MAN and i bought this first for me and then another for my son.  I pack my lunch so i needed this as my old one broke.What i like most is that unlike 99% of all others... just inside the TOP portion of this, there is some netting where i can inserte a 4 x 8 or 3 x 6 (not sure exactly) but a larger blue gel ice pack.  I then put a 2nd on the bottom.  SO... gel pack on bottom, a frozen 1 litre of water or whatever the flavor of hte day is, sandwich, a snack, and then a gel pack on the top.I wish this were about 1 inch deeper, but what can you do?What i find fascinating is that many of my co-workers come up and compliment me on my lunch box.I've had this for 6 months now?  Maybe 9?  Not sure.  The only thing going on it so far, is there is a small tear in the web netting inside.  I think it's a quality issue myself, but... it's small and it does not affect the holding of the gel pack.I will likely buy another someday or get one as a spare for when these are no longer available.The largest attration for me was the netting inside the top, which again holds a gel pack so that i have cold coming at my sandwich from top and bottom, not just the bottom.Very pleased.

My daughter is the cook in the family and she recommended these knives. Super sharp, and the storage keeps them available without using up much space. These are our first really "good" knives and we are really happy with the purchase. good weight, good selection of sizes, easy to use. Do NOT put in dishwasher though.Husband did accidentally and it created a little rust near handle.
summary: Excellent knives for an excellent price

reviewText: Keep your microwave clean with these products well made easy to hold when you have hot items easy to clean will buy more of these items

This utensil holder easily doubled my capacity, without taking up much more of the counter. I like to put bulky utensils in it, like wisks, pasta servers, and ladles that just get mangled or take up too much space in my drawers. This can rest flat against the backsplash and it never tips over, even if I am not careful loading it from the dishwasher.

I bought this at a local store for $129 about 3 weeks ago. I used it two times on the auto setting. It worked fine, did what I wanted it to do and I liked that you could walk away and let it clean. On the third try, I decided I needed to use the manuel hose. I followed the instructions about pressing the button for manuel within thirty seconds after releasing the hose grip, but the light just blinked and the manuel hose never worked. I unplugged the machine and tried again and still nothing. I called the company, explained the problem and was told to take it to a repair shop. They gave me the number for the repair shop nearest my house (25min away). I called and the repair man told me to return it to the store since it still fell within that particular store's return time frame. He said that the spotbot is a good idea, but they have many, many issues that result in costly repairs that are worth more than the machine itself. He said if I brought it to him, all he would do is return it to the company and they'd give me a different one and it would take a long time. I have no intentions of buying another bissell floor cleaner again.I also noticed a tiny amount of water leaking from the hose where it attaches to the machine. I assume this is not normal and eventually would have been an issue also.
summary: Great idea, bad mechanics and broken upon purchase

reviewText: and that's why the rating is only four stars; it is too soon to know how it will hold up, if it will continue to be as great as it appears at first glance.  This is not my first Malouf pillow; I've had another model for a couple of years now.  It has held up well and been most comfortable.  It is not worn out or ready to be tossed, but I needed a pillow for another bed, and decided to try another model of Malouf to see which I prefer.  Reading descriptions can help you to make an educated guess, but there's nothing like experience.I like the fact that this is a long pillow, truly king-sized.  It is firm enough.  It had no unpleasant odor, coming out of the package, although I do have it airing on the deck.  I'm a "side sleeper" and find adequate support with this one, just like my other one (same price, no gusseted sides, slightly different internal composition).The pillow came in a very nice zippered carry-case, plastic with handle.  That I found completely unnecessary -- being a senior citizen, the "have pillow, will travel" image made me giggle.  But hey, I do have friends who bring their own pillows if they visit me.  Pillows are important, and I had a good-night's sleep last evening from my new one.  Pricey but worth it.  The two single-sized pillows it replaced ended being stuffed into a single pillow case for one really firm pillow.  That might well end up under my 65 pound dog in her crate as bedding.

This set not only looks nice but is great to work with. It's got just the right sizes for our needs and we have loved using it. They are easy to clean and maintain, even when something accidentally gets burned. I would highly recommend this set
I love space saver bags and when I downsized to a smaller place I thought I better stock up.  Sadly these are thin and cheaply made and punctured before they could even be reused.
summary: Easy to puncture and cheaply made

reviewText: I had bought the plunger type frother and it just did not froth well, even after buying whipping cream. So I bought this one and it does a great job. I need to not froth too long or I end up with whipping cream with 1% milk. My husband discovered it on the counter and uses it to mix his milk chocolate drinks.

This Kettle appealed to me because of the clean lines. I thought it would be bigger and made from a stronger glass. I am afraid it will not last long in use. We shall see and I will update this review if it still around in a year. Other than that the price is good, and it does have a nice strong whistle to remind me I have water boiling for tea!
I wanted a thin bladed knife to use when cutting large pieces of meat. This knife does the job for me and was inexpensive.

Based upon all the other outstanding and helpful reviews, I chose this grinder for fine coffee grind and for grinding flax seeds into meal.  Speedy and thorough - it does the job.  I did learn though, not to over-fill with seeds/beans because then it's tricky to remove the lid without dumping the "grind".  Not the Krup-grinder's fault...just an overly ambitious human.  If you prefer a fine grind - here's your grinder!

First of all, I am an apron lover, and I wear them every day, both for art making as well as cooking.I love the color of this apron! It could not be more perfect for me. The neck adjustment is is generous and the clasp does not slip. The ties themselves are also generous and I wrapped them around my waist, and no I am no longer as petite as I once was!!The apron is made from  100% cotton and is made in India (a refreshing change that!). It is constructed from a twill weave cloth. The fabric is slightly thin, but I think that once it is washed the fabric will thicken up a bit. Based on my experience using similar fabrics I think that this apron could possibly shrink 10-20 percent in the washing machine (SEE UPDATE POST WASHING BELOW) unless you use a cold water wash and rinse which would minimize shrinkage. The apron is generously sized and should fit most humans!The ties and neck strap are a bit thinner than most aprons, but I don't find it to be a detraction.I find many aprons to be too high priced, and so I generally choose to make my own, but with an excellent price point for this apron I think it is an excellent buy that will appeal to many people in the arts, and, of course, cooks!UPDATE: 7/12/2014I washed the apron today and found that shrinkage is minimal. Washing tightened the fabric a bit and made the apron softer. More pleased with value.
summary: Excellent Value in a Favored Color !

reviewText: Seems accurate but the scale I received measured only in grams,not ounces as described.  Also, it doesn't run on AA batteriesbut a single CR 2430 3-volt "coin" type cell which is harder to find.I returned the unit!

Perfect like coffee maker. Attractively designed and just right for a single "cup plus". After seeing how nice this was, we purchased the next size up as well. Glass seems sturdy. Screen may be a bit coarser than the old BonJour pot, I clicked the setting on my grinder one-half notch coarser as well; maybe I'm just imagining it, though. Haven't held them up side by side.Before getting this, I had tried coffee from a friend's one-cup press with a plastic pot - this makes WAY better coffee with no off-flavors.Two very minor quibbles - wish the base had feet that stick out, this feels just a bit unstable. Also, with the amount of coffee I prefer - LOTS - the piston doesn't go all the way down when I press the coffee. My old pot had a bit more room under the screen, but I don't see the smaller space as a problem, just to be aware of.Ken - Author ofThe Pellet Stove Almanack: Home Heating Joins the 21st Century

I made a kids play area and needed some type of cushion. This came in a crazy small package but expanded nicely. I cut them up and my wife sewed some cushion covers for a kids play area thing. They work really well for this and are very comfortable. Even one layer can suffice for young people who want to sleep in the kids fort for a night or two.

Bought is for a counter oven of the same brand. Son loves pizza so I'm saving a mint on delivered pizza. He tosses one in the oven all the time and no one in the family has any problem with frozen pizza compared to expensive Dominos. You will find the major portion of my reviews rate the product high. We don't have much money, so I spend a lot of time researching a reviewing articles before purchasing, so far this has worked and we have been very happy with 99% of our purchases.

Purchased my slow cooker in July of 2011 and early this month it did not want to turn on one day. I had it plugged into a surge protector and it had not been put under heavy use at all. I would use it to heat up sauce while I cooked other ingredients so it would only be on for 2 hours max an average of 5 times a month. I really enjoyed using the unit and it worked well otherwise. Called Cuisinart hassle free customer service and it was so easy to arrange an exchange under their 3 year warranty. I do have to pay for shipping to get the new item back to me and I wil report if anything goes wrong with the new unit...*knocks on wood*. Overall its a good unti but perhaps I just got a lemon, we will see.

We had just bought a Panasonic iron, model NI-W810CS, 8 months before getting this TFAL in the Vine program. I'll compare the two in this review, and also comment on the TFAL in regards to its standalone merits.Short Review: Pointy front edge and large reservoir are pros. The light weight and long cord can be pros or cons depending on your needs, as can the complex and comprehensive de-calcing system. Cons include the need to clean and decalc the iron once per month (at least if you take the instructions seriously) and the idiotic "pictorial only" manual, which will leave you confused and squinty-eyed. Biggest liability is the entirely too vigorous steam system, which often sprays water out, drips from the front plate holes, and often makes the iron sound like Thomas the Tank Engine. The Panasonic competitor is generally more successful across the board and though it costs more, the difference in price is not enough to favor the TFAL in my opinion.Full Details:Iron Shape -- TFAL has point front, Pana is more or less symmetrical in shape, so the front is about as pointy as the rear of the face plate. This makes it easier to use TFAL to iron nooks and crannies in clothing, but makes it easier to reverse directions quickly with the Pana. All in all, I found the more traditional TFAL shape to be more useful.Water Capacity -- TFAL is larger in capacity (9 oz vs 6.75 oz) and is much easier to fill, as the port is larger and can even be put directly under a tap faucet. The Pana is more old school, with a tiny port, complete with a flimsy cover that is just waiting to break off at the first mishap. Clear win for TFAL here.Weight -- To get wrinkles out, pressure has to come from somwhere. Pana is heavier, TFAL lighter. Hence, TFAL is less fatiguing in theory, but you will have to press down more to get the fabric smooth. Choose your poison. I liked the weight of the Pana more myself, but there is no clear answer as to which is best.Cords -- TFAL has 12 ft, Pana about 9 feet. Both cords manuever freely around 360 degrees, neither retracts. A long cord can be good or bad, depending on your specific ironing needs. My ironing board is really close to the outlet, so I like the Pana.DeCalcinating -- Panasonic mysteriously just claims they have one on the 810. They don't go into detail, and you the user don't have to do anything. It just works. Or does it? No idea, only had the iron for 10 months, and NYC has soft water, so it is not much of a workout for decalcing methods. TFAL in comparison has some wand gadget in the middle of the reservoir that needs to be cleaned separately once per month, and then cleaned again in the separate once per month iron cleaning. This seems like a bit of work for the user, and frankly, I don't think I am going to do it very often or at all. Will my TFAL iron calc up in no time? No idea. If I had hard water, I think I would go with the TFAL and follow the regimen, but for soft water and / or lazy ironers, the possible ineffectual though low effort Pana approach may have more merit. I personally think two different cleaning protocols once per month is rather excessive for a low cost appliance, but you may disagree. If the instructions were clearer, this would have been a neutral point for me, but see below for why this protocol and the lame instructions interacted to give a victory to Pana.Manual -- Pana has a two page or so written manual with small print, and a few diagrams that is really nothing exceptional. Yet everything is clear enough. TFAL, either fearing an uptick in illiteracy and / or wanting to save money on localization costs of the manual around the world, has all features and instructions in minuscule pictograms that had me straining my eyes to see them. Even worse, TFAL had numerous instances of two pictures that look very much alike next to each other, one of which has an X through it (meaning "don't do this!!") and another with a smiley face ("yes, do this!") Good luck figuring out what you're supposed to do unless you're a professional sniper! Plus the pictograms are bundled into lengthy sequences - the monthly cleaning has roughly 17 steps! It's like the Common Core Curriculum approach to iron use and maintenance... This whole concept struck me as annoying and misguided, but showed how even a mediocre manual using old fashioned words can still be a better solution than hieroglyphic innovations for consumer products.Steam -- Pana is 1500 watts, TFAL more than 1700. All my ironing was on the "cotton" setting for both units, i.e. near the max. The two irons are fairly evenly matched in quality of results produced despite the wattage difference. However, the real issue is the TFAL's "Raging Bull" steam system. The auto steam system has 4 settings plus off, and only on setting 2 is adequate steam produced with only occasional water emission. Setting 1 is virtually no leaks, but not much usable steam, and settings 3 & 4 produce a lot of leaks, plus water bubbling out through the faceplate. If you turn autosteam off and try to control the steam using manual bursts, you almost always get water coming out. Pana in comparison almost never has water leaks, even on highest autosteam and plenty of manual bursts. Maybe the lower wattage works in Pana's favor? Not sure, but in any case any possible benefit from more powerful TFAL steam is offset by the frequent leaks and lack of control in TFAL. Big win for the Pana.Common Features: Both units had useful auto off systems that vary shut off time based on position of iron. Nice idea, well implemented in both. Both irons took the same time to heat up, and as mentioned earlier, produced usable ironing results that were comparable. No flaws or breakages, build quality appears similar for both. Both have a one year warranty. The main points of distinction between the two models are summarized above.Bottom Line: The more precise steam control of the Pana makes it more useful for me. The TFAL has a few comparative strengths, but the undisciplined steam is a big issue for me. If the TFAL was a lot cheaper, I might forgive this, but as of this writing, the TFAL costs 20% less on Amazon, which to me is not enough of a differential to offset an annoying flaw.
