Panasonic for the win for me, and unless you are confident that my particular over-steaming TFAL was a lemon, you will probably be better advised to go for the Panasonic as well. (Unless the price for TFAL falls a lot, and / or you worry about calcination and think the TFAL overkill approach sounds like something you need.)
These spoons are very good and are useful in tall glasses of tea, milkshakes, etc.  Wished that we had purchased these long ago.

I admit, I used it for regular out of the envelope hot chocolate.  I just haven't gotten around to trying real chocolate.  It did do a great job of mixing it well, with no residual chunks of powder normally encountered when simply using a spoon.  I feel that if I wanted frothy hot chocolate, I could use my Magic Bullet for the same results, or even a blender.  I personally wouldn't waste my money with this item; the glass appears delicate and the plastic seems cheap.  I wouldn't imagine it lasting very long, especially if it weren't stored properly, in a safe place.  Definitely not for leaving it out on the kitchen counter.EDIT:  Mine broke as well, on the 4th use; the "propeller" piece.  It just simply split in half and fell off the rod.  Not wasting my time with customer service.  I'll try to find something at the hardware store, otherwise it's off to the landfill...would change rating to 1 star.
Very nice quality!!! Good Price too! I love them!!! Keeps me cool in the summer! Will definitely recommend it! Thanks!

I had kept this shower organizer tower on my Amazon Wish List for a long time before I finally decided to "bite the bullet" and get it. I hesitated for a long time because of the price. However, this thing is worth every penny. We've had it in our shower for months now and it looks great. It is really heavy duty so it easily holds all of the bath products we loaded it up with (seriously, every shelf is packed).I love that the sides of our tub are no longer cluttered with stuff! Plus all the shelves, hooks and handles on the tower really ensure there is a place for everything.Installation was a breeze too (although my husband did it so I can't really even comment on that portion!).The short review for this is - if you're on the fence because of the price, just know it's totally worth it. simplehuman makes really great products and I am go glad I spent the money once instead of continually buying (and tossing) cheap tub organizers.

It's amazing that a machine with such a small footprint can produce such a great variety of coffee beverages.  When you take into consideration the 16 coffee bean blends, plus several special release blends; add an infinite variety of water-to-bean ratios; an infinite variety of milk proportions and foam thicknesses--well, it provokes excitement each time you turn it on.It is so easy to use and so easy to clean!  But, I have to say, that if the choice of coffee was poor or the quality of the coffee was less than superb, "easy" would have no bearing on how well we liked this machine.You can use the machine with or without adding milk.  And the milk container can detach and be stored in the frig.  The machine is programmed to create espresso and lungo portions, plus you can re-program it easily to create anything in between.  When not using the milk frother, you will be extremely happy with the crema:  It is thick, rich and luxurious.This is our second Nespresso machine:  We also have a CitiZ in a "60's" (kind of old-fashioned) white color to match the style of our kitchen,Citiz in Creamy White.  We still use it, because very often we don't feel the need to add milk and just crave an espresso shot.  We keep both machines on the kitchen counters.  They do not look well together.  We've left the CitiZ in its long-time, more prominent position because its older look lends charm to the kitchen.  The Lattissima is tucked in a corner and while it is "stylish" it is also not conspicuous.  Our Lattissima machine is white (and black); the white matches KitchenAide and Cuisinart white.I also have aGaggia for Illy Espresso Machine, and compared to this Lattissima machine, it is clumsy looking, clumsy in the way it froths milk and difficult and time-consuming to clean the frothing wand.The Lattissima is easy to learn how to use.  We've never had any issues with either of the Nespresso machines.  Customer Service is always helpful and cheerful.  Periodically someone will call and ask if all is well with our machines and do we have any questions.  There is a great, interesting, full-color magazine produced by Nespresso also. It is available online or hard copy through the mail.We buy our capsules from Nespresso online.  We order a four-five month supply at a time to maximize the value of their flat-rate shipping charge.  They have never messed up an order.  Shipping is very quick.  Of course, we have our favorite blends, but we are fond of all the blends and always try to keep all 16+ blends on hand.The only fault I can think of--and it's so minor, I feel that I'm clutching at straws in mentioning it:  There are always a few straggling drips of coffee after the brewing ends.  But because you need to have some kind of cup available to catch the water residue involved in the cleaning process, it's no big deal to switch out your coffee cup for your cleaning cup.  We didn't have to search too hard to find a little cup that (kind of) matched the machine, and that's what we routinely keep positioned under the brewer spout when not actually brewing.
summary: Terrific coffee flavor; endless possibilities; small and easy!

reviewText: I haven't used that much yet. They do look great sitting in the crock next to the stove. Price is right!

I own two of these, one in silver & now in black.  I love how sturdy they are, how much weight they can hold, and that they are compact enough to fit it tight spaces.  A definite must-have for anyone who needs extra shelf space.

I purchased 2 of these bed frames. They arrived on time and in good condition. No problem setting them up. Using them both for Queen size mattress and box springs. Had them for about 2 months. One is in fine working condition. The other is not.The center metal support bar has a thin metal leg that comes to a point and sits on a plastic cone shaped foot.  The plastic foot collasped and made the frame unusable as it now has no center support and I cant find anything that the metal foot will rest on because it is tapered. Will not securly rest on a block of wood. The rest of the frame seems to be strudy.The price was low and I thought at firstI got a good deal.  :(
summary: I got what I paid for : (

reviewText: Adorable and effective. I don't get much use from it because I have a granite sink and it doesn't stick well. Sometimes I use vaseline or something similar to stick it to the side of the sink. It works for a while.

This works just fine to hold the cord for my iron.  I notice that the stem tends to lean over a bit (and my cord is not particularly heavy) but it doesn't stop it from working.  A stronger stem would be better but perhaps by tightening it more it might help.  I like using it.
summary: Good but the stem is a little weak

reviewText: I looked for these economical soap dishes for years and finally found them on Amazon.  These were popular in the 70s and 80s, and with good reason.  Your bar of soap doesn't sit in water anymore, so your soap lasts much longer, and it keeps the shelf in your shower, or the rim of your tub or sink clean and dry, depending on where you use this soap dish.  We even put one in my husband's workshop!  Love, love, love it!

this scoop is excellent.  It has the liquid antifreeze which makes it easy to get the ice cream off the scoop and into the bowl.  CAVEAT; You must hand wash (no dishwasher) or you will quickly lose that benefit and turn it into just another spade.
This is a great tool for folding T shirts and women's blouses to keep drawers neat and clothes folded. I find it makes folding large T shirts easily. I use it everything I launder now!

Thank you amazon!!  This is exactly what I was looking for to hang hand towels.  I also use it as a holder for the box of kleenex hand towels.  I put it in upside down and it acts like a dispenser.  It works for me and it stays put on the wall.  Previous ones I have purchased have fallen off the wall after a couple of days.  This one stays put.  Follow the instructions provided to the letter.
summary: just what I was looking for

reviewText: Too small for my Rowenta iron.  I didn't even think to check the width. Nicely made and seems very tough. Too bad it didn't work out.

I love this, it makes things so much easier when rolling out pie crusts.  The mat doesn't slide around my counter top, and the crust doesn't stick to the mat after rolling.  I'm glad I spent a little more to purchase this item - it's well worth it.

This is my second kitchenaid  chopper. I gave the first to my daughter thinking it would be easy to replace.  Not so.  I finally found this one which was the same as the first, except this new one is red. I love it.

These are just adorable. The 'concept' is great for boats (us) picnics, etc. BUT the construction quality leaves much to be desired.... the concept was very cheaply implemented, e.g., they are poorly made.  Where the wine glass insert {rim} is fused to the outer insulated cup, there seems to be disruptions in the construction (and rough edges). It is relatively poorly constructed and will surely fail in the near future. Since I bought them during the winter and didn't open them until recently it was well beyond the return point.  So, I'll just used them until water gets in between the wine glass portion and outer insulated cup.
summary: High 'cute factor', construction quality very subpar

reviewText: This blender was large, loud yet basic in it's operation - I really felt like for the money I spent, I should have gotten a higher quality blender.  I tried all of the functions out and they worked, but the blender was very loud and shakey.  It's made entirely out of plastic and that could be why.

I received this stone today. I began to use it immediatly, this stone is exectly what it is advertised to be.  Yes it is a very soft stone, I wouldn'tcall it a sponge.  I used this stone to fine tune an already sharp knife.  This stone is made to put the final touch on a knife, that already has a very sharp edge.  I am satified with this product.  I would NOT reccomend this stone, for someone just starting to learn how to sharpen knives.  However,I would highly reccomend it for the experienced on sharpening knives to a razor sharp edge...............I purchased this stone mostly because of allthe real good reviews......................

I really like the pattern, it's cheerful. The curtain dries fast, and the metal grommets are good quality, I don't expect them to come out. I like the fact that it's not stiff like the plastic curtains, much more elegant.
summary: nice really long shower curtain dries fast

reviewText: This is a minus 5.  It spews all over the counter and scorches the rice.  I followed the directions exactly and tried different brands of rice.  It boils over even with the smallest amount, and scorches before the end of the cycle no matter how much or how little rice is cooked.  I would return it but got busy and missed the deadline, and at that point the cost of shipping and the partial refund make it not worth the bother. This product should be taken off the market until they get it right. Judging from other reviews, not all of them are defective, but enough are that something really needs to be done.

I really do love these. I have used many different shapes of the embossed cutters for fondant, cookies, and pie dough. What I can't believe is the price that these are going for. Just because Paula Deen has her name attached to them? I do like Paula, but I don't like the price gouging. Before you JUST HAVE TO GET THESE do your homework. I found most, if not all, are made in China, and I have found them in varying shape combinations. They sell a lot of these on eBay, and you can even get lucky and find the ones you want with free shipping. But to pay $ 11.99 and then shipping on top of that is just ridiculous.
I love this mat!  It adheres to my counter tops easily.  Super easy to clean.  I put it in soapy water, rinse and pat or hang to dry.
Great to have, keeps wine cold, cools down bottles in no time.Great fun product!Allwas very helpful to have something like this in the freezer.

I have been using this vacuum over a week now and it works like a charm. I have to vacuum every day because of all the cat hair and tracked litter from my cat, and this vacuum gets rid of all the hair and litter from my carpets. The litter was never an issue for my old cordless stick vacuum, whose battery ran out, but it was never able to pick up the hair. I have one rather heavy area rug which hair sticks to, but this vacuum sucks it all up. In fact, it makes my carpets look like new because the colors look brighter after all the dirt has been removed. I especially love the "vacuum lines!"To add to the amazing suction power, the clean up is probably just as amazing. The push of the button releases the dirt with no mess. Everything is easily removable, including the filter, which when rinsed under cold water, removes any dirt. You may have to dump out any dirt after each use because the container is rather small, especially if you vacuum often, but because you can actually see how much dirt has been collected due to it being clear, you know for certain when you have to do it.If I could, I would give this vacuum 4.5 stars simply because I thought it was a little pricey for a vacuum that has no extensions, like a pipe to clean the sofas. I don't care so much for the extensions because I knew it didn't have any before purchasing, but it is a little on the expensive side. Hopefully, I get my money's worth if the vacuum's suction power lasts a really long time.

I just rec'd the pans and omg fell in love right away. Strong, steely, gorgeous and made in the USA. What's not to love? I admit I haven't cooked in them yet. I rarely bake cakes (kept a flimsy aluminum set from Woolworths for years), but these feel and look so great that I imagine they'll be a go-to for lots of stuff. Nice surprise - on turning one over I saw the bottom has a beautiful mirror effect - I wonder if that will last?! If I find they fall short of the 5* rating after cooking in them, I'll do an update.

My last two tfals lasted nearly 16 years, the last few years I did put them in dishwasher.  The outside laminate (probly powder coating) then deteriorated quickly.  Inside of old pot stayed intact.  This 3quart saucepan is great size.  Lid does leak steam a little around the circular edge when I boiled eggs.
I gave this as a gift.  I did not use it but they say it worked as expected. Arrived on time.

We love these sheets. If you appreciate 100% cotton, these are probably for you. They fit our deep-pocket King nicely, they've held up well for 4 months now, no pilling, and they have that lovely cool cotton feeling.If you like the silky feeling of synthetics, you probably won't like these sheets. They are crisp.

I brew a lot of loose-leaf tea but usually don't drink more than a cup at a time. It gets tedious getting out the pot and strainer for a single serving each time in order to make sure my tea is hot. This product is perfect for letting me brew a large pot at once (so clean up only once) and keeps the tea hot the whole day from sunup to sundown. It doesn't really keep it hot the full 24 hours it claims - after 24 hours, the liquid is barely better than room temp, but more often than not, the tea has run out by then. It definitely keeps it a nicely hot for at least 12 hours, which is usually the max a container full of tea will last for me. I don't have any problems with leaking or drip down the sides after pouring, but water does tend to condense under the cap when it's screwed on from the heat so that when I unscrew the cap, I get a bit of trickle down the sides I need to wipe up. Still very happy with performance and look of product. Use it nearly everyday.

When I received this thermos, I put in some very hot tap water and let it sit overnight,  The next morning I was surprised and pleased that the water was still very warm enough to drink had it been coffee or tea.  OK - the next thing was filling it with hot tea to take with me.  I drank the tea about 6 hours later and it was still the right temp as I like my hot drinks hot.  The next time I put boiling water into it prior to filling up with the tea ... 6 hours later it was even hotter than the first time.  So I am a happy camper.I haven't had it long enough to have peeling problems like other have had, so I can't comment on that.  It is a nice size (2 cups) and it fits into my purse or tote.  I have also used it for water - using already ice cold water.  Again, no problem 5-6 hours later as I like my cold water cold, not lukewarm.  I mainly use it for my hot tea as I am not a coffee drinker, but I'm sure the results would be exactly the same.It has a sleek look and I love the cranberry color, but the main thing is that it keeps my tea hot and not lukewarm.  I'm sure that it would stay hot longer than 5-6 hours, but I haven't tried that yet.I am very satisfied with this thermos and wouldn't hesitate to purchase it or recommend it.
Dressy looking yet functional.  Good product!  We have this in a bathroom at a business and customers have also commented on the design.  We are very happy with this.

I've had this baby for over 3 years now.  It still peels great and I have yet to replace the blade.  The grip is comfortable and you don't have a chance to nick yourself with this one, since it's laid out just like a razor.  I'm getting one for my parents.

I've been using it to grind milk thistle seeds and it works very well.There's instruction line inside to indicate how much beans are filling in. As well as a easy clean little brush which is built right in the bottle surface. A little push would set the brush free for use. I also like the fact that I don't have to physically be there while it's grinding the beans. I can set the machine and do any other things. Also, the power cord can be store and hidden in the bottom of the machine. All I need to do is to pull up the machine and the power cord area appears.I think this grinder is very smartly designed, best utilized space and function. This unit is also very easy for cleaning. Overall, I'm pleased with this grinder and would recommend.

This is the best opener I've ever had ~ & I've tried many different styles over the years.I'm impressed with it's working ability and easy to use no-non-sense style.The opener is a well made all steel basic design that should last a life time.I've been using the same one now for around 15 years ~I can't imagine it ever wearing out or breaking.The gripping area opens to 4 1/8'" and doesn't take a lot of strength to hold a lid strongly.If your strong enough to hold the item and twist the openeryou'll be able to open most lids with this opener.Occasionally ~ maybe once a year I run into something I'm not strong enough to twist open.That's when I get out my Black & Decker Lids Off ~ it's never failed me yet.But I keep it put away because of it's size ~ 9 1/2" tall X 8 1/2" wide ~it takes up to much counter space.One the other hand ~ this handy opener takes up very little room in a drawer.

There's no guessing with this toaster oven. I debated toaster v. toaster oven when my 4 slice toaster decided to quit. I didn't want to sacrifice counter space for inadequate toasting, but my daughter really wanted the convenience of a toast oven.I actually purchased a much less expensive toaster oven and returned it to the store because it was just horrible. I read the reviews for this model and decided to take the plunge. You get what you pay for. We have a wide variety of preferences for toasting in my kitchen and this toaster oven has not disappointed us once. It's easy to use and straight forward. The dials are clearly marked and the toasting settings are easy to figure out...so there's no guessing. I love that a timer displays to let you know how long until your toast is done. There are also an additional settings/buttons if your item is frozen or if it's a bagel.I've also used the oven setting to reheat items. Very satisfied with that as well. There are three rack positions for broiling, toasting and baking. It's a well built kitchen appliance and I don't regret rearranging my counter to accommodate the toaster oven.
Does everything a shower curtain should keeps the water in the tub and not the floor. Bonus! It has a really pretty tree on it!

These get the job done, but one arrived with a crack in it that I think was due to the vent holes still having plastic in them.  Seems like a bad molding process or bad quality control.  I had to use a knife to cut the plastic out of about 1/3 of the holes on both of them.  They would have worked without doing that, but the holes are meant to be open.  I use them all the time as they help prevent splatter and are easy to clean.  So I'm glad to have them, but probably should have just bought them locally.
summary: Functional, but not the greatest quality

reviewText: Our carpets had not been cleaned in six years.  They were absolutely filthy.  In fact, I was about to rip them up and live on the bare concrete floor - that's how bad they truly were.  I thought they were hopeless because we had used the Rug Doctor machine on them a couple of times and it had not done much good.Enter the Hoover SteamVac with Clean Surge!  Using the Hoover Deep Cleansing shampoo, I began to use the SteamVac exactly as prescribed in the user manual.  Two wet strokes (one forward, one backward - SLOWLY), and two dry strokes (same thing, but without holding the shampoo trigger), I was astonished to watch my carpets become cleaner and cleaner as I worked my way around the room.  As the user manual suggested, I used double the amount of shampoo because I did not pretreat the spots.  (What was the use?  The entire carpet was black!)The carpet dried very quickly, and as it dried, the color became lighter and brighter.  Where were those horrible black spots that had been on there for years?  GONE!  And our cat's accidents?  Gone as well - with no lingering odor!Even weeks after the first cleaning, there is NO CAT SMELL!!!  That in itself is a miracle.  I cannot believe that we are living in the same house, quite truthfully.  I never imagined that a fairly inexpensive carpet shampooer could do such an incredible job.  I could not be happier.  I am no longer embarrassed to have friends walk in my front door.  In fact, one of my friends asked if we had gotten new carpeting.  She could not believe that this carpet was nearly 15 years old.True, it does require making multiple trips to the sink to fill and dump the filthy water.  Believe me, that's a small price to pay to have my carpets looking so good again!  I am kicking myself for waiting so long to purchase this machine.  I can't imagine anything ever working any better than this does.  I definitely recommend this to all my friends!

I bought this product and the RSVP Shuck Deluxe Corn Stripper because reviews indicated that each were better for different sized ears of corn. Every year, I buy dozens of ears of corn that are frozen as both corn-on-the-cob and kernels. I had been using a knife to remove kernels and this was messy plus many of the kernels were cut rather than removed. I tried the Kuhn Rikon Corn Twister with some of the smaller ears of corn, and it didn't work for me. I just couldn't get it through a whole ear. The RSVP Shuck Deluxe Corn Stripper was much faster and worked for all of the ears of corn whether large or small. I returned the Kuhn Rikon Corn Twister to Amazon.
summary: I didn't find thid product easy to use.

reviewText: I've had mine for a while. Works well.  Only adaptation i have made is to use thick rubber bands (like from around broccoli) to keep the small blue extension nozzle extended, as it tends to collapse during use.  It is also REALLY helpful to purchase an extra filter, so you have one to use, and one to wash and air dry.

It's official. I shouldn't ever need a colander larger than this. But I've been glad I got this. Cooking some dishes in my new 5 quart saute pan has made this a necessity for decanting the results into bowls for storage in the fridge sans liquid content.I used to be sloppy trying to use much smaller colanders but no more. You need one of this size. Quality is excellent. I like OXO products. They keep getting high recommendations and I can see why now.Recommended.

I purchased this little machine because of its compactness, good reviews and to clean a major mess on the carpet after my son got sick on the floor after being unable to get to the bathroom quick enough. Set up was super easy and I started cleaning the floor within minutes after un-boxing everything. I pretreated the stain as recommended and came back to start the cleaning. Let me tell you this little machine is powerful and sure cleaned up that stain. It left my carpet fresh smelling again. I also pretreated a stain that had been on the carpet a while and I was just thrilled when the Bissell was able to clean that stain too. I am very pleased with my purchase.
summary: Little Green is Big on Clean!

reviewText: Put this on my memory foam/regular foam discount mattress. Really helps it to be a bit more comfortable so that you don't feel the hard foam underneath the memory foam as much.
I already owned this wine opener and bought the new one as a gift.  So easy to use.  Works great.  I have had it almost a year now and love love love it.

It does what it says.  I will say that many people here said it was hard to clean up.  No way.  Very easy.  Even after my potatoes burnt, I soaked it for a little while and it came right off.I did learn one thing.  It is very important to oil it before you use it.  I did not do that the first time.  The potatoes stuck.  The second time, I sprayed some EVOO on it before putting it on the grill and then dumped the veggies into it and it cooked great.

I had taken the three previous courses offered by Wilton but this course wasn't offered, so I took matters into my own hands and purchased the course kit and this book.  It's great to have a reference book handy whenever I need it!

The inverter feature is nice. I don't hear the microwave power up and down like my old oven. The sensor cooking is very useful. I'm using it 90% of the time. With the color LCD touch screen panels getting so cheap. One would think someone would have come out with one on a microwave by now. It would have been nice to select the cooking menu by plain words instead of looking it up in the user's manual.I read some people are complaining the light doesn't come on when the door is opened. That's actually a nice feature. I leave the door open after cooking to let the moistures out and don't have to worry about the ligh being on.There were minor problems. I don't know if it's just mine or on most of the units? The back panel vibrates when on and makes a loud noise. I had to put cardboard between the seam to quiet it down. I wish they would use any color other than blue for the LED. Blue is the worst color light for human eyes to focus on.Overall it's a nice oven and hope it lasts.
This heavy marble spice grinder is great for crushing pills, grinding herbs and such.  I use it regularly in cooking.

Although this opener may look modern and appear to be one that will deliver SMOOTH edges on cans..... IT DOES NOT.The can tops are not smooth at all and the lids have brutally sharp edges that could send you to the Emergency Room.I am extremely disappointed in this unit.Do Not purchase.It is a piece of junk.
Love it! It reheats food I have purchased that is already cooked and does not change the texture. It is easy to use, versatile and dinner is ready quickly.

We accidentally damaged a plastic part to our JE900 and ordered a replacement. The order process is cumbersome (their 800 number is a voicemail drop, and you wait for a callback ... sometime). When the part finally arrived, it was the WRONG part. The invoice showed they shipped the correct part, but it doesn't fit the JE900. We're still waiting a call back on this. I'm betting our JE900 will wind up in the junk pile, since we wouldn't buy another one given this experience.
summary: juices fine, but wait until you need to order parts!

reviewText: Bought these for my son as  gift and he has told me that they are thick and absorbent. He has no complaints about them.

Great for kids. Wide flat bottom allowing enough space for a meal (rice, veggies and chicken for example) and high rim so they don't spill the food as they scoop it to the spoon. I was so happy to switch to these from the plastic dinnerware they had! And the plates are lightweight and break resistant. Couldn't love it more!Of course awesome for pasta as well.

I had been wanting to try this product ever since I first saw it advertised a few months ago.  I usually stock up on La Croix sodas from Costco.  However, recycling all those cans seems wasteful.  So, I used my 20% coupon at Bed, Bath & Beyond and bought the Genesis SodaStream.I LOVE IT! It's so simple to use. It takes up almost no space on the counter (but I have a small kitchen, so I moved my rarely used blender to a closet). The bottles are supposed to last a few years, so although they are not as environmentally friendly as glass, they still have a 3 year lifespan.I'm not interested in all the commercial flavors available for purchase.  I like plain carbonated (filtered) water from my tap which we sometimes flavor with freshly squeezed lemons or limes.This is a great product, I only wish I had purchased it years ago. I'm so happy that I am no longer wasting all those aluminum cans.

I had a set of these at home & I find them very handy.  I needed some for my son in school so he could air dry some articles of sport clothing (UA & other compression  items) that shouldn't go in a dryer.  I could NOT find these hooks anywhere!  Not supermarket, hardware, KMart, B,B & B--nowhere!  God bless Amazon!

I bought these because I hate metal shower curtain rings. These are quiet and look nice. I do prefer the way metal looks, but I hate the noise it makes, how it rusts, and how you have to bend it to secure and unsecure them. Not to mention they are sharp... no tetanus for me, thanks.I would repurchase this product.
summary: Quiet, no rust, snaps shut securely.

reviewText: Not much to say about this simple sponge holder except that it does exactly what it should perfectly. I do love that it's small - just a little smaller than my sponges. So it fits nicely beside the faucet, keeps the sponges out of the bottom of the sink where they always seek to end up. I like it better than the ones that stick to the side of the sink because my sink is rather small and shallow and the other kind takes up to much usable room. I recommend this wholeheartedly. :)
summary: Does what it's supposed to - Hurray!

reviewText: This is a great product.  Best feature is the rotating suction cup attachment arm thing (my previous shower caddy's suction cup straddled one of the wall tiles and never achieved good suction).  This unit stays put very nicely and the adjustable shelf height AND horizontal position is a major plus!
Works great for the most part.  Very practical if you use garlic in a lot of your recipes and doesn't take up too much space.
summary: Works great for the most part

reviewText: Very sharp, but not spot- and rust-free, even though they state they are stainless. We have had them for three weeks now, and they look a bit spotty. My hubby wanted to send them back (doesn't like spots), but I like the sharp edges, and I don't care about the spots. Ginsu knives are much sharper than Farberware! Woo-hoo!
summary: Excellent value, sharp! but not rust-free.

reviewText: These are exactly what I was looking for - a washable terry bath mat like the kind you find in hotels. They are smaller than a bath towel, and of a similar weight, but are still generously sized for a bath mat. I have washed them a half dozen times, and so far they are holding up very well. At $9 each, you can't beat the price! A good buy.
summary: Hotel quality terry tub mats - very nice for the price!

reviewText: My husband doesn't like nuts except for English walnuts that he breaks open and eats in the winter.  He was using a sturdy ladle of mine to break open the nuts and I decided he needed a proper nutcracker (my ladle was starting to crack!).  After reading the reviews at Amazon, I chose this one because it seemed to be the one that didn't cost a small fortune that works well.And, it has performed well for my husband.  It breaks open the nuts without pulverizing the meat inside.  He likes it and told me to recommend it.
This wasn't bad for the price I paid! The color will fade no matter what so expect that. Softens with use and proper care.
It works great and the wife loves them. They are easy to clean and very very comfortable in the hand when using it.
summary: works great lasts a long time.

reviewText: Works well and is easy to see. I like that "the  zone" id highlighted in red (for refrigerator use).  The hanger seems to be designed for refrigerators that have metal wire racks as you can't hang it from the glass shelves that I have.
The brush head is soft and yet it is strong, has worked really well so far in cleaning out the grinder
summary: Great Brush for cleaning the grinder

reviewText: Three nights into useing the buckwheat pillow and I can say my experience is good. It is different than using a standard pillow, much more firm (but then it would be), but that is what I like about it. I tend to wear out pillows quickly so thought I would give this style a try. I cannot smell any scent from the buckwheat hulls and I do not find them to be loud/noisy once you are settled on the pillow. The size is fine for me, I do not require a huge pillow - really how much space on the pillow do you need? Buckwheat pillows do not need to be folded or puffed to be used night after night, unlike a feather pillow which tends to need to be bunched after a while.So far I would recommend this pillow, it takes a few nights to get used to though. Once would not call it soft....but it is not a brick either.

Out of the box, I loved this vacuum. It has powerful suction and I can't believe how much dust and dirt it picked up.Here are my petty gripes:- The only way to hang the cord was if you wrap it up properly. I haven't done that in years. Who has time to carefully loop the cord around the top and bottom brackets? I just want to throw it over a top bracket and be done, but you can't do that here - the bracket is too small to do it like that.- The on/off button is in an awkward place.- You have to flip a switch to go between hose and vacuum. It's really easy to forget to do this. I will often complete my vacuuming and then realize I've forgotten to switch it back.Here's why I am returning the vacuum to the store:I have never owned a vacuum that required this much maintenance and cleaning. According to the product maintenance tab on this page, after each use you are supposed to empty the canister and then clean the filters. doing this, took us 15 minutes and made a dusty mess of the air and our hands. Who wants to play in the grime that you just vacuumed up and get the dust all over the place?My home is just under 1700 sq. feet and I have no pets. The largest area of my home is wood and tile floors so I only have about 1000 sq. foot of carpeting. I can get about 2 vacuums out of it before I have to do the whole filter cleaning routine. If I vacuum three times, there is a noticeable lack of suction.On top of the filter cleaning hassle, you are supposed to replace several of the filters every 3-6 months. This is where they get you. It's almost $40 to do this.This vacuum may be inexpensive to buy, but it's not worth the cost and hassle to maintain.
summary: I am returning it to the store

reviewText: I read all of the reviews before I placed my order, so I knew what I was getting into.  This is a good solution for my needs (inside a closet in my kitchen to use as pantry storage).  I did bolt it into the door vs. using the over the door hooks b/c it is in 2 pieces and would swing wildly if you just did over the door, plus the baskets don't go up in the back so as it swung, stuff would fall out.  Again, I knew all of that going into this purchase, so I planned to bolt it to the door.  Once bolted, it works great!  I was pleasantly surprised that the baskets are wider than I expected and can hold larger items than I planned to store.  It's working out well for me and is seeming to hold up well - I have it loaded down with cans and containers of bulk foods.

Nice wood and easy to put together.  We would give it a 5, but one of the draws had a problem with the wood panels.  We worked around it and everything looks and works great.  The stools are strong and really sharp looking.

This sturdy stainless steel workstation is strong and easy to clean once set up.  It was well packaged.  I did find it somewhat difficult to slide the shelves over the adjoining plastic clips, as they didn't clip together tightly, so they would separate and slide down.  The wheels can lock, or not, and they move easily.  The shelf height can be adjusted.  Quality control seemed to be doing its job; thankfully everything fit.
very sharp looking much better than Depot. they roll so easy and being stainless steel they should last the rest of my life

I have went through every can crusher on the market. The metal ones bend and once they bend are pretty much trash. Another metal one I had the base would turn a little and drive into the side walls and any fluid dried in the mechanism and further complicated things. I now have two of these. The best part of this is the extra long handle and the pivoting base. When you pull down the base pivots forward and when you pull back the crushed can on the based that is turned and allows the can to fall out without having to pull it out. Put a trash can under it and they fall in. I put mine in a stairwell to the basement and put a hole though the step that has a large plastic pipe through it just under the base. They fall in the pipe and into the basement where a can is waiting out of site. I know other reviewers were afraid of this being plastic. Although I do not use either of these in the cold where plastic could become brittle I think this would hold up good provided you only crush aluminum cans.

I wish I was happier with this, because I like all of the other OXO products I have used.  Unfortunately, it doesn't get any kind of a seal, so the hair just washes right under it and clogs up the drain like it did before we got this.

I treated myself to this new coffee maker when I learned of the design upgrades that Cuisinart has made over the years.  My old Cuisinart model made excellent coffee, and was still going strong after ten years, but as a lot of people know, water condensed on the lid of these older models, and when the lid was opened it would dribbled down the back.  I put a towel down to collect the drips, but after ten years I decided to replace the unit.I'm glad I did.This is the same high-quality coffee maker as my old one, but now the condensed water on the lid has a place to go, and the other new/improved features are nice too.  I love the large 14-cup capacity when needed.  I also love how classy this coffee maker looks on my kitchen counter.  But more important than just about anything, the water heats to the right temperature for proper brewing - mine measures 200 degrees at the shower head - and the resulting coffee in the carafe is HOT.I use freshly roasted whole beans, weigh them whole (9-11 g/per 6-oz water - aka the "Golden Ratio"), and then grind them in a burr grinder right before brewing the coffee.  I adjust the size of the grind to make sure that every pot of coffee, regardless of the size, meets the coffee geeks' "eight-minute rule" for drip coffee - and that rule is that hot water never spends more than eight minutes on/dripping through the ground coffee.  Any time less than six minutes and flavor is left behind, and any time more than eight minutes will over-extract and dissolve unwanted flavor compounds that render the coffee bitter.  It takes some testing to calibrate the grind size to the amount of water to ensure the eight-minute rule (more water the bigger the particle size and vice versa) but it's well worth the effort.  With the application of this simple science - and using a burr, NOT a blade grinder - you'll get all the flavor the so-called high-tech automatic drip makers promise to deliver, but at a fraction of the cost.  You don't need a Technivorm or a Bonavita to do this.
I recommend this to anyone looking for quality baking pans... I have used these for everything and they clean up pretty well, don't warp, and are a must-need in every kitchen. Great price as well!

A few years ago I bought a little cheap waffle maker from Home Depot during a Black Friday Sale for about $25. After 2 uses, we got rid of it - horrible to clean and the waffles weren't that good. We knew we wanted another waffle maker, but there were a million choices and they were fairly expensive, so we put it off. Finally, I decided to get my partner one for her birthday because she was always talking about wanting to make them at home.I am a research queen, and after doing extensive searching, I decided on this one. I am so glad I did, and it is beyond worth the money.Ease of use: I pretty much hate cooking, and I can (and like) using this machine! You simply plug it in, wait a few minutes, and it's ready to go. After putting the batter in, you close and twist, and leave it for a few minutes. This leaves time to finish doing the dishes, or making the bacon, while not having to worry. I've found that I perfer to leave my waffle in there another 1-2 minutes after the beep, for a more crispier texture. When it's done, the waffle just comes right out - you can use your fingers or a fork and it just lifts right not - NO STICKING!Clean-up: It comes with a drip pan, which is a nice bonus, but we hardly ever need it. We might spill a bit over after the first pour, but after that we get used to it and the batter stays inside like it's supposed to. After we are done and it cools off, we just wipe the inside down with a little soapy water, but we actually don't see any residue or dirt - the waffle really comes out that smoothly.Design: Yes, it's a big big, but not as big as some. The handle folding in was worth the extra bit of money. It cleans well and there are very few buttons, so it's super simple.We are super happy with this purchase, and would not hesitate to buy it again!
summary: Breakfast will never be the same!

reviewText: My husband wanted an apron, so I went looking. When I saw this apron, knew I had found the perfect one! Love the saying on it; nice weight; adjustable ribbon so will fit almost anyone. I like the fact it is dark colored so splashes don't show quite so much. Also, easy to clean - just remember to tie the ribbons together (or clip them together) when putting it into the washer!Recommend it to anyone who thinks their guys might like to feel like they are legends! :)

Had to stop using it because it was too dark to use while showering.  Looks nice but it's just too dark in actual use. I guess if we had a light or skylight directly over the shower, this would be ok.
summary: Too dark to use in our shower

reviewText: This is one of the best hand held vac's ever.  I use a dyson for main carpet and this for all the small jobs.  I love this vacuum.

I purchased this because when cooking meat I was always worried that it was done enough and tended to overcook it.I must say I am very happy with this purchase.It came with great instructions and was very easy to use.The holder is very handy. It works extremely well,my meat is now juicy and cooked to perfection!
Not much to say, it's true to its description and very reasonably priced.  Exactly what I was looking for to organize items on my closet shelves.
summary: Exactly what I wanted for the right price

reviewText: Good bright colors, well made, seems like it will hold up.  We are using it as a desk pad instead of a table placement.  The optical mouse could not function over it (too shiny?) but it works well to protect the desk when writing.
This is a great stool. I use it in the kitchen every day. We liked it so much that we bought another one for my wife's dog grooming business.

This is one of those rare products that exceeds your expectations! I do a fair bit of travel by car and I love hot coffee, tea and even lattes. I have a Nespresso machine and lately have been making my own lattes at home as opposed to going to Starbucks every morning (more than once a day sometimes!) With my Nespresso I can make just as good - if not better - a latte than I get at Starbucks for less than half the cost. The problem is how to carry an extra large coffee, tea or latte with me to work or on the road. Normal mugs hold about 16oz (grande in starbucks speak) and thermos makes a great 16oz in this same line. This product holds 24oz of any liquid and keeps it hot for about 4-5 hours. (at least for me).Pros:Sturdy, metal container, very well made. Sleek appearance, looks great! Love the midnight metallic blue.The screw on & flip top cap is one of the best I have seen. Easy to clean, doesn't need to be taken apart, etc.. just wash / scrub it with a brush or sponge. it's spring loaded & has a little metal retainer that you can snap shut for extra holding power. When you want a drink, you just press the button - the lid pops back (and stays back) and you take a sip from the well designed cap.I think the thermos holds a little more than 24oz which allows you to have a true 3 cups with a little room so you don't have to worry about overfilling. As long as you don't overfill, it's absolutely leakproof. I have inverted it, shaken it, and toss it in the air - no leaks. If you do overfill, the amount that you overfill will flood the cap and that can leak - so just to be clear - don't overfill.Cons:It's a little heavy but it's metal so what do you expect?While it says it keeps hot drinks hot for 12 hours, I found my coffee just "very warm" after 5 hours but I had ben drinking from it off and on a lot, and leaving the flip top back. Maybe 12 hours is only if you seal it & don't open at all. But really, 5 hours is plenty for me.I haven't tested for cold drinks, I really don't need to worry about keeping something cold.. maybe when the summer rolls in I will.
summary: Exceptional thermos for hot coffee or whatever you want!

reviewText: This scale seems to be accurate and is a good basic scale. Also it is a nicer looking scale with the black plastic and stainless steel plated top and buttons.  The buttons and screen are large, which is helpful.  I do however have a couple reservations about fully recommending this item.  It is light weight, which some people may love, but not me.  Also the one i received wobbles from the front left "leg" to the back right one.I do however very much recommend this company, as their customer service is fantastic!
summary: Great customer service and good basic scale.

reviewText: These were a lot of fun at our last Halloween party. Good quality and very easy to apply right over the top of an existing bottle label.
summary: These were a lot of fun at our last Halloween party

reviewText: We are hooked.  We have insulated travel mugs that do the same thing, but wanted this one to have around the house.  It is well built, easy to clean and use.  Make the investment of GOOD coffee to use with it and you won't be disappointed!

This adds a soft, dreamy look to my daughter's bed.  It's really cute and she loves it, especially the glow in the dark butterflies.  It's a true pink color, not hot pink but it's noticeably pink, the picture shows it as a very soft pink.  The butterflies are a good size, about 2 inches square, and made of hard plastic that seems durable.  I like this as an added measure against my daughter getting bitten when she sleeps, she has allergies and sometimes she's woken up with a few bug bites here and there, despite no other evidence of the little critters.The price and the quality (and the shipping speed!) make this 5 stars.  A great way to add a romantic princess look without spending a fortune :)
Very cute and well made.  I've dropped it several times and it hasn't cracked.  It made my mother a very happy cook and it matched her kitchen perfectly!

I've had this scale for a few years now and it's still going strong. Some pros: it is lightweight, seems to be accurate, and the battery has lasted a long time. Cons: the platform isn't wide enough for many of my bowls, and the automatic 2-minute shutoff is a problem when I am cutting/prepping something and using the tare function--sometimes it takes me longer than two minutes between adding to the bowl, then I have to empty it and start all over again because the scale shut off and cleared the tare. I will probably upgrade in the future, but this price is hard to beat!

I got this from Ideeli.  This is my favorite piece of cookware.I did not have any problems with the construction or loose handles.The griddle fits on my stove front-to-back.  It's nice because it allows me to use the other side of the stove without worrying about reaching over a hot griddle to tend to other items I'm cooking.  The griddle does heat evenly. I usually keep both burners at the same temperature setting and I preheat the griddle before cooking on it.The griddle stays put once it's on the burners.  On one occasion I tried to move it. I missed touching the coated part of the handle, touched the metal side of the handle instead and got burned.  Just watch out and pay attention when moving the griddle once it's heated.I've only hand washed this. No problems.  Food doesn't stick to the cooking surface at all so it only takes seconds to clean.Overall a great product.  It makes cooking for my family of 5 so much easier. It is my go-to cooking item.I would recommend this to others.
It does its job. It's pretty loud and you have to make sure the sensor is facing you or the remote won't work. Would recommend for the price.

I bought one of these and cut it in half to use in front of my sink and stove.  Almost everyone who is a guest and finds themselves cooking or washing dishes comments on the comfort of standing on them with or without shoes.  I don't have a use for another one but would definitely buy again if these were damaged somehow.
summary: Great affordable anti-fatigue matt for in front of stove or sink

reviewText: OPEN IT UP, CLOSE IT WITH THE KNOB ON TOP OF THE CAN, TURN IT EASILY, AND OFF COMES THE ENTIRE TOP WITH NO LITTLE PIECES OF TIN FALLING INTO THE CAN. - Takes a little getting use to.
summary: SUPER EASY FOR LEFT HANDED PERSON

reviewText: We are exceptionally pleased with the functionality and overall quality of this grill. We have a 30-inch GE cooktop with standard grates over all 4 burners. If you try to center the griddle on the burner grates, it will wobble. But, move it about one-inch either forward or back and it will settle into a stabe and workable position while still covering the burner units adequately. We used our griddle about 10 of the first 14 days we had it, and tried it for every kind of meal we would have expected to use it for. When the griddle was warmed-up slowly, everything cooked to perfection. On first use, we noticed some of the eggs were sticking so we added a little more effort to the seasonong process. After that, no problem. Based on our experience, we suggest that negative comments on this product be disregarded.
It was too big, took the whole sink, not part of it, so I sent it back.  The company was great, refunded me.  The product was well made, just not sized for my needs.  Good vendor tho.

If you are canning, it will really make your life easier to have a lid lifter.  I bought this one because it also had a bubble remover.  This lid lifter worked well for both removing bubbles and lid lifting.  This feels fairly sturdy and well made and it is reasonably priced.
summary: well made and does the trick

reviewText: I own Calphalon pots and pans so I thought I would expand into the bakeware and replace my rusting pans.  These are gorgeous and work very well.  So far I have used the muffin pan and the 9x13 - no stains, no scrubbing, no hassle.  Nonstick as promised!

I love making gnocchi and mashed potatoes.  A potato ricer makes both of these things better and easier, so I spent a long time researching and sifting through the potato ricers available on Amazon.  Most of the ones I found had small capacities and a good amount of negative reviews.  When I found this ricer, I loved the size but worried about the price (twice as much as most of the others found on Amazon).  I took the plunge and couldn't be happier.  This ricer can hold about two whole potatoes at a time and makes quick work of a whole pot of potatoes.  There is a pot/bowl rest to help steady the ricer while you work.  Since the ricer has such a large capacity, it takes a good amount of muscle to push the potatoes through but it does a great job.  This ricer is made of stainless steel, and cleaning the ricer is extremely easy.  It is dishwasher safe, but it cleans up by hand quickly too.  This ricer is much larger than other options, but it fits easily into my pot drawer.

I love a stiff but smooth Martini at the end of the day.  I take them like Mr. Bond, shaken, not stirred.  I have been drinking Vesper Martini's the most lately.  The glasses are very nice and subtly different than traditional.  They have good weight and have good hand feel.  They clean up easily in the dishwasher just be careful when drying them as the rim is a little fragile.  Over all very happy with purchase!

Within 3 weeks was leaking all over my kitchen.The milk system is really smart . . . but it ends up being messy and hard to clean out.  and at times makes really watery steamed milk.  I returned this and got a illy capsule machine and am much happier

For the most part, this works pretty well. I will explain the pros and cons of this juicer/press, as well as how it stacks up against the Jack Lalanne Power Juicer, and against the Vitamix.A quick overview, is that this juicer does a good job with all but the hardest vegees, and all but the softest fruits, like bananas (unless you want to make sorbet). The cleanup is not really that bad, especially if you're used to cleaning the mesh screens of other juicers. Mesh screens do not clean easily, but after some practice you develop a knack for it.Before I get into the pros and cons, I will say that this makes pulpy juice and juicy pulp. To some, that may be a negative thing. But I love to eat the wet pulp, it taste like an indulgent treat to me. And I've always liked my juice with pulp in it. Basically, the machine does a good (but not great) job of separating pulp and juice. If you're going to throw away your pulp, you'd be wasting a lot of good stuff!Ok, first I'll give detailed info on the cons:The literature claims this will do carrots, but by the time you get a miniscule amount of juice after cleaning and cutting your carrot up into small pieces, and running the machine forward, then backward several times to free up jams, you probably could've eaten three carrots. This definitely falls way short of both my Power Juicer and my Vitamix. My Power Juicer will juice five pounds of carrots in the time it took me to juice a single carrot in this thing. And my Vitamix of course will pulverize carrots in no time. So for carrots I will stick with one of those two machines, depending upon whether I want just the juice (Power Juicer) or the juice with pulp (Vitamix).I have two other cons, but they are fairly minor complaints. First, the clear container that houses the yellow trimmed mesh basket is not designed to my liking. You have to let it air dry, as the bottom has a semi closed in area that cannot be accessed for drying purposes. This means I have to let it sit our for a long time before putting it away, as I do not like damp crevices to sit where mold and/or bacteria can build up. I can see no other way to design it though, to allow pulp and juice to have separate exit points. My last issue is with the weight of the unit. The base alone is 12 lbs, and the handle is not very ergonomic for carrying. When you pick it up by the handle the weight of it makes the whole thing want to topple forward. It definitely takes two hands to carry it. But maybe the weight of the unit speaks for it's sturdiness. So no star taken away for that really, it's just a minor inconvenience.Ok, now for the pros:First, it's surprisingly quiet, I can hold a conversation in a normal tone of voice while this is running. I love this juicer for the things my Power Juicer doesn't do well. I'm mainly talking about softer fruits like citrus and kiwis, this does a bang up job on those. And the pulp is really tasty too (especially on the kiwis). Also, I am pleasantly surprised that I have not gotten any jams at all in the pulp chute, which surprised me considering it's small size. I LOVE the fact that you can make frozen sorbet with soft frozen fruits like bananas (That's the only way you can do bananas in this machine). As far as juice extraction, it's not as good as my Power juicer, but fairly close. But as as I said, I do enjoy eating the wet pulp. (You need to core your apples first if you don't want to eat seedy pulp).Here are some of my yields:One 12 oz bag of cranberries and one medium grapefruit yielded 14 oz. juice. Add one packet of stevia, and this is really yummy!On another batch, I used 1.5 lb red grapes, 3 apples, and 2 kiwis. It filled the entire 32 oz container to the top.Of all the things I like about this juicer, I would have to say my favorite is the way it does apples. I did not have any problems at all with the apples getting a little jammed, as other uses have experienced. As far as the apple juice goes, since this is a 'press', not a centrifugal juicer, it makes the apple juice taste a little thicker and richer than what I'm used to with my power juicer. I love that because it reminds me of some of the farm stands where I grew up in the midwest where we could get fresh cider each fall! I can't wait to heat some this evening and add a little cinnamon to it!All in all, I like this juice press. If I had to pick only one of my machines to keep (between this, my power juicer, and my vitamix), it would be my Vitamix because it's more versatile and can literally handle Everything I put into it. Nonetheless, this is a decent machine. I did receive it free in exchange for my honest review, so I feel it's only fair to add that I think the price is a little high. I would not pay $199 for it.
summary: Great for Apples, Useless for Carrots

reviewText: Very nice knives, lightweight (but sturdy), sharp and they make an impressive statement at the table. Would definitely recommend.Great price,too.

I have the large Tassimo at home and wanted one for the office, but not as big.  This is the perfect fit, not too big and great tasting coffee at my fingertips without paying2-3 dollars at the coffee shop.  Plus, I love ot experiment with the different discs and flavors to get a variety.  I love the Tassimo.

I've had these stools for over a year. They came assembled nothing to do but open the box. They've been GREAT. Look wonderful, perfect height for my counter and very sturdy. I definitely would recommend these as in terms of price they can't be beat.
Excellent quality, lid seals and protects contents well. Perfect for snacks, treats, baking supplies, or any other thing kitchen goodies.

I own two rice cookers.  One is a fuzzy logic 5.5 cup Panasonic that works very well.  I also wanted an On/Off/Warm larger (8-cup) rice cooker so I could make the recipes from the Cajun rice cooker cookbook.  I can highly recommend this Aroma rice cooker, it does everything you'd want it to and for a great price!  Also comes with a nice plastic vegetable steamer tray.
summary: This is a fine rice cooker!

reviewText: I got this for a "three-season" room in my house that has several windows, isn't well insulated and is not hooked into the home's heating system. I use the room as my art studio. This heater keeps it warm. I like its automatic shut off feature. I can set the heater to a temp I want, and leave it to do its business knowing it will turn off on its own. This really is a benefit to having to shut it off if I leave the room for more than an hour.
summary: Works well for a small room

reviewText: Was a gift to a family member who suffers very much with leg pain.  I hoped to bring her comfort, but was told that the heat element was just okay.  Not too discourage buying it - it may be as well as another and perhaps I (or she) do not know enough about electric blankets.  But this came out a bit mediocre so it is not widely used.  It's probably a beautiful thing to throw over chilly legs on a cold night with a cup of hot tea on the coffee table. :)  I got it alleviate chronic leg pain using the heat element and it was no so effective in that regard.  Hope that helps.
